story:
مرحبا .. اسمي سليمان نعمت موسى ... عمري 22 عاما .. النظر في التبريد وتكييف الهواء الهندسة ..

أنا من دولة فلسطين .. أنا أعيش في قطاع غزة المحاصر ..

درست في الكلية، والآن أنا تركت دراستي لأن عائلتي فقيرة، وأنا لا يمكن أن تدفع المال للجامعة

ليس لدي عمل

أحلم لإنهاء دراستي والدراسات العليا

أرجو أن تساعدني

شكرا
story_txt: مرحبا .. اسمي سليمان نعمت موسى ... عمري 22 عاما .. النظر في التبريد وتكييف الهواء الهندسة ..أنا من دولة فلسطين .. أنا أعيش في قطاع غزة المحاصر ..درست في الكلية، والآن أنا تركت دراستي لأن عائلتي فقيرة، وأنا لا يمكن أن تدفع المال للجامعةليس لدي عملأحلم لإنهاء دراستي والدراسات العلياأرجو أن تساعدنيشكرا

story:
This is an official RELAUNCHING of our previous campaign. We raised $590 of our $1975 goal. If we can meet half of our goal this time around, the rest will be matched! This is an amazing opportunity for our future students and for the future in general as these students will no doubt change the world with their collective insights. Help us make it happen!!!

The Superhero Children Project uses science, philosophy and meditation to teach self-awareness and inner-voice to children ages 7-15... and it works! After 3 wildly successful semesters at HISD's Garden Oaks Elementary we are ready to expand. This means we need to train teachers and cover teaching and marketing expenses. This means we need funding and to receive proper funding we need to be an established nonprofit with a tax exempt status. 

The mission of the project is to provide the Superhero Children Program to students free of charge and then to connect the graduated students in a local social network (think of this as a life-long networking of heart-centered future decision makers.) We will start locally, then regionally, then nationally and, within 7 years, we will expand globally to teach as many children as we possibly can to love and celebrate their truest selves, to follow their hearts and to make decisions based on what feels right for them. This is, in essence, our giving back to politics and to innovation. We will teach as many of our future leaders as we can to follow their hearts and love themselves. Imagine politicians doing this? It's like a social art experiment. What will come of a generation of self-love? And what can they accomplish together? I want to know. Don't you?

Please help cover the expense of getting the Superhero Children Project established as a non-profit so we can FINALLY say YES to the funds available for expanding this incredible project. And, if you want to be an even bigger part of the creation of this project, we will soon be seeking funding to train teachers and offer these classes free of charge to as many children as we can reach! Visit our website to learn more about our 4 step plan for teaching children throughout the world!

To know more about the Superhero Children Project or Alexis Anne Moore, visit:
www.SuperheroChildren.com
www.Soulgarden.tv.

Peace,

Alexis

story:
Indian Hills Nudist Park was opened in 1971 by Gottlieb Kogel, also known as "the professor". He was a successful real estate investor and businessman. He was also a magician, but most importantly, he was a loyal friend to many people. To this day, we still get the pleasure of meeting the occasional 'old-timer' with great stories from the heydays of Indian Hills. The professor passed away in 2010, at the age of 94 (Though many feel he visits his beloved park often).

Today the park is the last nudist campground in Louisiana. It's important to our members and guests to keep the park open. Plus it's important to everyone who cares about freedom, whether you visit our park or not.  Everyone should be able to  enjoy naturism.

There are some improvements needed so the park can continue to thrive by inviting new guests, building the clientele and preserving the professor's dream.

The money will go to renovate the following projects in this order...    
  • Pool and Hot Tub Renovations
  • New Roof and Renovation of our Clubhouse
  • 3 New Rental Cabins

The money raised will be kept in an account separate from the operating account. Renovations and improvements will be paid for directly from that account. Financial records will be available to all contributors.

The value of your contribution will be doubled, as we will be matching all money raised dollar for dollar. We have some great rewards in every price range.

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially right now, but think about these other ways to help...

  • Share your licensed skills to help defer renovation costs, 
  • Share your time building, digging, planting, painting, cleaning...there will be plenty to do.
  • Share our campaign on your social media, tell your friends about it, stand on the corner with a sign...anything you can think of to create a buzz.

Do you have a little extra to give? There are opportunities for interest investors as well. Inquire about our business plan and future improvements.

By making these necessary improvements, we will be able to grow the business and improve Indian Hills. Thank you so very much for helping to Keep Louisiana Naked.

story:
Let's have some fun with history!

TALE OF A CITY is an animated series that will tell the fascinating story of cities around the planet.

The first episode will focus on Boston.

Cities to follow will include New York, Seattle, Atlanta, London, Paris, San Francisco, Rome and more...

Watch Boston Transform!

Maps will morph, engaging characters will narrate and history will be revealed.


BOSTON 1630-1775

MEET our animated characters FEATHERBUTT and RAT and watch as the Boston episode is introduced:


Founded on September 17, 1630, the city is named after Boston, England, a town from which several prominent colonists originated.  Boston would eventually become the "Cradle of Democracy."

FIRE!


The fire started on Lincoln Street on November 9 and in two days destroyed about 65 acres of the city. 776 buildings were destroyed causing $60 million in damage.

FLOOD!


This strange mishap occurred on January 15, 1919. A huge molasses storage tank at the top of a hill exploded. Twenty-one people were killed and 150 injured as hot molasses crushed, asphyxiated, and cooked many of the victims to death.

TRAGEDY!

Boston Marathon

Boston has had its fair share of tragedy.  The Cradle of Liberty proudly regroups and carries on after two terrorist bombs go off during the 2013 Marathon.  Boston Strong becomes the mantra to help the city unite and heal.COMPOSER: Scott Rockenfield

Our Tale of a City composer is Scott Rockenfield, best known as the drummer from the band Queensryche.  However, as a composer Scott is making a name for himself apart from Queensryche. His recent works include scores for films and film trailers for The Matrix, Avatar, The Dark Knight, Star Trek, Spiderman, Prometheus, and soon Tale of a City.  Click to hear some of Scott's work.

With your help we can start with Boston to create the first city of the series. 

Our plan is to approach education distributions companies, The History Channel, PBS... just to name a few and make this fun educational series a reality!!  What city is next???  We will reach out to our supporters to help us make that decision.  Your city could be next!!



We feel education is key to helping children find their voice and strength to be the best they can be!

We are also proud supporters of our Military!!  We have three veteran families on our Tale of a City team and a partnership with the Los Angeles Film School's military department.


Storyteller Original Films LLC Treatment
©2014 WGAw 1677778

All images ©2015 Storyteller Original Films LLC

All rights reserved.

story:
Every child has a unique genius.

At Mainly Mozart, we have see first-hand that music can be a powerful spark in unleashing a child's potential. Research shows that playing a musical instrument inspires self-confidence, creativity and focus. It strengthens the parts of kids’ brains that process math and language skills, and allows for critical thinking.

“Music makes me more confident about myself. I feel like I can actually do something that's worthwhile.” – Aaron, age 9

Our campaign is about giving San Diego kids the chance to unleash their own unique genius through the Mainly Mozart Youth Orchestra (MMYO). We serve all youth, ages 3-23, at all levels and from all backgrounds. We are also the only youth orchestra in the region that actively integrates children with learning disabilities into our core programs. In fact, up to 25% of our Orchestra students have special needs, and some of them are as young as three years old.

HOW IS MMYO CHANGING LIVES?

Here is just one example of the difference that music can make in the life of a child:

When five-year-old Ali, born with Down Syndrome, first began attending Mainly Mozart Youth Orchestra rehearsals, she was shy and quiet; she struggled with her motor skills, and was afraid of interacting with her fellow student musicians.

Despite the challenges she faced, Ali’s mother brought her to rehearsal every Saturday morning, and encouraged her to pick up her violin and play. Surrounded by children of all ages and all abilities, learning the music of Mozart and the Masters, is where Ali’s transformation began.

In June, this child who struggled to make eye contact a few months earlier, performed for an audience of a thousand people at the Balboa Theatre.

These days Ali, who was hesitant with language before coming to MMYO, bursts into rehearsals every week with a “Hi, Miss Jane” for her beloved teacher. And, when the time comes for ensembles to participate in games and activities, Ali now races to be first in line with the other children.

Since joining MMYO, Ali has become fully verbal, has transformed socially, and has even begun to read music.

Your support will make a difference!

  • Two donations of $40 provides an hour of one-on-one coaching to young musicians with special needs such as Autism Spectrum Disorder and Down Syndrome
  • Ten donations of $75 can provide a year-long music scholarship to a family in need
  • ANY amount helps to ensure prestigious performance opportunities year-round for all of our students, including the chance to play at The Balboa Theatre during the Mainly Mozart Festival

WHY SUPPORT THE MAINLY MOZART YOUTH ORCHESTRA?

“I don’t have music at my school.” – Kacie, age 6

With budget cuts and reduced funding for the arts, music education programs in schools have been eliminated, resources for children living in underserved communities have been minimized, and creative outlets for our children have all but disappeared.

The Mainly Mozart Youth Orchestra gives our children what our school system can’t: rigorous musical training by the world’s top musicians, inclusive programs for all ages and abilities, and a focused environment for serious young musicians.

The Mainly Mozart Youth Orchestra needs to raise $15,000 by April 10, 2015 to successfully take us through our second season.

The Perks

$10: A shout out on the Mainly Mozart Facebook page and your name listed in all MMYO programs for the 2015-2016 season

$25: All of the above PLUS an mp3 recording of the February 14th MMYO performance at Lincoln High School

$50: All of the above PLUS a CD of entire November 15th MMYO Advanced Orchestra performance, including performances by Cynthia Phelps and Sheryl Staples of the New York Philharmonic—this concert had the audience on their feet!

$150: All of the above PLUS two tickets to any MMYO 2015-2016 concert

$500: All of the above plus two additional tickets to any MMYO 2015-2016 concert AND your CD will be autographed by Cynthia Phelps and Sheryl Staples

$1500: All of the above PLUS VIP-status tickets to all MMYO 2015-2016 concerts and an invitation for two to Mainly Mozart's 2015 Festival Closing Party on June 20th

$5000: All of the above PLUS recognition as a June 7th MMYO Concert Sponsor

WHAT WILL MAINLY MOZART DO WITH $15,000 FOR THE YOUTH OTRCHESTRA?

A celebrated cultural icon since 1988, Mainly Mozart is uniquely positioned to provide the highest quality musical education and performance training to San Diego’s future leaders through our demonstrated model of:

  • Teaching communication, collaboration, discipline, focus, leadership, and creativity
  • Developing self-esteem, promoting self-discovery, and ensuring emotional health in all of our student musicians
  • Providing sustained opportunities for positive social interaction between peers and introducing creative and productive ways for children to spend their free time
  • Reaching out to families in economically depressed, ethnically diverse areas of San Diego that would not otherwise be able to afford Youth Orchestra registration fees
  • Integrating students with learning differences into all of our core programs, and allowing all students to learn from each other in a welcoming environment
  • Helping students build a life-long connection to the arts, giving them the opportunity to reap the life-long benefits of exposure to expressive media
  • Establishing a safe environment for students to exercise their leadership skills, personal accountability, dedication, persistence, and team-oriented mentality

Money raised from this specific campaign will help provide the funding necessary to:

  • Provide music scholarships to families in need
  • Help students with special needs such as Autism Spectrum Disorder and Down Syndrome to receive extra one-on-one musical coaching
  • Secure teaching hours from world-renowned musicians from the Mainly Mozart Festival Orchestra
  • Ensure prestigious performance opportunities year-round for all of our students, including the chance to play at The Balboa Theatre during the Mainly Mozart Festival

The Mainly Mozart Youth Orchestra is sustainable through ongoing fund development, such as this campaign, and student registration fees.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute monetarily, but you’d like to help us make a difference in the lives of San Diego’s youth, there are many valuable ways you can help.

Like Mainly Mozart on Facebook and share our campaign and status updates with your friends

Follow @MainlyMozart on Twitter and retweet the inspiring stories of our student musicians

story:
Why we are here

Hello everyone! My name is Teran Chase and I am a student in the Evening MBA program at Arizona State University. Since undergrad, receiving my Master's in Business has always been a goal for me and now that I have been accepted, I intend to make the most of it. I was recently awarded the opportunity to do an off-campus elective. I will be spending two weeks in Europe learning international business. As this is a once in a lifetime opportunity, I will be taking an additional week to tour Paris, Venice, and Rome. Who wouldn't?!

I have started this campaign to help offset the cost of the trip. Any and all support is appreciated.

Breakdown of Costs

- $2500 for the flights

- $2000 for lodging in Paris

- $3000 for travel money (food, travel in the cities, tours, souvenirs)

story:
Short Summary

A fund to support chapter initiatives/ 

What We Need & What You Get

$500 was the minimum amount indiegogo would let us put in. This fund is aimed to generate any/all funds to support chapter programming. 

Contributors will see all donations go towards subsidizing activities and events they can participate in. 

The Impact

Donated funds will enable the group to provide better receptions at events, book suitable venues, and support participation by alumni in academic and professional endeavors. 

Risks & Challenges

All funds will go into an operational fund managed by the Carleton Economics Alumni Chapter volunteer board. All funds will be used to directly support programming and events open to alumni. Any funds not used by Sept 2016 will be donated to the Carleton Economics Department to be given to student initiatives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help the group by participating in our events, sharing our social media pages, or mentoring an economics student as part of the alumni mentoring program.

story:
WONDERS SUCCESS & NEW HOME

November 2016 Update:

The last copies are now exclusively distributed to the trade and available for individual purchase for $260.00 plus postage from Todd Pratum Bookseller, a specialist in anomalous phenomena and related fields, please order from him directly through this link which has complete ordering details.  https://knowledge396.wordpress.com/wonders-in-t... - Payment by check or PayPal. 
 
For credit card orders please order through Rick Wilkinson Books, http://www.gfwilkinsonbooks.com/si/6869.html - Copies can also be viewed in person at his bookstall in downtown San Francisco, 34 Trinity Pl, San Francisco, CA 94104, 415.200.8707

 

Help Us Uncover the Reality of Ancient UFOs 

 

DISCLOSE the TRUTH about observations by astronomers and qualified witnesses

PROVIDE the RECORD and PRESERVE original documents for future scholars

DEMONSTRATE how phenomena in the sky influenced our cultures and religions

REVEAL the FULL HISTORY of UFOs -- BEFORE AIRPLANES were invented

 
 

                   

              "Golden orb" phenomenon seen at Spoletium (Umbria, Italy) in 91 BC

 

    Collector's Limited Edition of Wonders in Sky

 
The goal of this campaign is to publish a collector's limited edition of Wonders in the Sky. And by supporting this project you will be supporting UFO research. Help us facilitate future investigations. Thus far 143 books have been claimed! There are 357 copies that remain available.
 

 

Research has flourished...from collections and museums all over the world
 

Research has flourished in the last five years, with remarkable material added and unique color images obtained from collections and museums all over the world. With the manuscript completed, and the prototype prepared, we now need your help to independently publish this next generation of Wonders that takes the study and research of UFOs to a higher level. We hope you will support our campaign and come to love your book for both its artistic beauty and scientific merit.

 

Only 500 Signed and Numbered Copies

This new unique Limited Edition (only 500 signed, numbered and slipcased copies will ever be produced) represents the culmination of many years of exhaustive scientific research. Since the original publication of Wonders in the Sky, two of the world's leading UFO researchers Chris Aubeck and Jacques Vallée have continued to investigate both new and existing cases with the help of a group of experts on the internet. New cases have been researched and appear in this work for the first time (Penguin produced a paperback version in 2010). Meanwhile other cases have been expanded following further investigation, and some cases from the original work have been removed as additional research proved that they lacked merit. 

 


To hear more about Dr. Vallée's research, just click here and here for two videos; a panel about outer space at a global financial conference in Saudi Arabia and a TED talk in Geneva on Futures Research, respectively.
 

420 Selected Reports

 
The book you receive will contain more than 420 selected reports of sightings from biblical-age antiquity through the year 1879 -- the point at which the Industrial Revolution deeply changed the nature of human society with the invention of the dirigible, airplanes, rockets, and various prototypes increasing the opportunity for confusion and misinterpretation of new technology as UFOs.

 

                    

   Report of a man in a flying object by nightwatchmen in London, 1710


 

The Phenomenon Did Not Begin in 1947

 

As some of you may not be familiar with the original version of Wonders and its research, the following will serve as additional background on the concept. Since the end of World War II, many individual researchers, newspapers, and military agencies have recorded thousands of incidents involving aerial phenomena, often called UFOs. These accounts gave rise to much speculation about flying saucers, visitors from other planets and alien abductions, generally thought to be a recent development. Yet the phenomenon did not begin in the present era.


Jacques Vallée and Chris Aubeck reveal a thread of vividly rendered -- and sometimes strikingly similar -- reports of mysterious aerial phenomena from antiquity through the modern age. These accounts share definite physical features  -- such as the complex evolution of the objects in flight, their spherical or discoid shape and their luminous characteristics -- that have changed little over the centuries, yet have remained unexplained. This work charts a complete chronology, ensuring that cases meet a standard measure of credibility via a specific person on the record having witnessed an event at a specific time and place.


                 
   
             Mirabilis Annus: Progression of the UFO "wave" of 1660-61 in England
 
 

 

The work of Jacques and Chris has received widespread praise for its scientific approach to the study of UFOs. A few of these endorsements are provided here.

 

 

"A riveting historical framework"

Sage thinkers have noted that revolutions in thought, scientific or otherwise, are wrought when anomalies are noted and then finally explained. But what does one do when an anomaly continues to show up over thousands of years in the skies above us -- and yet there remains no consistent explanation?! Absent a formal explanation a diligent scientist in today’s era would first chronicle the history, verify the data with best practices, and then provide an objective recounting of the case facts.  That is at least what should happen…

In that vein this newly updated Edition of Wonders in the Sky provides a riveting historical framework for a vexing anomaly—that of unexplained aerial objects and, by implication, the potential reasons (intelligence?) behind them. Starting as far back as 1460 BC, Vallée and Aubeck, in magnificent detail, provide a gallery of unexplained aerial phenomena as chronicled by a range of individuals—whether common folk, generals of the day, members of their armies, scientists and astronomers, or leaders of cities or even religions. What is compellingly brought out in Wonders in the Sky are the similarities of the recorded experiences juxtaposed against the extraordinary variety of interpretations by the participants who recorded them. What have these people seen? Why is it there? Is it similar to what is seen today and if not, why not?

Meticulous attention to scientific detail is a hallmark of Vallée’s books, and Wonders in the Sky is a case study in objectivity. By never allowing their writing, or their reader, to fall into the trap of a foregone conclusion, Vallée and Aubeck enable the broadest set of hypotheses to remain on the table. Such focus is what makes this new edition of Wonders in the Sky a landmark on the history of unexplained aerial objects. And it should be a case study in the scientific literature of how to avoid dogma while still leaving open the wonders of what role we play in a larger reality.

 

-Dr. Garry Nolan, Rachford and Carlota Harris Professor of Microbiology & Immunology, Stanford University


 

 

"A beautiful synthesis of the humanities and sciences"

 

Anyone who has dipped into the world of ufology knows just how difficult it is to find an able guide through the dark deep forest of the phenomena, which are diverse, confusing, and often, or so it seems, intentionally confusing. Two beacons high above this forest have been the work of Jacques Vallée and the web-based “Magoniax” research team of Chris Aubeck and his colleagues. The present project, a gorgeously produced new edition of Wonders in the Sky, brings the two together again as they scan human history from antiquity to 1879 for evidence of unexplained aerial objects. In the process, they resist any easy answers or pat interpretations, preferring instead to sit with the historical data in all its complexity and mystery, to listen, as it were, to the historian of religions as closely as the astronomer. The result is a beautiful synthesis of the humanities and the sciences, of the human imagination and the computer, of the visual arts and the art of scholarship. From the striking painting on the cover, which depicts a mysterious object painted on an Italian ceiling in 1561, to the sharp, clear thinking of the text, to the playful medieval symbols attached to each case, the book sets a new standard, and a new aesthetic, for the still developing conversation.

 

-Dr. Jeffrey J. Kripal, J. Newton Rayzor Professor of Religion, Rice University

 
 

 

"That, I believe, is true science: to follow the data wherever they lead"

Their rigorously scientific insistence allows Vallée and Aubeck to retain the most challenging and interesting aspects of these events without the distraction of premature commitment to any particular interpretation. That, I believe, is true science: to follow the data wherever they lead, and to move away from established theory when it fails to deal adequately with the data.

The other beautiful innovation in Vallée and Aubeck’s work is the combination of science and scholarship. A willingness to combine documentary research, the heart of humanities scholarship, with physical and astrophysical knowledge is rare.”

-From the preface to Wonders by Professor David Hufford at the University of Pennsylvania
 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

106 Color Images and Special Items


Our expanded and updated Wonders in the Sky contains 106 color images of rare photographs and illustrations. These images have been rendered from high quality digital images to create a work of lasting beauty as well as science. Towards this end, you will also receive the following special items for your contribution:


A facsimile commemorative token (coin) of French origin from 1648 depicting a legendary shield from the sky

                                           

 

The token pictured above, which was struck in 1648, shows a disk with a thick border. This kind of object or medal (“jeton” in French) has been mentioned in books and magazine articles as a flying shield either observed in the clouds, passing over a wide landscape or (as in this case) protecting it from spears directed at its curved surface from the sky.

 

The jeton is a little larger than a U.S. quarter and is similar to many tokens produced in Europe around that time for religious and educational purposes. Rather than a flying saucer (some sort of “Roman Roswell,” as some have suggested), it is thought to represent the “Shield of Numa.”

 

It is said that on March 1st, 707 BC, during the outbreak of a plague, the second king of Rome, Numa Pompilius, witnessed the fall of an oval shield from the sky during a ceremony. Somewhat astonished, he sought advice from the nymph Egeria and the nine Muses, who assured him that Jupiter had dropped it as a sign of his benevolence. The pestilence soon came to an end, so the grateful king had eleven identical copies made by an armourer, and those were used in dances and celebrations every year. Written around the edges of this coin is the Latin phrase “Resistit paucis obruitur pluribus,” which means “It withstands a few but is overwhelmed by the many.”

 

Reports of such “flying shields” figure prominently in Wonders in the Sky. We believe this intriguing coin is a worthy accessory minted in support of the research.

 

A folder of rare 17th and 18th century European broadsheets and placards

 

Presented are a folder of rare broadsheets, the newspapers of the time, that functioned as mass media, most of them from 17th and 18th century Germany, depicting celestial events observed in central Europe, France and Italy. Produced in facsimile, each one consists of an engraving of the scene (typically enhanced with mythological, allegorical or religious figures) with a text explaining the significance of the event for the benefit of the public.

 

These records have taken the form of paintings on the walls of caves, carvings in stone walls, statues and stelae, or writings on papyrus and parchment. After the invention of paper and the printing press, the observations could be shared with an eager and curious public. This led to widely distributed poster-size documents known as broadsheets, broadsides or placards. These were posted as notices in a public place or sold as individual sheets.

 

Please see two of the placards below, and enjoy these rare items that are both pieces of art and critical components of the historical UFO record.
 

                  

 

                   

 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 

                             Highest Production Values                                      
 

 

Specifications

 
TRIM: 8 1/2 x 11; PAPER:  text: 157 gsm acid-free matt artpaper;  Endpapers: 140 gsm woodfree paper; SLIPCASE: Saifu cloth over 3 mm board with stamping on front and spine;  JACKET:: 157 gsm glossy artpaper; BINDING: smythe sewn, sq back, case bound, head and tail bands.
 
 
Work on the manuscript and a prototype of the book is now complete and represents the culmination of many years of careful research. We will deliver the highest quality production values, and the books, coins, and placards will arrive in distinctive and protective packaging.
 

Jacques and Chris are very excited to bring this book to life, and more importantly, bring this updated work of UFO scientific research to you. For everyone interested in UFOs, this is an amazing opportunity that we hope you will take advantage of. This limited edition, updating the Penguin edition, will  contain 500 copies signed, numbered and slipcased -- and of course, also a facsimile coin and a folder of rare broadsheets and placards will accompany each book. These magnificent thank-you gifts will be delivered in late Spring 2016.

 

Additional information about the authors:
 

 

 

Jacques Vallée and Chris Aubeck at a conference in Madrid, May 2015
 

Jacques Vallée holds a master’s degree in astrophysics from France and a Ph.D. in computer science from Northwestern University, where he served as an associate of Dr. J. Allen Hynek, the scientific consultant to the U.S. Air Force on the UFO problem. He is the author of several books about high technology and unidentified phenomena, a subject that first attracted his attention as an astronomer in Paris. While analyzing observations from many parts of the world, he became intrigued by the similarities in patterns between modern sightings and historical reports of encounters with flying objects and their occupants in every culture. The result was the seminal book Passport to Magonia, published in 1969. Later, Jacques would become the model for the French scientist character in Stephen Spielberg's Close Encounters played by François Truffaut.

After a career as an information scientist with Stanford Research Institute and the Institute for the Future, where he served as a principal investigator for the groupware project on the Arpanet, the prototype of the Internet, Jacques Vallée cofounded a venture capital firm in Silicon Valley, where he works.

 

 

Chris Aubeck was born in London. His interest in the historical and sociological aspects of unexplained aerial phenomena began at an early age. He moved to Spain at age 19 and now lives in Madrid, where he works as an interpreter and English teacher at the Madrid Development Institute. A student of folklore and philology, he has helped compile the largest collection of pre-1947 UFO cases in the world. He has spoken on his research in many articles and on public radio. In 2008 he was awarded a prize for his contributions to the field by the Spanish organization Fundación Anomalía.

In 2003, Aubeck cofounded a remarkable collaborative network of librarians, students, and scholars of paranormal history on the Internet. This group, known as the Magoniax Project, extends from North and Central America to Russia and Germany. It has accumulated thousands of references, searched media archives in several languages, and gathered hundreds of rare documents, scientific reports, and newspaper clippings from the last four hundred years.

 

Copyright © 2015 by Jacques Vallée, Documatica Research, LLC and Chris Aubeck

WONDERS SUCCESS & NEW HOMENovember 2016 Update:The last copies are now exclusively distributed to the trade and available for individual purchase for $260.00 plus postage from Todd Pratum Bookseller, a specialist in anomalous phenomena and related fields, please order from him directly through this link which has complete ordering details.  https://knowledge396.wordpress.com/wonders-in-t... - Payment by check or PayPal.  For credit card orders please order through Rick Wilkinson Books, http://www.gfwilkinsonbooks.com/si/6869.html - Copies can also be viewed in person at his bookstall in downtown San Francisco, 34 Trinity Pl, San Francisco, CA 94104, 415.200.8707 
Help Us Uncover the Reality of Ancient UFOs 
 
DISCLOSE the TRUTH about observations by astronomers and qualified witnessesPROVIDE the RECORD and PRESERVE original documents for future scholarsDEMONSTRATE how phenomena in the sky influenced our cultures and religionsREVEAL the FULL HISTORY of UFOs -- BEFORE AIRPLANES were invented
 
                                  "Golden orb" phenomenon seen at Spoletium (Umbria, Italy) in 91 BC     Collector's Limited Edition of Wonders in Sky

story:
Hello friends,
Please join me in helping to educate young Nepalese children from the city of Kathmandu !

Some of you may have already heard : thanks to Projects Abroad, I will be setting off to Nepal, from January 7th to April 7th, to teach young teenagers how to speak English.

Nepal being one of the poorest countries in the world, it has a very high rate of illiteracy and unemployment.  But it is also one of the most beautiful and culturally rich places on earth, and because of the explosion of tourism, speaking English has become essential. This is why learning the English language from a young age is a way for children to access higher education, find a job, and improve their prospects for the future.

This mission being self-funded, I need to raise a total of 3,500€ that will go towards organizing my project, supporting my host family (food and accommodation), travel and health insurance and so on.

If you would like to help me achieve my fundraising goal, please consider contributing a little something and do not hesitate to share this page with your friends and family.  All donations, no matter how small, will be of great great help.

Most gratefully, 
Cecilia  

To know more about the project : http://www.projects-abroad.co.uk/volunteer-destinations/nepal/teaching/general-teaching-projects/

---

Hello tout le monde,

Certains d'entre vous le savent sans doute déjà : je pars avec Projects Abroad faire une mission d’enseignement de l’anglais pendant 3 mois, du 7 janvier au 7 avril, auprès d’enfants de Katmandou, au Népal.

Le Népal étant l'un des pays les plus pauvres au monde, le pays a un taux très élevé de chômage et d'illetrisme. Mais c'est également l'un des plus beaux pays de la planète, avec un héritage culturel très riche et, grâce à l'explosion du tourisme local, la maitrise de l’anglais est devenue essentielle. C'est pourquoi enseigner l'anglais à l'école permettrait aux enfants d’améliorer leurs chances de trouver un travail, aller plus loin dans leurs études et améliorer leurs chances d’un avenir meilleur.

Projects Abroad étant une organisation indépendante, je cherche à collecter un total de 3500€ pour couvrir l’organisation de ma mission par l'association, nourriture et hébergement dans une famille d'accueil, assurance voyage et santé, et ainsi de suite.

Si vous souhaitez m'aider à atteindre mon objectif de financement, n'hésitez pas à contribuer une petite somme et partager cette page avec votre entourage. Tous les dons, peu importe le montant, me seront d'une très grande aide.

Merci par avance de votre générosité, 
Cecilia

Pour plus d'info sur le projet : http://www.projects-abroad.fr/pays/nepal-volontariat/enseignement/
story_txt: Hello friends,Please join me in helping to educate young Nepalese children from the city of Kathmandu !Some of you may have already heard : thanks to Projects Abroad, I will be setting off to Nepal, from January 7th to April 7th, to teach young teenagers how to speak English.Nepal being one of the poorest countries in the world, it has a very high rate of illiteracy and unemployment.  But it is also one of the most beautiful and culturally rich places on earth, and because of the explosion of tourism, speaking English has become essential. This is why learning the English language from a young age is a way for children to access higher education, find a job, and improve their prospects for the future.This mission being self-funded, I need to raise a total of 3,500€ that will go towards organizing my project, supporting my host family (food and accommodation), travel and health insurance and so on.If you would like to help me achieve my fundraising goal, please consider contributing a little something and do not hesitate to share this page with your friends and family.  All donations, no matter how small, will be of great great help.Most gratefully, Cecilia  To know more about the project : http://www.projects-abroad.co.uk/volunteer-destinations/nepal/teaching/general-teaching-projects/---Hello tout le monde,Certains d'entre vous le savent sans doute déjà : je pars avec Projects Abroad faire une mission d’enseignement de l’anglais pendant 3 mois, du 7 janvier au 7 avril, auprès d’enfants de Katmandou, au Népal.Le Népal étant l'un des pays les plus pauvres au monde, le pays a un taux très élevé de chômage et d'illetrisme. Mais c'est également l'un des plus beaux pays de la planète, avec un héritage culturel très riche et, grâce à l'explosion du tourisme local, la maitrise de l’anglais est devenue essentielle. C'est pourquoi enseigner l'anglais à l'école permettrait aux enfants d’améliorer leurs chances de trouver un travail, aller plus loin dans leurs études et améliorer leurs chances d’un avenir meilleur.Projects Abroad étant une organisation indépendante, je cherche à collecter un total de 3500€ pour couvrir l’organisation de ma mission par l'association, nourriture et hébergement dans une famille d'accueil, assurance voyage et santé, et ainsi de suite.Si vous souhaitez m'aider à atteindre mon objectif de financement, n'hésitez pas à contribuer une petite somme et partager cette page avec votre entourage. Tous les dons, peu importe le montant, me seront d'une très grande aide.Merci par avance de votre générosité, CeciliaPour plus d'info sur le projet : http://www.projects-abroad.fr/pays/nepal-volontariat/enseignement/

story:
In the Grizzly Garden at Pajaro Valley High School in Watsonville, we're teaching our students all about regenerative farming and gardening.  Besides growing annuals and having lots of native plants, the garden is home to 40 fruit trees.  

We're really trying to ramp things up out there.   We're gonna be selling at the Watsonville Farmers Market so we're re-doing all our raised beds to plant our fall crops (cilantro, carrots, onion, etc).  On top of this, we're now raising money to plant 40 more fruit trees!  

Help us out with any donation amount (rhyme unintentional), and share us on your social media networks.  For every $40 donated, we plant one tree.  Go Grizzlies!!!

story:
In Iloilo, Philippines, opportunities for self-sufficiency and/or jobs for the deaf have been next to nothing. If there are,  these are limited.  In addition, educational opportunities that will allow them to fully use their potentials are also inadequate if not downright restricted.

It is for this reason that I thought of providing people with hearing impairment an alternative learning program on building a successful business using the internet which will not only open a whole new possibilities for self-fulfillment and self-reliance, but will also help them develop self confidence, realize their dreams, pursue their interests and passions so that they can live productive lives. 

Who am I?

I am Marie de la Rama. I consider myself an entrepreneur, too. I have had almost 30 years of fun and privilege working with some of the finest companies in the Philippines providing them IT solutions -- hardware, software, support -- to solve business problems and achieve business goals while building, nurturing and growing my own micro and small business ventures on the side.

Help me make use of this experience to help the deaf in Iloilo  (especially those who are poor and have no resources for further education)  benefit from learning how to start, build and grow a business using the internet. Help me make something positive and productive out of their young lives now.

What We Need 

I need to raise US$77,000 to fully fund the training, mentoring and coaching of the first 12 deaf scholars in developing their own online enterprises.  These amount will be used to:

  • pay for the use of an integrated package of software and tools in developing an online business
  • acquire computers, presentation equipment and similar learning aids for the deaf
  • pay for skilled sign language interpreters 
  • training of additional trainers and mentors 
  • pay for the rent of a training venue
  • pay for the associated costs of professional coaching and mentoring for a year
  • finance the costs related to helping the deaf develop their own products and services, negotiate deals such as partnerships, marketing, joint venture, etc.

The Impact

Imagine the impact your financial support can do to the first 12 deaf scholars and the next set who will receive similar opportunity through our "pay-it-forward" course. Firstly, it will provide them hope. It gets them excited to see life in a whole new way. They start dreaming and learning and relearning. It affords them a way to pursue their lifelong passions and interests, acquire new skills and exploit their talents, creativity and gifts. And, it gives them an opportunity to make a living.  It builds and restores their confidence. Above all, it removes the stigma of being a burden to their families because the Enterprise Development Program offers them a chance to be financially independent. They'd become sociable and responsible persons who will also learn how to give back in return.

Risks & Challenges

The risk that all first 12 may not succeed is very real. The challenge is to ensure that they complete the 80-hour training program.  Which is why, to minimize the risks and  face the challenge squarely, we employ the "learn-by-doing" method in teaching them the process of starting a business online.  On top of that, they will receive professional coaching and mentoring as they nurture and grow their online business within the year of the training. From experience, we know that some hand-holding is necessary.  As a result, the degree of success has been impressive. And so, no one will be left unattended.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please ask folks or request your Facebook friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Remember us when you are in the position to help by saving our contact details.

Thank you!
