story:
La Casa Clü

"La Casa Clü" is a ludic center located in the community of San Ignacio, Nayarit, Mexico.

San Ignacio is a really poor community, with a low education index, and a lot of domestic violence and addictions.

·  We first came to San Ignacio in 2010, and we officially  became a non profit association in 2013.

In "La Casa Clu" kids can learn by playing and parents can find a source of work and a change in their lives. We seek always to motivate the children, helping them develop their individual potential, encouraging them to think freely, to believe in themselves, and to develop their creativity through the arts. Here the children have the opportunity to break free, to learn the art, be creative and develop their potential according to their tastes and interests.

With help we can keep providing the community with psychological and pedagogic help and also to have funds to afford the space we work at.




  • We need $30,000 USD to afford the land we are located, and to develop more infrastructure for educational purposes.
  • We  need $5000 USD to be able to pay our psychologists and pedagogues that provide the attention to the community.
  • If you donate 50 USD you’ll receive a video of the kids thanking you for your help .
  • If we don’t achieve our goal (35,000 USD) the money will be used to keep paying rent for the land, to have better teaching infrastructure, and to keep paying our psychologists and pedagogues

El impacto


  • This project gives a chance to  people that were born in adversity and in a difficult conflictive environment to develop themselves in a healthy environment; teaching positive emotions for the future generations of San Ignacio.
  • We work together with "Foundation Punta de Mita", an important association in Bahia de Banderas.

Riesgos y desafíos


  • All the things we have done, have been achieved with minimum budget and a lot of volunteer work, yet we have had outstanding results. Kids that lacked of social skills and used to fight among each other, have now developed strong friendship bonds. Also, some of them couldn't afford to go to school and now they have the opportunity to learn how to read and write. 
  • We always have hope, and we have been blessed with a lot of voluntaries that have helped us since we started, yet people that work with us need economic support to continue making this project achievable. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar


  • We are located near Sayulita and Punta Mita, a surfing and golfing paradise, if you come here you can help as a voluntary helper, either building, teaching or providing; any help is appreciated.

story:
The Digital Creative Workshop  



The Digital Creative Workshop is a community-based initiative in Anguilla. We strive to create a space for the development of technical vocation training in the arts. Currently, we are in our second year after seeing immense success from the first year's proceedings, most notably the "Anguilla Happy" video.

The 2015 Digital Creative Workshop will be expanded with the addition of UNICEF's One Minute Jr's, an international program that equips young artists with the fundamental skills to share their ideas, dreams, and viewpoints with the world.

This year’s workshop takes place from August 17-28th, 2015 and includes two full weeks of immersive instruction. Week one is dedicated solely to video production, from story conceptualization to production, including cinematography and direction, to editing and sound design. Week two, which focuses on audio production, will cover the fundamentals of vocal recording, DAW workflow, mixing and mastering.

Supplies used for video production with UNICEF will be donated to the Department of Youth and Culture for continued education. These audio and video tools will remain accessible and free-for-use for sustainable community enrichment.


What We Need & What We Can Do



We are fundraising for the final expenses of our workshop in order to make great things happen.

We are in need of:

  • Travel and accommodation costs for two (2) instructors (estimated 2,900 USD) 

  • Four (4) FL Studio Producer Licenses (200 USD/license)

  • 20 USB flash drives, AUX Cables, misc learning supplies (800 USD)

What we can do:
All persons donating, no matter the amount, will receive a subscription to the Digital Creative Newsletter. This quarterly update contains information about the ongoing progress and work of the students here in Anguilla. The newsletter also includes insight into the ever-evolving digital market (i.e. flagship smartphones, the open source movement, MOOKS, wearables, computer tech and cloud storage).

  • Persons donating 100 USD or more receive an exclusive sneak-peek to films produced in the workshop. Donors will be given a password-protected link to each of the films along with a subscription to the quarterly Digital Creative Newsletter. Please include a personal email address with this donation.
  • Persons donating 200 USD or more will receive a warm holiday greeting card from the islands. This includes a group picture of the class from the workshop sent personally to your front door anywhere in the world. Donors also receive access to the sneak-peek of the final films and a subscription to the quarterly Digital Creative Newsletter.
  • Persons donating 500 USD or more will receive the title of Project Sponsor. You, or your desired business, will be incorporated in all promotional materials, including the Digital Creative Newsletter. You will also be listed in video and audio credits of the project. Holiday greeting card and sneak peeks of video projects are included with this donation.

Our Impact



The benefits of the Digital Creative Workshop extend far beyond the two-week workshop. The goals of this project are long-term developmental objectives within the Education Department and Ministry of Social Development in Anguilla. Benefits include technical support for digital media, communications, benchmark secondary school courses, as well as the development and expansion of professional industry personnel.

Figures from the 2014 Workshop

14 Students Taught
5 Days of Instruction
7 Songs
1 Music Video
7,000+ YouTube views

Projected Figures for 2015 Workshop

20 Students Taught
10 Days of Instruction
15 Songs
20 Short Films
Endless Possibilities

What's at Risk 



Providing a quality program for students who deserve a great experience and access to digital tools and resources is our greatest barrier. Essential supplies such as flash drives, proprietary software and applications, auxiliary cables and headphones. Other expenses include travel and accommodation for instructors to teach these young, brilliant minds.

We have had great success with in-kind donations such as laptops and other sound recording equipment. We appreciate all help and consideration.


Infinite Ways You Can Help



We are always willing to receive in-kind donations. This includes used computers, laptops, speakers, microphones or any other equipment used for music or video production. We are always reconfiguring, fixing, and repurposing used parts. Please email us at digitalcreativeworkshop@gmail.com to discuss shipping directly.


Please share our campaign with someone you know.

story:
Short Summary

My sister has dedicated a significant part of her life to understanding and helping all those around her. She has become a well educated peer in many facets of advanced brain/mind/psyche restoration tactics. 

There might be a better way of conveying to you how hard she has worked for this, or how much she has earned the greatest grand canyon experience of her life but all I am hoping for now is a little bit of your help to send her down the river with all that she needs. 

Your financial contribution will help her by providing her with the essentials she needs to make a fun, safe, education and inspirational trip down the river, 

  • This fundraising effort will provide Adrienne with the necessary tools to prepare for, document and execute what I believe will be an immensely contributive study to anyone interested in what nature, an educated guide and a psychology degree can provide (if we can help her cross the finish line!)
  • Any amount that is raised over our goal will go to Adrienne and provide her with the support she will need starting off in her new career! It takes time for these things to get going and she will not be making any money on this trip! 
  • Adrienne is going to have an amazing trip. Everyone on her tour will benefit not only from her presence but from her passion to creating a space where those around her can blossom. The beautiful thing is that even though she studies so hard to create this space for others, it comes so naturally and she doesn't even know she is doing it most of the time... With a degree and with your support through funding this campaign, you will be amplifying this already wonderful force in the universe ( I call my sister)



And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

This scholarship is designed to encourage African American and historically under-represented students along the way, in his/her pursuit of life long learning. In over 15 years of teaching, I witnessed hundreds of deserving students go unrecognized throughout his/her educational journey. 

Many students in college told me the last award he/she received was in elementary school. Some claimed they wished they had been recognized in some way in high school. 

Do you know a deserving student? Did someone come to mind, while reading this introduction? Stop. Take 10 minutes, complete the form, write a short letter of recommendation, and do something "Best" for that person. Nominate them. Today!

Please complete the scholarship form and upload your letter of recommendation by Sunday, August 2, 2015. Send materials to: 

THEABCSCHOLARSHIP@GMAIL.COM

A selection committee will read personal statements, letters of recommendation, watch video clips, and rank applicants.

Awardees are contacted via email, verified, and notified of award by Wednesday, August 5, 2015.

Awards are granted throughout the academic year on a rolling basis. Our vision is to provide (3) awards per quarter. Awards vary in amount based on funding sources.

Awards are given directly to the student in his/her name and may applied with other scholarships.

The first (5) Scholarships are given to former and present students. Students currently participating in LASC Upward Bound are highly encouraged to apply. Students will receive the award at the Upward Bound Culmination Ceremony on Friday, August 7, 2015. Awardee must be present at the event.

Stipulations:

This is a one-time award. All grades K-12, college, graduate students, and EDD doctoral students may apply.

Award Categories:

·  Shining Star-Progress attempted and made in attitude and academics. (i.e. tenacity, stick-to-it-ness, and perseverance)

·  Learning Skills Award

·  Leadership Award

·  Justice Award-Standing up for what's right.

·  Young Entrepreneur Award

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Goal $500 
  • Funds raised go directly to students for books, supplies, and personal expenses.
  • Perks: Personal Phone Call/Message, Notecard, and/or Personalized Letter and Picture from the event. 
  • When the goal is reached excess funds will go towards funding students fall 2015.

The Impact

Small gifts impact lives. Small changes can change the world.

  • Individual Level
  • Organizational Level
  • Global Level

Risks & Challenges

THE ABC COACH turns problems into possibilities! When others see a problem and say, "Hey someone should do something about that," I turn inward and say, "I should do something about that!" Some challenges include: reading the submitted materials in a timely fashion, getting the awards printed by the deadline, and printing the "big check" for the students by August 5, 2015.

  •  What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles: My 14 years of teaching experience qualifies me. I'm not afraid of a NO. I work within my means.
  • My plan for solving these challenges: Ask for help, delegate tasks, and build a team to help me respond to the needs.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share on your social media outlets.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Contact Dr. Nicole Johnson to create other ways to serve African American and historically under-represented students.

THEABCSCHOLARSHIP@GMAIL.COM

A selection committee will read personal
 statements, letters of recommendation, watch video clips, and rank applicants.
Awardees are contacted via email, verified, and
 notified of award by Wednesday, August
 5, 2015.
Awards are granted throughout the academic year
 on a rolling basis. Our vision is to provide (3) awards per quarter. Awards
 vary in amount based on funding sources. 
Awards are given directly to the student in
 his/her name and may applied with other scholarships.
The first (5) Scholarships
 are given to former and present students. Students currently participating in
 LASC Upward Bound are highly encouraged to apply. Students will receive the
 award at the Upward Bound Culmination
 Ceremony on Friday, August 7, 2015.
 Awardee must be present at the event.
Stipulations:
This is a one-time award. All
 grades K-12, college, graduate students, and EDD doctoral students may apply.
Award Categories:
· 
 Shining Star-Progress attempted and made in
 attitude and academics. (i.e. tenacity, stick-to-it-ness, and perseverance)
· 
 Learning Skills Award
· 
 Leadership Award
· 
 Justice Award-Standing up for what's right.
· 
 Young Entrepreneur Award   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Goal $500 
Funds raised go directly to students for books, supplies, and personal expenses. Perks: Personal Phone Call/Message, Notecard, and/or Personalized Letter and Picture from the event.  When the goal is reached excess funds will go towards funding students fall 2015.    The Impact Small gifts impact lives. Small changes can change the world.  Individual Level Organizational Level
Global Level    Risks & Challenges THE ABC COACH turns problems into possibilities! When others see a problem and say, "Hey someone should do something about that," I turn inward and say, "I should do something about that!" Some challenges include: reading the submitted materials in a timely fashion, getting the awards printed by the deadline, and printing the "big check" for the students by August 5, 2015.   What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles: My 14 years of teaching experience qualifies me. I'm not afraid of a NO. I work within my means. My plan for solving these challenges: Ask for help, delegate tasks, and build a team to help me respond to the needs.    Other Ways You Can Help  Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share on your social media outlets. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Contact Dr. Nicole Johnson to create other ways to serve African American and historically under-represented students.

story:
In some places in Africa the legal age to get married is 18 but cultural practices have priority to the legislative. Child marriage is dominant there, so that young girls of 12 to 17 get married to people older than them without their consent. Their lives are being wasted away. They do not have access to education.These girls are illiterate which makes it hard for them to break the cycle of poverty furthermore, their kids are most likely to become illiterate. Our goal is to help these girls to save their lives by sending them to school. This is also a way to fight against poverty in the world.

The funds raised by this campaign will be sent to the organisation "Children of Africa", a non-profit and non-governmental organisation that focuses on providing young African children with education. Each girl needs only 200 euros in order to attend school for one year in Ivory Coast. We're focusing our campaign in Ivory Coast, a country that has high rates of child marriage due to lack of access to education.

During the Yale Young Global Scholars Program, Awa Soumahoro (Leyla Noorah) has delivered a very inspiring TED Talks presentation on Child Marriage in Ivory Coast. Later on, still during the program, we met with the goal of setting up this campaign to raise funds for young girls to have access to education in her home country, Ivory Coast. Based on Awa’s personal experiences, she has met a lot of girls in her country who do not have access to school. Their parents then send them out to work at people’s houses to get money and help their families. They are most likely to be exploited, and they are treated as slave by some inhuman people.

Awa and I, among several other people, believe that these girls should be in school, just like us. Finally, our goal is to fight against child marriage and labour. Both are banned in Ivory Coast, but they are still unfortunately happening. These little girls deserve to go to school and money is their only limitation. This is why we encourage all of you to help educating these girls. Help them break out of poverty!


Important links:

UNFPA Child Marriage Country Profile (Ivory Coast) - http://www.girlsnotbrides.org/reports-and-publications/unfpa-child-marriage-country-profile-cote-divoire/

Children of Africa - http://childrenofafrica.org

Yale Young Global Scholars Program - http://globalscholars.yale.edu

story:
UNAM Motorsports

UNAM Motorsports es la escudería que participa en la competencia de Formula SAE que tiene como objetivo el diseño, manufactura y desarrollo de un prototipo fórmula, donde competimos con más de 500 universidades del mundo. 
Nuestro equipo, conformado por estudiantes de la UNAM de distintas facultades, ha participado en dicha competencia desde junio del 2010 y, actualmente, es nuestro séptimo año consecutivo.
Con el objetivo de lograr nuestros sueños y seguir poniendo el nombre de México y de la Universidad en alto, los invitamos a conocer nuestro proyecto y ser parte de la familia.

UNAM Motorsports team is participating in the Formula SAE competition that aims to design , manufacture and development of a prototype formula , where we compete with over 500 universities worldwide.

Our team , made up of UNAM students from different faculties participated in this competition since June 2010 and now is our seventh consecutive year.

In order to achieve our dreams and keep putting the name of Mexico and the University up , we invite you to visit our project and be part of the family.

Uso de los fondos | Use of the funds

Para inscribirnos a la competencia de Lincoln, Nebraska 2016 y empezar a manufacturar el prototipo de esta temporada necesitamos $ 3,000 USD. En caso de no llegar a esta cantidad, lo recaudado seguirá siendo para el mismo propósito.
El costo de la inscripción a la competencia es de $ 2,200 USD.
En forma de agradecimiento por apoyarnos, llevaremos a cabo las siguientes acciones:
  • Para los 3 mayores donadores, sus nombres aparecerá en nuestro prototipo, el cual se exhibe durante la competencia y en distintas exposiciones en las que nos presentamos.
  • Para los 10 mayores donadores, pondremos sus nombres en la playera oficial del equipo.
  • Sus nombres aparecerán en nuestra página web.


To sign up to competition from Lincoln , Nebraska 2016 and start the manufacture of the prototype of this season we need $ 3,000 USD . Failure to reach this amount , the proceeds will remain the same purpose .

Registration Fee: $ 2,200 USD.

In a thank you for supporting us , we will take the following actions:

  • For the 3 major donors , their names will appear in our prototype , which is exhibited during the competition and various exhibitions in which we present .
  • For the 10 major donors , we will put your name on the official team shirt .
  • We will put your names on our website.

El impacto | Impact

Uno de los principales motivos por los que se lleva a cabo la competencia Fórmula SAE es para que los estudiantes de las distintas universidades pongan en práctica los conocimientos ingenieriles y de negocios. Por lo tanto, al apoyar a UNAM Motorsports, estarán fomentando la educación y desarrollo de emprendedores universitarios de México.

Como prueba del éxito que hemos tenido en la competencia, hemos ganado los siguientes premios:

  • William C Mitchell - Novato del año FSAE WEST (2010)
  • Mejor equipo mexicano (2010-2015)
  • Mejor equipo latinoamericano (2010)
  • Segundo auto más potente (2011)
  • Tercer lugar en Reporte de Costos (2015)


One of the main reasons for which Formula SAE competition is done, is for students of different universities implement the engineering and business knowledge. Therefore, to support UNAM Motorsports, is to promote education and development of university entrepreneurs of Mexico.

As proof of the success we've had in the competition , we have won the following awards:

  • William C Mitchell - Rookie of the Year FSAE WEST (2010)
  • Best Mexican team (2010-2015)
  • Best Latin American team (2010)
  • Second most powerful car (2011)
  • Third place in Cost Report (2015)


Riesgos y desafíos | Challenges 

Nuestro equipo ha tenido distintos desafíos, pero uno de los principales a los que nos enfrentamos es competir contra grandes universidades de Estados Unidos, Alemania, Japón, entre otras, las cuales tienen un nivel ingenieril muy avanzado.

Para sobresalir entre todas estas universidades, trabajamos arduamente durante todo el año preparando cada uno de los eventos que se evalúan en la competencia, buscando asesorías y trabajando en conjunto para sacar lo mejor de nosotros, como personas y como un equipo.


Our team has had different challenges, but one of the main challenges we have faced is to compete against important universities in the United States, Germany, Japan, among others, which have a very advanced engineering level.

To stand out from all these universities, we work hard throughout the year preparing each of the events that are evaluated in the competition , seeking advice and working together to get the better of us, as individuals and as a team.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar | Other ways

En caso de querer apoyar a UNAM Motorsports, pero no contar con los recursos económicos, te pedimos que difundas esta página a todos tus conocidos. Indiegogo tiene las herramientas para que compartir esta información sea sencillo.

¡Gracias!


If you want to support UNAM Motorsports, but not have the financial resources, we ask you to spread this page to everyone you know. Indiegogo has the tools to share this information.

Thank you!

story:
The Endowment Campaign for the on-line Institution that will equip History Makers!

New awakening

Thousands of new pro-life individuals have been awakened by the recent PP videos. Thousands of others have wondered, 'what exactly is the best course of action to take to effectively bring an end to the human holocaust of abortion and to once again assert the legal right to life?'  We are determined to seize this opportunity of acknowledged ignorance to give enduring answers to those questions.

  • We are part of the world's largest and most effective pro-life advocacy organization, the National Right to Life Committee.
  • California, as the largest state in the nation numerically, and the most culturally diverse, has a huge task - how to educate and motivate the far-flung pro-life team.
  • With deep appreciation for the NRLC principles and experience, RTL U and the School of Life will offer our state and all other states, the tools to effectively educate and equip pro-life individuals right from their own laptops!

Right to Life University and the School of Life will give the normal person Immediate access to some of the finest minds in the pro-life movement; answers questions about the thorniest of issues; and as the School of Life, equips average citizens to go out into the community to impact the civic and cultural processes that change a nation for good. We are resolved to win our nation back for life and it's your help that's going to do it.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are all volunteers. For the last 2 years we have been assembling some of the finest and most effective presentations and workshops
  • There is so much more to be done! The vast majority of funds will go to internet marketing and other forms of advertising...We are out to reach the 'unreached'!
  • We are also busily reviewing content and preparing basic 'quiz' accountability tools, so that there is a sense of retention, and accomplishment for each course.
  • All extra funds over our goal will go to more and better training, more effective outreach and helping you change a culture that needs to restore the Right to Life.
  • We are sponsored by a 501 c3 non-profit (California ProLife Ed. Fund) All funds raised will be used to educate and motivate the pro-life community to better understand the challenge before us.
  • So you can get a tax-deduction and then any of the many cool perks we are offering (check 'em out!). More and new perks are being added all the time!

The Impact

The potential impact is mind boggling. Annually, literally thousands of young people learn about the actual horror of legalized abortion and just don't know how to handle it.. "What can I do?" Joleigh Little of Wisconsin Teens for Life speaks and leads high schoolers: "This is huge! The need has been great. Now all of these thousands of high school kids have a way to dig deeper, get to the heart of the cultural and legal battle, and they themselves be effective advocates for the RTL. We must do this! Thank you RTL U!"

Risks & Challenges

Hundreds of folks have responded already. They are VERY excited about what this means for both American youths and adults. We want to be able to declare 'Admissions Day' at the end of this coming October (it is Respect Life Month!)

  • Our diverse team has already run several successful crowdfunding campaigns
  • In addition many are hands-on administrators and trainers at pro-life boot-camps, conferences and institutions. And most are in fact drawn directly from the teaching profession.
  • Even if we fall 'short' of the deadline or financial goal, the testing and certification process will have begun and students are already singing our praises.
  • We would like RTL University and the School of Life to be universally known and admired among 'the good guys' and feared by the forces of evil who hide in, and use ignorance.        A tall task, but it can and will be done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • PLEASE : get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please click on and  use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • And though we are non-sectarian, we appreciate your prayers as well!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi! We are a group of high school seniors who live in Guadalajara, a city in Mexico with a lot of social inequality and discrimination. We are volunteers that alongside with other young entrepreneurs from “Cerro del Cuatro”, one the most disadvantaged zones in the city, work to improve the circumstances and make a change in that area through art.

We work in a community center located in the middle of the "Cerro del Cuatro". In this center we help up to 200 kids develop through art and culture with a variety of workshops. 

 Together, we are a group of change-makers from this city; we want and we CAN make a change, but to accomplish this we need your help. 

This is how the community center looks like now, September 2015. 

Our main goal in this campaign is to get founds in order to reconstruct the restrooms of our community center. The center can not provide any more this essential facility, since the actual restrooms are in terrible circumstances. What we have in mind is to renovate the whole center, but since we do not have the resources we will achieve this renovation project through stages. The first and most urgent one is the reconstruction of the restrooms. 

Blue spaces are for the restrooms.  

The total cost of the reconstruction of the restrooms is $409,431.18 Mexican pesos. Our center barely has money to cover the basic expenses such as water, electricity and craft material. We believe that we must accomplish this first stage first because a clean and accessible restroom is needed for 200 kids plus the staff working there. 

This is the completed architectonic project we would like to have in a future. 

 We are a same city, same young adults with the same goals, different circumstances, and we want the same opportunities for everyone.

What brings us together are the children, their future and the hope to improve their lifestyles.


Youtube video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XtE_xMbvC2A&amp...

For more information, and to get to know our team, you can always access to our blog: 

http://waking-entrepreneur.wix.com/makeachange

story:
"The marine world is a mystery to most of us; less than 10 percent of the oceans have been explored. No part of the oceans is unaffected, however, by human activities. Shamelessy, we pollute, exploit, and destroy a world that we know very little about."

-Yann-Arthus Bertrand (Excerpt from Haiti from Below)

Haiti. Beautiful blue seas with breathtaking mountainous landscapes- all make it a charming surprise for tourists. But Haiti is arguably more recognized internationally for its natural disasters or acute poverty. How can a community with an abundance of natural resources remain the poorest in the western hemisphere? Why is the environment so degraded?

Preserving Haiti from Below: The Exhibit will initiate change by educating youth on marine biodiversity and its connection to the broader environment.  It will share content that indicates how human behavior towards the environment actually stagnates job creation. It will teach those who visit how coral reefs actually protect us from storm waves and create our beautiful white sand beaches.

It will impact a generation of change-makers.

Partnered With

  


#sustainability #causeandeffect #educate

Why does The Exhibit need to be produced?

In December 2015, Haiti was referred to in Paris (COP21) as one of 3 countries on the brink of environmental collapse. Less than 2% of forests remain; only 15% of coral reefs along the coastline are healthy, due to erosion, overfishing, and waste pollution. In order to save whatever natural resources remain, we must start by educating the community, and especially the youth, on the impacts of human behavior.

Children are the future. In every nation, rich or poor, their perspectives and behaviors ultimately determine the future direction of a country. Media. Culture. Economy. The key to progress is to influence their perceptions and future actions.

In Haiti, environmental issues are not taught in traditional schools. As a result, adults have very little understanding of the ecosystems and show little respect for animals and plants. Culturally, Haitians also tend to have a disconnect with natural elements and a certain fear of the ocean.

Through The Exhibit, we want to explain the relationship between trees cut on the hilltops and the destruction of the corals, the increase in floods and drought, the disappearance of jobs, and the loss of prospects for future happiness. 

What will The Exhibit entail?

Events catch attention, but experiences are remembered. 

Making use of multisensory tools (still and moving images, sound, lighting, and tactile artifacts), The Exhibit is designed to be an unforgettable and immersive underwater experience for Haitian school children of all walks of life.

Our plan:

Photo Credit: ExperienceHaiti.org

Photo Credit: Nick Hobgood

Photo Credit: Photos 4 Filter

Who is producing The Exhibit?

AYITI NEXUS, a consulting firm committed to Haiti’s development, has a credible track record leading creative projects that encourage public dialogue and bring sustainable solutions to recurrent challenges. Previous and existing clients include international development agencies, non-profits, prospective investors, research institutes from different parts of the world. Principal consultants of the firm show significant interests for environmental sustainability issues. 

How is the budget broken down? 

Based on our years of consulting across various sectors, we have put together a detailed financial plan made of estimated costs for the production of an exhibit of exceptional quality. The budget is broken down in two categories of production:

Category 1: Exhibit Content - Printing of photos and catalog, framing, audiovisual production, take-away gifts for students and other visitors

Category 2: Labor - Project coordinator, curator, graphic designer, translator, film producer, sound and lighting expert, etc.

The estimated costs total $50,000.00. We hope to raise half of this amount with your help.

Ways You Can Help?

Share the video with your family and friends to spread the word about "Preserving Haiti From Below: The Exhibit". Even better, show your support financially by backing the campaign on Indiegogo. If we make this happen, we can reach 10,000 kids, giving them the only opportunity they will have to learn about marine life, how it ties to life on land, and the importance of biodiversity conservation. We truly count on your support.

Perks!

- $5: A big THANK YOU! This amount covers the cost of one student's admission to The Exhibit.

- $10: Beautiful postcard from Haiti

- $25:  Handmade Haitian jewelry piece made of recycled wrapping paper

Photo Credit: Apparent Project

- $100: One (1) coffee table book showing Haiti's beautiful marine life


- $200:  One (1) beach wrap with Haitian art print from Yanvalou Designs

Photo Credit: Yanvalou Designs

- $300:  One (1) Sea Hawk Excursion at the beautiful Marina Blue in Haiti 

Photo Credit: Marina Blue

- $500 "Corporate Sponsor Level":  one (1) coffee table book of Haiti's beautiful marine life + postcard from Haiti + public acknowledgement via marketing materials for The Exhibit + one (1) nvitation to the opening event

Photo Credit: Frederick Alexis

Risk and Challenges

While we are confident this exhibit will have a great impact on those who visit, producing a month-long activity can be very expensive. We have put together a flexible budget that will allow us to modify the features in the event our campaign isn’t fully funded. We are dedicated and qualified to make this content accessible to children across all sectors of society. We will proactively provide updates on production timelines and scheduling; and you’ll know when to mark your calendars for the opening.


Data sources:

NIELSON.COM

USAID.COM

WORLDBANK.COM
story_txt:
"The marine world is a mystery to most of us; less than 10 percent of the oceans have been explored. No part of the oceans is unaffected, however, by human activities. Shamelessy, we pollute, exploit, and destroy a world that we know very little about."
-Yann-Arthus Bertrand (Excerpt from Haiti from Below)


Haiti. Beautiful blue seas with breathtaking mountainous landscapes- all make it a charming surprise for tourists. But Haiti is arguably more recognized internationally for its natural disasters or acute poverty. How can a community with an abundance of natural resources remain the poorest in the western hemisphere? Why is the environment so degraded?
Preserving Haiti from Below: The Exhibit will initiate change by educating youth on marine biodiversity and its connection to the broader environment.  It will share content that indicates how human behavior towards the environment actually stagnates job creation. It will teach those who visit how coral reefs actually protect us from storm waves and create our beautiful white sand beaches.
It will impact a generation of change-makers.
Partnered With



  




#sustainability #causeandeffect #educate

Why does The Exhibit need to be produced?
In December 2015, Haiti was referred to in Paris (COP21) as one of 3 countries on the brink of environmental collapse. Less than 2% of forests remain; only 15% of coral reefs along the coastline are healthy, due to erosion, overfishing, and waste pollution. In order to save whatever natural resources remain, we must start by educating the community, and especially the youth, on the impacts of human behavior.
Children are the future. In every nation, rich or poor, their perspectives and behaviors ultimately determine the future direction of a country. Media. Culture. Economy. The key to progress is to influence their perceptions and future actions.



In Haiti, environmental issues are not taught in traditional schools. As a result, adults have very little understanding of the ecosystems and show little respect for animals and plants. Culturally, Haitians also tend to have a disconnect with natural elements and a certain fear of the ocean.
 
Through The Exhibit, we want to explain the relationship between trees cut on the hilltops and the destruction of the corals, the increase in floods and drought, the disappearance of jobs, and the loss of prospects for future happiness. 


What will The Exhibit entail?
Events catch attention, but experiences are remembered. 
Making use of multisensory tools (still and moving images, sound, lighting, and tactile artifacts), The Exhibit is designed to be an unforgettable and immersive underwater experience for Haitian school children of all walks of life.
Our plan:


Photo Credit: ExperienceHaiti.org


Photo Credit: Nick Hobgood
Photo Credit: Photos 4 Filter

story:
On 5th April 2012 we first visited our neighbouring primary school in Ole Keene, Maasai Mara, Kenya. Comprising of basic iron sheet classrooms and a mud hut kitchen plus two newly built classrooms it is a very basic school. Although now a government funded school it was originally built from contributions by the villagers of Ole Keene and was late to be taken over by the government meaning it is not covered by the school feeding program. With barely enough money to pay teachers the Headmaster is not able to afford anything to feed the children at lunch time meaning at the time we visited children were being sent home to try and find food for lunch. Some children have to travel several kilometres on foot to school, often through dangerous terrain due to wildlife and the majority are from very poor families. Most kids would not get any food at home and then have to return to school in the afternoon even more hungry from their efforts.

Although the kids are very happy to go to school and desperately crave knowledge malnutrition and hunger has a very negative impact on their ability to learn. We decided to try and do something so from that day onwards we created The Porridge Project initiative and have been fundraising and bringing awareness to the situation of the children through the camp and encouraging clients to visit the school.

Porridge is an inexpensive but very nutritious and simple meal which provides long lasting energy so we decided it was one of the best things we could provide to the school for the children to have for lunch. After some initial fundraising we were able to provide porridge consistently in term time throughout 2012. Unfortunately in 2013 we didn't have enough funds to supply it the whole year but we were able to provide it for 6 months. We also began paying a salary to a local woman to cook it in October as it became too much for the teachers to do it due to the fact the school is also under staffed. Since 2014 we have consistently provided porridge for the whole year through donations alone which is huge achievement.

Currently we have around GBP 130 of carry over donations to get us going into 2016 when the kids return to school after Christmas so we are fundraising again and asking for your help to spread the word of The Porridge Project so we can continue it through the next year. A 90kg sack of porridge currently costs us KES 5500 including transport from Narok to Maasai Mara. It costs approximately KES 200,000 ($2000/£1300) for us to provide the school with porridge for a whole year and pay the salary of a cook. 

Please help us spread the word of The Porridge Project and donate if you can so we can keep this initiative going for many years to come!

story:
Even though the campaign has closed, donations can still be made at:

www.creationresearch.org


Many people view dinosaurs as the classic proof of evolution and disproof of creation.

Evolutionists have certainly understood the value of using dinosaurs as a “propaganda tool.” They have effectively employed this tool in textbooks, science videos, and even popular movies. Students are not just taught about the anatomy and living habits of dinosaurs; from an early age they are taught dinosaurs lived millions of years ago. Even when our fascination for dinosaurs begins to fade, this “indoctrination” remains - dinosaurs evolved, Genesis is wrong.  But is it?  Watch this interview with Timothy Clarey, PhD author of 'Dinosaurs:  Marvels of God's Design'.


However, what if dinosaurs did not actually live 85 million years ago?  What if they did not become extinct almost 65 million years ago? What if humans and dinosaurs actually lived at the same time in earth’s history? What if the answer to these questions means that dinosaurs lived just a few thousand years ago?  Rather than being evolution’s “classic proof,” dinosaurs would be a major contradiction. 


New evidence has been discovered that challenges what we know about dinosaurs.  

In 2005 Dr. Mary Schweitzer published her discovery of soft-tissue found in a T-Rex femur. Her claims were controversial and sensational. Animal tissue (including cells and proteins) is very fragile.  How could dinosaur tissue survive millions of years? During an interview on 60 Minutes, Dr. Schweitzer stated that she was concerned about publishing her results about the soft recognizable tissue.  As she expected, her research received intense criticism from her evolutionary colleagues.  However, Dr. Schweitzer continued to publish, despite the controversy.   

The funny thing is so few people have even heard of the soft tissue controversy.  Watch this video to learn more about that.


You can download the article that Jim gives to the students he interviews HERE.

The Creation Research Society (CRS) commissioned a team to look for their own dinosaur specimens in hopes of finding soft-tissue.  On May 12, 2012 a horn from a Triceratops was excavated from the Hell Creek Formation (in Montana).  The researchers found that the horn also contained soft, pliable tissue. In 2013, Mark Armitage and Kevin Anderson published these findings in the journal Acta Histochemica, as well as the cover of American Laboratory, at the 2014 Microscopy & Microanalysis International Conference, and in the Creation Research Society Quarterly  (Spring, 2015 issue).  (See http://tinyurl.com/nphm2c4 for more information about the CRS project.)

The following short video begins to tell the story surrounding dinosaur soft tissue.  

CRS and Evidence Press, Inc. (EPI) have teamed up to create a documentary running about 90-minutes in length.  This documentary will discuss Dr. Schweitzer's discoveries and the CRS triceratops horn analysis.  It will also address many questions such as, how and why the dinosaurs were buried so suddenly, issues about how fossils are dated, and common objections to the Creation / Flood model.  

What Is Needed

There is still much work to be done such as editing the dozens of hours of film from multiple camera angles and mix it with graphics, music, titles, and narration. Success of raising $25,000 will enable us to develop a professional quality video production.

Throughout the documentary there will be visuals to help tell the story.   For example watch the clip below.


The graphics in the above video are produced in a 3D graphical program.  We are all accustomed to watching amazing graphics and we need to include them in this documentary.  However, motion graphics are expensive and time consuming to produce.  Your support will help us develop high quality graphics for Echoes of the Jurassic.

Another significant cost will be for the licensing of 60 Minutes and BBC2 footage so the story of Dr. Schweitzer and her discoveries can be quickly and accurately told.   The BBC2 and 60 Minutes footage is very powerful and we would like to include a few minutes of it.  However, the licensing costs are substantial.  Once we meet our initial goal, additional money would be used to purchase such footage.  

What You Get

Your donations will enable completion of this documentary as a professional quality production.  There are several levels to choose from with a variety of amazing perks.  We encourage you to consider giving at more than one level and receive more than one perk.  You get more and so does the project. 

The Impact

When Dr, Schweitzer found soft and pliable tissue still remaining inside dinosaur fossils she immediately understood the significance.  Soft tissue is not supposed to exist in fossils found in rock layers dated to be 68 million years old!  Tissue simply should not last more than a few thousand years.  Yet, even more incredible, in a later publication Schweitzer revealed the discovery of intact bone cells called osteocytes and also the presence of proteins!  

Dr. Schweitzer has proposed several explanations for the survival of dinosaur tissue.  Echoes of the Jurassic  will discuss these and challenge her explanations with scientific evidence.  

Much is at stake.  If dinosaur fossils are only a few thousand years old, then the assumptions and methods used to date these fossils are flawed. This would draw into question the entire ‘millions of years’ evolutionary time-frame.  This would be nothing less than revolutionary!  It would rock the very foundation of the evolution establishment. The evidence from the Triceratops horn adds even more evidence in favor of it being real dinosaur soft tissue.  

People love a good story involving science.  They especially love empirical science (that which is testable and repeatable).  With the horn research, soft tissues in dinosaurs are being discovered from multiple fossils locations.  The Echoes of the Jurassic  documentary will provide corroborating evidence demonstrating that dinosaurs in rock layers dated to 65-million or more years are really only thousands of years old.  

Your gifts will fund this project so we can demonstrate to the world the real age of dinosaurs. 

Please feel free to contact us with any questions about the Echoes of the Jurassic video or about the donation 'perks' we are offering.  You can contact the Creation Research Society at crsvarc@crsvarc.com or by calling 928-636-1153.

Perk Lists

(Please note you will receive a follow-up e-mail from us asking for your choices from these lists.)

For example, the following video is a logical argument that natural causes cannot account for the first proteins.  Watch this video:

story:
Overview

TechShop is excited to announce the expansion of our highly successful STEAM (science, technology, engineering, art, math) program in an after-school format for 8- to 17-year-olds at our TechShop locations in North America. Our shops are one-of-a-kind, membership-based, DIY fabrication studios offering access to over $1 million worth of equipment. At TechShop, we want to make 1,000 scholarships available to any young person who wants to participate in the program . . . and we need your help to raise $650,000 to make this possible.

The goal of this campaign is to provide scholarships to youth would otherwise not have access to our summer or after-school STEAM programming. This type of educational curriculum, set in a fun and encouraging environment, is essential to cultivating creative and innovative thoughts in adults. 
With the help of our strategic partners and through the generosity of individuals like you, TechShop is prepared to match every dollar raised—even donations that exceed our goal!—to provide up to $1.3 million worth of scholarships to young people who want to learn how to become makers using STEAM principles and the cutting edge technologies that TechShop provides.
Please help us meet our goal by donating or sharing this campaign. Together we can help over 1,000 young minds!


TechShop STEAM Program

The world's leader in teaching makers of all ages and skill levels how to use cutting edge technologies, TechShop has a proven track record of highly successful and fun programs.

Our popular STEAM training program for youth consists of 30 hours of hands-on training in one of two distinct learning tracks:

  • Design and Build: Includes 30 hours of hands-on training and project fabrication, focusing on practices of industrial design and engineering

  • Arduino Robotics: Includes 30 hours of hands-on training and project fabrication centered around electrical engineering and programing

Along with each of the program tracks, TechShop provides Project Support workshops in which students can work on their projects with the dedicated support of TechShop Dream Consultants and staff.


What We Need to Make This Possible

Your support! We have always found creative ways to make TechShop an inclusive resource for anyone with a desire to explore making. In the past, this has included campaigns like our widely-acclaimed veterans training program, for which we raised $4.5 million and provided free annual memberships and classes to over 2,000 United States military veterans.

Your generous participation will enable us to accomplish the following to under-served youth in 2016:

  • Fund at least 1,000 individual student scholarships for TechShop STEAM programs

  • Provide an additional six months of TechShop membership and supervised lab time to each scholarship recipient


The Impact

We believe every kid should have access to the tools of innovation, like 3D printers and laser cutters, regardless of income or status. Everyone should have the opportunity to experiment, learn, and grow. Your financial support of this campaign will help us make that a reality. 

Following completion of 30 hours of training, learning and practicing STEAM concepts in the hands-on After-School STEAM Program, each scholarship recipient will receive six months of continued supervised access to the shop so that the students can reinforce and build on everything they have learned.

The impact of this program will reach far beyond the participants of the scholarship campaign. Every young person who enters the STEAM program will take inspiration and creativity back to their community and their peers. Programs like this are often kids' first introduction to design and engineering concepts not regularly taught in school. We hope to help inspire the next generation of great American inventors, artists, scientists, designers, engineers and makers. Thank you for your support.

If you would like to apply for a TechShop STEAM scholarship or you know of young makers deserving this scholarship, please submit your applications here.


The Perks!


The Sticker Pack


The Button

The Hat

The Book


The Plaque

Actual items may differ slightly in appearance.


The Partners & Sponsors
story_txt:
OverviewTechShop is excited to announce the expansion of our highly successful STEAM (science, technology, engineering, art, math) program in an after-school format for 8- to 17-year-olds at our TechShop locations in North America. Our shops are one-of-a-kind, membership-based, DIY fabrication studios offering access to over $1 million worth of equipment. At TechShop, we want to make 1,000 scholarships available to any young person who wants to participate in the program . . . and we need your help to raise $650,000 to make this possible.The goal of this campaign is to provide scholarships to youth would otherwise not have access to our summer or after-school STEAM programming. This type of educational curriculum, set in a fun and encouraging environment, is essential to cultivating creative and innovative thoughts in adults. With the help of our strategic partners and through the generosity of individuals like you, TechShop is prepared to match every dollar raised—even donations that exceed our goal!—to provide up to $1.3 million worth of scholarships to young people who want to learn how to become makers using STEAM principles and the cutting edge technologies that TechShop provides.
Please help us meet our goal by donating or sharing this campaign. Together we can help over 1,000 young minds!


TechShop STEAM Program
The world's leader in teaching makers of all ages and skill levels how to use cutting edge technologies, TechShop has a proven track record of highly successful and fun programs. Our popular STEAM training program for youth consists of 30 hours of hands-on training in one of two distinct learning tracks:
Design and Build: Includes 30 hours of hands-on training and project fabrication, focusing on practices of industrial design and engineering
Arduino Robotics: Includes 30 hours of hands-on training and project fabrication centered around electrical engineering and programing

Along with each of the program tracks, TechShop provides Project Support workshops in which students can work on their projects with the dedicated support of TechShop Dream Consultants and staff.


What We Need to Make This Possible
Your support! We have always found creative ways to make TechShop an inclusive resource for anyone with a desire to explore making. In the past, this has included campaigns like our widely-acclaimed veterans training program, for which we raised $4.5 million and provided free annual memberships and classes to over 2,000 United States military veterans.Your generous participation will enable us to accomplish the following to under-served youth in 2016:
Fund at least 1,000 individual student scholarships for TechShop STEAM programs 
Provide an additional six months of TechShop membership and supervised lab time to each scholarship recipient



The Impact
We believe every kid should have access to the tools of innovation, like 3D printers and laser cutters, regardless of income or status. Everyone should have the opportunity to experiment, learn, and grow. Your financial support of this campaign will help us make that a reality. 
Following completion of 30 hours of training, learning and practicing STEAM concepts in the hands-on After-School STEAM Program, each scholarship recipient will receive six months of continued supervised access to the shop so that the students can reinforce and build on everything they have learned.
The impact of this program will reach far beyond the participants of the scholarship campaign. Every young person who enters the STEAM program will take inspiration and creativity back to their community and their peers. Programs like this are often kids' first introduction to design and engineering concepts not regularly taught in school. We hope to help inspire the next generation of great American inventors, artists, scientists, designers, engineers and makers. Thank you for your support.
If you would like to apply for a TechShop STEAM scholarship or you know of young makers deserving this scholarship, please submit your applications here.

story:
Facebook      Instagram    youtube 

attocube website  | 한국어 구매 가이드 



As parents we worry that our children spend too much time playing with smartphones and tablets that aren't helping them develop important sensory and motor skills.


Attocube was created to help train the minds of young children, boosting creativity, problem solving, concentration and team work.

attocube.co.kr




               “Education is not the learning of facts,
                                        but the training of the mind to think”
-Albert Einstein


AttoCube integrates timeless classic wooden blocks with technology to create a smart toy that provides fun & entertaining educational games for children.

Attocube consists of cubes with all surfaces featuring different geometric patterns. Using patterns, any images such as letters and numbers can be created.

Attocube comes with Stand, Reflector Mirror Attachment, 9 wooden blocks, and 100 image cards.


Attocube in the press






               1. Start by clipping the reflector mirror on the smartphone or tablet 

                    you already own. 



               2. Then launch the free app to begin.



                             3. Start matching the cubes with the image on the screen.  

                                  The reflector mirror automatically recognizes the cubes.


                   

4. Congratulations!  You did it!



Compatibility Devices

iPad 2-4, iPad Air, iPad Mini & iPad Mini Retina
iPhone 6, iPhone 6+, iPhone 6S, iPhone 6S+

GALAXY S4-6, GALAXY S6 Edge, GALAXY Note 2-5 , GALAXY Tab 4 7.0 Jelly Bean

Reflector is attachable to / detachable from stand. 



  • Kids are spending more time playing with tablets and phones than with physical objects in the real world.  Online games can be educational but they alone are not sufficient to build important developmental skills, like motor skills, spatial, tactile awareness, dexterity, and sensory skills.
  • Educational toys play an important role in a child’s brain development, teaching them how to solve complex problems with novel solutions.
  • Eco-friendly!  Creates less waste on earth than toys made with plastic materials.
  • Made with all natural wood.  Wooden toys are classic and timeless.
  • 2.3 billion images to play with
  • Simple & Easy to follow
  • Promotes team play
  • Portable so you can play Attocube anywhere, anytime! 


Introduce your child to powerful, educational smart toy!


ATTOCUBE： Digital Meets Analog
Wooden cube blocks with different patterns on each side are connected to a smart device to offer fun and playful learning experience. Behind this interactive smart toy is ATTOCUBE， a local startup team of young 



- INFINITE NUMBER OF IMAGES

One set of Attocube consists of 9 same blocks, with each surface designed with different patterns. By arranging those 9 cubes into 3 by 3 square, you can create more than 2.3 billion different images.



Attocube has unlimited expandability. With more cubes, much bigger and much more diverse images can be created.  Each child can bring their own Attocube set to build bigger and more complex images together, teaching children collaboration and team work.



Watch how each attocube blocks are being made.

Attocube is made of European beech wood and is colored with non-toxic paints. The blocks are tested to meet high safety standards of Europe and carry the CE mark.



ATTOCUBE LAND!


















- CUBE


- CUBE CASE


- STAND / REFLECTOR

 






The whole team is working day and night to provide the best opportunity for children to learn through play. It is not just about making products but it is our vision and dream to provide children the best educational toy.








Q.  When will I receive Attocube?
A.   We want you to receive Attocube in time for Christmas so please expect to receive it by December 10, 2015.

Q.  What is Attocube made of?
A.  Attocube is made of all natural woods with non-toxic coloring to ensure safety for children.

Q.  Why did you choose to make Attocube with wooden materials?
A.   We wanted to make children's toy safe.  We understand wood is better suited for children compared to artificial materials often used in children's toys because it doesn't contain chemicals and lead that can negatively affect children's health.

Q.  What other development skills does Attocube help children develop?
A.  Unlike online toys, Attocube allows children to touch and feel physical blocks which helps children develop these important sensory, dexterity, spatial, and motor skills along with creativity, critical thinking, concentration, and teamwork. 

Q. Why don't you offer FREE SHIPPING?  Do you ship anywhere in the world? 
A. In order to offer Attocube with the lowest price possible, we could not include the Free Shipping option. However, we do ship to almost every country, with the lowest rate possible. We will provide the full listing as soon as possible. If you want to know if your country is available for shipping, please contact us. We will be happy to inform you :)

Q. How can i choose color I want?
A. After the Indiegogo campaign closes, we will contact each supporter for their choice of color and for customization options (ex. school name, organization etc.) 

(  If you need more details, please contact us : info@attocube.co.kr)

story:
Goals:

Want to make a difference in the lives of Hawaii's youth? The American Society of Young Musicians aims to instill a joy and passion for music through working directly with Hawaii's public and private schools as well as young local bands. ASYM director Gerardo "Jerry" Velez has an extensive history in the musical fabric of America--playing with greats such as Jimi Hendrix, Spyro Gyra, Stevie Wonder and Elton John. Thus, Gerardo's expertise in the music industry positions those in the ASYM program to take their success to the next level both in skill and reach.  All donations to the American Society of Young Musicians will directly fund the purchase of the instruments, technology, and marketing necessary to empower Hawaii's blooming musicians and take their dreams far beyond the borders of the Hawaiian Islands. 

What We Need:

  • An array of musical instruments for school programs and aspiring artists.
  • Funding for events featuring ASYM artists and students
  • Funding to support ASYM staff, office, and storage space

What You Get:

  • Limited Edition signed photos of Gerardo Velez and Jimi Hendrix at Woodstock
  • Limited Edition photos of Gerardo Velez with Stevie Wonder and Patti LaBelle
  • Baseball caps, Men's and Women's t-shirts
  • Limited, signed Latin Percussion Shaker Eggs
  • Vintage, autographed poster from the 25th anniversary of the Woodstock Festival 

The Impact

Young musicians will learn both musical skill and the ins and outs of the music business through:

  • A platform of resources available to ASYM members 
  • Taking part in the planning of ASYM sponsored events
  • Mentorship from established individuals in the music industry

Risks & Challenges

The American Society of Young Musicians is a relatively young charity organization in the state of Hawaii. However, many are already volunteering their time and efforts to support this organization. In addition, the charity is largely dependent on Mr. Velez. At present, Mr. Velez is personally funding many of ASYM's projects. This campaign aims to ease the personal burden on Mr. Velez through developing a community of leaders readily available to invest in Hawaii's musicians of tomorrow. Through the perseverance of ASYM staff, the participation of its students, and the funding raised in this campaign, the American Society of Young Musicians will achieve the influence necessary to put Hawaii's musicians on the map and prepare them for success.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love to hear from you! If you have unused musical instruments you would like to donate, music memorabilia you would like to contribute to the campaign, or would like to volunteer with ASYM, please contact: gerardo@asymhawaii.org

story:
BRIEF REVIEW

Hi, I'm Angel Irizarry, I am a Dominican Musician. Seeking to fulfill my biggest dream, I applied to the prestigious college of music, Berklee and got average academic scholarship.  I got some support from my country’s Ministry of Education and the Latin Grammy Foundation. Thanks to them, I completed the academic scholarship.

However, they still lack US$15,000 since this scholarship does not cover maintenance and must be enrolled for the 2016 Summer (by May) because the grant expires and I cannot let it pass.  So, because of this crucial reason, I decided to start a Pro-Fundraising Campaign with Indiegogo called “One Step For Angel 2.0”!  All the proceeds will be used to cover the necessary expenses. Hopefully, we will achieve, at least, a year for studying.

I've waited my whole life for this unique opportunity, and with your help and support, this will be possible and will become a reality. Your contribution will make a difference... and it will become a big step.

YOUR GIFT OF APPRECIATION:

I would like to show you my appreciation by offering guitar lessons! You can choose your class through different ways (Skype, Google Video) You can send me a message specifying what exactly would you like to achieve and I will do my best to teach you!

INVESTMENT OF COLLECTED FOUND

At this moment, the estimated goal is US$15,000.00.  Indiegogo will retain a part for the service agreement page.

With the remaining funds, I can pay for my first year of maintenance, as well as, travelling costs, local transportation, buy computers and software that requires Berklee, books, health insurance and other added expenses.

THE IMPACT

The music is a tie that binds people to people, from my early days as a student and as a teacher, I could see how it transforms people, and ultimately, I would like that my music transcends borders. With your help you will be helping to spread this universal language and transforming lives through music.

I am very grateful that Berklee has been fixed in my work, who has valued my talent and my compositions, it is a big commitment that I accept. I take great pride in my music and accept this great opportunity to demonstrate my roots and show the great artistic diversity of the Dominican culture.

I'm really anxious to see, with your help, the results of this career, to continue creating, composing, playing my music to feel the adrenaline that gives and the thrill of hearing the applause at each stage.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

After the first year, I shall be able to work and seek more opportunities to continue paying such expenses over the next years of the career. After all, at the end of this Indiegogo’s campaign first stage, they provide the option to continue raising funds through its associated page called InDemand.

Even if we cannot collect the necessary funds, I, at least, hope to be able to cover main registration costs, and after that, figure my way up by myself! 

You can help make a difference!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can also help me by sharing the link of my Indiegogo’s campaign,  “One Step For Angel 2.0”! .  Go to my site on these social networks, give me one "Like and Share" and use the #onstepforangel Hashtag through Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

There is no small contribution, your help give me a big push in my career.

BAND INFORMATION

http://instagram.com/carijazzrd

https://twitter.com/CarijazzRD

https://www.facebook.com/carijazzrd123 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JSPgWyrlADM

WHERE YOU CAN FIND ME?

https://www.instagram.com/angel.irizarry/

https://www.facebook.com/angel.irizarryalmonte

angelirizalm@gmail.com
