story:
"There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children."    — Nelson Mandela, Former President of South Africa

"It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men." 
  — Frederick Douglass, abolitionist and statesman

What is Tee It Up For Kids?

Tee It Up For Kids is a youth assistance initiative based on a simple, yet dynamic concept- tap the explosive growth of recreational, amateur and professional golf: outings, skills challenges, corporate, amateur and individual tournaments- at the local, state and national level- in effort to provide resources to prevent child abuse, assist those in need, build stronger, more resilient kids and create targeted success/leadership programs for our youth, especially our at risk youth. Yes- It's ambitious. But that's the way we roll.

By creating a strong cause, purpose and brand for participants to support behind the event, all can golf for a cause- NOT just because! Sponsoring organizations can attract more participation and donations than the typical non-charitable event, in turn driving awareness to their corporate brand, separating themselves in their marketplace, creating goodwill among participants and a keen sense of honor and contribution in their community. Best of all- Tee It Up For Kids will be generating much needed capital to support local, state and national youth initiatives and education! Everyone wins- especially the kids!

The Origin

Tee It Up For Kids has its roots in the very personal and career experiences of founder Michael R. Frazier, owner of Peak Talent Capital Solutions in Augusta, Georgia. Rising above childhood abuse and neglect, happiness and success became a mission along with the desire to be and achieve more than his past could have dictated for him. Ambition, enthusiasm, tenacity and his go for broke action mindset led him to develop himself further and rise in a career field that would make a true difference for others. His career path culminated in successful entrepreneurship and the ability to create more solid solutions for the issues close to his heart. 

Throughout his 28 year career in human capital management and solutions, he has been on the front lines- witnessing first hand the devastating effects a poor home environment, physical and mental abuse or the lack of positive soft skills development (behavioral traits) could have on children and youth as they attempted to grow or transition from school to work and progress in life. 

Committed to work diligently to help others less fortunate or capable rise above their own circumstances, the Tee It Up For Kids concept was born. We are proud to report that it was tested and passed with flying colors at its first corporate golf event in the Augusta, Georgia market in October 2015, with over 200 participants and business partners! It's a solid concept- and one that people truly care about.

The Plan

Your contributions will go into building the nationwide nonprofit assistance framework and core capabilities necessary to make the impact we feel (and if you've made it this far, you do as well) is necessary for a mission of this magnitude. Failure is NOT an option.

With your help, we will move rapidly with expansion plans including: A more robust website capable of event communication, planning, interaction and management along with increased social media campaign creation. Increased office space and talent will allow us to emphasize increased utilization of existing and proven leadership, branding, marketing, engagement, event and people management solutions to drive strong national outreach and delivery of solutions to business, business, golf professionals, private and semi-private courses, schools, professional clubs, community leaders and other organizations that would benefit from the Tee It Up For Kids initiative. 

Our mission is to successfully build the solutions and giving juggernaut necessary to tackle a problem that is overshadowed by other charitable initiatives, yet deserves much larger recognition. We must realize that today's youth are tomorrow's contributors, parents, workers and leaders. To deliver much needed youth assistance, charitable giving, creation of youth leadership programs and much more we must ensure this issue receives more prominence. We want this network of organizations and the necessary resources we're building to last, but we'll need your help to take it to the level necessary for sustainability and growth! Making a difference isn't easy-but it's necessary. Please join us and we will keep you updated through or e-Newsletter as we exceed our shared goals!

In addition, we will produce a documentary with the help of our friends at Peak Media, chronicling our vision, progress and the difference you're helping us make! Check out our Perks and how you can be shown gratitude for your generous donations! Come support us-you'll be glad you did.
story_txt: "There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children."    — Nelson Mandela, Former President of South Africa"It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men."   — Frederick Douglass, abolitionist and statesmanWhat is Tee It Up For Kids?Tee It Up For Kids is a youth assistance initiative based on a simple, yet dynamic concept- tap the explosive growth of recreational, amateur and professional golf: outings, skills challenges, corporate, amateur and individual tournaments- at the local, state and national level- in effort to provide resources to prevent child abuse, assist those in need, build stronger, more resilient kids and create targeted success/leadership programs for our youth, especially our at risk youth. Yes- It's ambitious. But that's the way we roll.By creating a strong cause, purpose and brand for participants to support behind the event, all can golf for a cause- NOT just because! Sponsoring organizations can attract more participation and donations than the typical non-charitable event, in turn driving awareness to their corporate brand, separating themselves in their marketplace, creating goodwill among participants and a keen sense of honor and contribution in their community. Best of all- Tee It Up For Kids will be generating much needed capital to support local, state and national youth initiatives and education! Everyone wins- especially the kids!The OriginTee It Up For Kids has its roots in the very personal and career experiences of founder Michael R. Frazier, owner of Peak Talent Capital Solutions in Augusta, Georgia. Rising above childhood abuse and neglect, happiness and success became a mission along with the desire to be and achieve more than his past could have dictated for him. Ambition, enthusiasm, tenacity and his go for broke action mindset led him to develop himself further and rise in a career field that would make a true difference for others. His career path culminated in successful entrepreneurship and the ability to create more solid solutions for the issues close to his heart. Throughout his 28 year career in human capital management and solutions, he has been on the front lines- witnessing first hand the devastating effects a poor home environment, physical and mental abuse or the lack of positive soft skills development (behavioral traits) could have on children and youth as they attempted to grow or transition from school to work and progress in life. Committed to work diligently to help others less fortunate or capable rise above their own circumstances, the Tee It Up For Kids concept was born. We are proud to report that it was tested and passed with flying colors at its first corporate golf event in the Augusta, Georgia market in October 2015, with over 200 participants and business partners! It's a solid concept- and one that people truly care about.The PlanYour contributions will go into building the nationwide nonprofit assistance framework and core capabilities necessary to make the impact we feel (and if you've made it this far, you do as well) is necessary for a mission of this magnitude. Failure is NOT an option.With your help, we will move rapidly with expansion plans including: A more robust website capable of event communication, planning, interaction and management along with increased social media campaign creation. Increased office space and talent will allow us to emphasize increased utilization of existing and proven leadership, branding, marketing, engagement, event and people management solutions to drive strong national outreach and delivery of solutions to business, business, golf professionals, private and semi-private courses, schools, professional clubs, community leaders and other organizations that would benefit from the Tee It Up For Kids initiative. Our mission is to successfully build the solutions and giving juggernaut necessary to tackle a problem that is overshadowed by other charitable initiatives, yet deserves much larger recognition. We must realize that today's youth are tomorrow's contributors, parents, workers and leaders. To deliver much needed youth assistance, charitable giving, creation of youth leadership programs and much more we must ensure this issue receives more prominence. We want this network of organizations and the necessary resources we're building to last, but we'll need your help to take it to the level necessary for sustainability and growth! Making a difference isn't easy-but it's necessary. Please join us and we will keep you updated through or e-Newsletter as we exceed our shared goals!In addition, we will produce a documentary with the help of our friends at Peak Media, chronicling our vision, progress and the difference you're helping us make! Check out our Perks and how you can be shown gratitude for your generous donations! Come support us-you'll be glad you did.

story:
What is ignis and why are we doing it


The idea behind ignis is simple - to provide a free tool to facilitate education, especially (but not exclusively) to kids of lower socioeconomic status while allowing the parents to be more involved in the process. 

In Ecuador and many other places, the current system is based on a diary notebook in which students write down which assignments they have. If the school wants to send a message to all the students and parents, they do so by printing it and giving a paper to each student to take home. All this implies costs for the students directly or indirectly, as well as for the environment. On top of this, many times those messages never get to the parents, and there is a notable lack of communication between parents and the school, which negatively affects the quality of the kids education.

In the schools with lack of resources, the kids write down their assignments in the same notebook they use for class. This can create confusion as parents can't identify the kid's assignments and can't review them. While most of the kids in these schools don't have cellphones, their parents do. We have talked to the parents in several of these schools and they all are very excited about the idea!

Keeping this in mind, we thought about providing a free learning tool that could complement, and eventually replace, the use of a diary/notebook to write down the assignments and the printed notifications. Specifically, ignis will work as follows:

  • Teachers will write down the assignments and the due date

  • Teachers will write down quizzes and the date they will be taken

  • Assignments and quizzes will show up for students

  • They will be able to sort them by date received and their due date

  • The school and teachers will be able to send announcements to either or both students and parents

  • The students and parents will be able to send messages back to the teachers and/or school.

The idea is to keep the tool as simple and as user friendly as possible. Our aim is to avoid that anyone has trouble using the platform while still providing an useful tool.




To start with, ignis will have five tabs: Homework, Quizzes, Announcements, Messages and Trophies. A description of each follows:

  • HOMEWORK: Shows the homework received classified by received date and due date. The student can select if it is ordered by most recent received date, or by closest due date.

  • QUIZZES: Shows the quizzes classified by received date and due date. The student can select if it is ordered by most recent received date, or by closest due date.

  • ANNOUNCEMENTS: This will be used for general announcements the school makes for students and their tutors. Special events, for example.

  • MESSAGES: Private interaction between teachers and students and/or tutors. Mainly designed to have an easy way of communication between teachers and tutors.

  • TROPHIES: There will be a set of achievements that a student can earn, for example a student that has checked all the homework during a month will complete that achievement and receive a symbolic trophy for it. In this tab will be shown the trophies that each student has, and will be possible to see among all the students of the school.


With your help we will be able to provide for free an easier, faster, more reliable and greener alternative to the current system used by students and their parents to keep track of assignments, while also providing teachers and schools to send communications directly to the students and/or parents.

We are convinced that ignis will be a useful tool for many students, parents, teachers and schools increasing the quality of their education. We would like to invite you to be part of this wonderful cause!

As time goes by, we will strive to keep improving the platform in order to offer a better, friendlier and more efficient tool.



What we need to make this possible


Remember that you can help not only by donating! Sharing this with other folks is very valuable and appreciated as well!

After researching and analyzing what is needed to bring this project to life, we have arrived to the conclusion that we need $9800, which will be spent as follows:

  • $5300 will be needed for platform development

    • Website in which the students and teachers register

    • App for both Iphone and Android

  • $2500 for increasing the awareness about the platform

    • Targeted Facebook ads

    • Hire representatives to visit schools

    • Printed materials

  • $1200 for establishing and maintaining the servers

  • $800  for covering Indiegogo’s and other fees



With this we should be able to provide ignis to many students in Ecuador, and hopefully internationally as well. If we don’t receive the totality of the funds, we will invest the amount received in building the platform, and try to raise the rest of the necessary funds in another way. We won't give up!

Any funds that go over the requested amount will be used to bring ignis to more people that will benefit from it!



What will you get back


Although we are sure you are contributing to help, and not to receive, we offer you the following perks as our way to thank you for your contribution:

  • $10 Everything counts!

You will receive a sincere thank you email for this great contribution!

  • $20 I am in!

 You will be mentioned in the website as a contributor and also a thank you email!

  • $35 Yay education!

Your name will be featured in the app randomly among the other donors with a small  message you would like to give to the kids!. Plus all the previous rewards!

  • $70 I love kids!

You will be able to try the app before it is released, and provide your valuable ideas on how to become even more helpful. Plus all the previous rewards!

  • $100 Free for everyone!

You will be featured permanently on the website as a top donor, along with a message for the kids, teachers, schools and/or parents. Plus all the previous rewards!

  • $200 Get involved!

You will be able to design a limited edition version of the app and give it to the school of your choice. Plus all the previous rewards!

  • $500 ignis fire!

You will receive a personalized thank you video from kids that have benefited from ignis. Plus all the previous rewards!



Risks & Challenges


We realize it can be challenging to get the teachers and students to trust, start using the platform and get used to it. Once some people start using ignis, with those experiences and references will be easier to get others on board. With what we have budgeted for raising awareness we believe this first steps will be overcome.

Another challenge would be to keep providing the service for an extended period of time, since it has it costs and ignis will be provided for free to everyone. That’s why we have decided to include a really small ad in the app to allow us to keep the project running.


If there is anything you would like to know or suggest, please don’t hesitate to get in contact with us!

We would like to thank you again for your contribution, be it monetary and/or with your time. Both are really AMAZING!

story: Diversity in Antwerp City is a free festival organized by schoolgoing youths. We think color, religious conviction or cultural background do not matter and that we stand stronger together. Antwerp city is becoming less tolerant towards diversity. We see more and more racism and discrimination and this goes hand in hand with more repressive measures. So as a group of young people from diverse backgrounds we came together to find a way to stop this development. That is why we are organizing a festival against racism and discrimination. Last year we started with 0 euro because we thought only our friends and family would come. But because the event went viral on Facebook, we had to empty our pockets (a big stage, artist fees, food trucks and drink stands, technicians, logistic support...) and our finances ended in red figures. To prevent this from happening this year and to accommodate the more than 1.000 people that already plead to attend on Facebook, we will need all the help we can get. And following the recent terrorist attacks in Paris and Brussels, we think more than ever it is important to bring people together to celebrate diversity. Every euro we raise can help us to make sure we can spread the message of tolerance and respect in these sad times.

story:
The Bush Babies Environmental Education is an environmental program that is offered at primary schools in communities that surround the Greater Kruger Park, teaching the learners about conservation and wildlife, creating an environmental literate community that is motivated to conserve wildlife and biodiversity for future generations.

 The campaign is important to us as we want to give the learners an opportunity to see what we are conserving, and why it is important to save wildlife by bringing the learners to an Eco nature reserve where they will be taken on game drives allowing them to interact with mother nature thus changing their behavior towards conservation. 

Your contributions will assist the Bush Babies to learn about conservation, and changing their view on how they see our wildlife, offering them an opportunity to grow and mature in nature.

The Bush babies need R 20 000.00 , which will be used to pay for the Bush Babies Environmental Bush Camp, including their accommodation, food, fuel, game drives, stationary, and educational gift hampers. 

By donating you will be assisting us to create an environmentally literate community, which will make wiser decisions with regards to wildlife conservation, enabling them to realise and acknowledge that wildlife conservation is important. Therefore you will be helping us educate the community.

The Bush Babies Environmental Bush Camp is valuable to everyone as we are doing this for conservation and uplifting the community, and educating them that they should conserve wildlife and conservation for the sake of future generations. Therefore your contributions will assist us to change the mindsets of communities that surround the Greater Kruger Park.

In the classroom the Bush Babies have learnt the importance of conserving wildlife, the behavior of the Bush Babies has changed tremendously as they are now able to tell you what is the important of a tree is, and coming from poor communities they need wood as a source of fuel by chopping down trees, the bush babies are planting more trees for the trees lost.

story:
Summary

The Swapping Community is the Best Place to Trade Stuff online. Goods and Services are directly exchanged for other Goods and Services. Join the SWAPPING COMMUNITY to list your unwanted items. And you can get items and services that you want, simply by trading them with others in the exchange. Registration is FREE, quick and easy. 

We are the Craigslist alternative, so “Why Pay For It, When You Can SWAP For It?” Are you a Plumber, Tutor,  Massage Therapist, Piano Teacher, or  Health Caregiver that would like to trade your services for another service, or maybe for a Laptop...? You’ve come to the right place!

You can swap whatever you have that you want to get rid of for items and services that others have. You have the option to create a WISH LIST of items you’re hoping to find, create a SWAP LIST of items you have that you’d like to swap with others, or create a SALES LIST of items you’d like to sell. We even have a FREE STUFF page that lists items that people just want to get rid of. When someone in the Swapping Community likes what you have to offer, they’ll contact you. It’s that easy.

We even have a feature on our website that helps our community find Swap-Meets and Yard Sales that are close to their location. So, Why Pay For It When You Can SWAP For It? 


What We Need & What You Get

Funds Raised will be used:

  • To build a professional website and create an App for our community.
  • Hire a Search Engine Optimization Expert.
  • Launch our campaign thru' Trade Fairs.


Risks & Challenges

Our major concern or issue is our service crashing, due to heavy traffic

  • We are hiring a professional to re-design our current website
  • We're hoping that funds raised will be sufficient to upgrade our service.

Other Ways You Can Help

If at this time you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help...

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remember please, to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You For Supporting Our Project.

story:
Hi there and welcome to the Indiegogo campaign for "Reckon Comics Magazine" the monthly comic Magazine! First and Foremost, we have a secret surprise for you, click here if you are interested, if not, please kindly read on. CLICK YOUR SECRET SURPRISE or CLICK FOR PARTNERSHIP


 

What is Reckon Comics Magazine?

Glad you asked! Reckon Comics Magazine is our monthly Digital and Comical Magazine that will highlight on different criteria of life events and activites in high schools and colleges." Gays ain't Fags, Bullies are the Fags is our 1st ever edition: It is the comical story of how a popular high school boy finally came out of the closet about being gay, and how he faced humiliation, rejection and life threatening bully even from his friends and teammate, but yet he survived all that brutality of his anti-gay school mates with positive approach.


 

So... really. What is this? 

It's a Comic Long Magazine!

Reckon Comic Magazine is a monthly digital and comical magazine for all LGBTQ communities in High Schools and Colleges to showcase their talents, activities, creativity, life events and romance to the world in Digital and Life format.

Reckon Comic Magazine is currently running a campaign on indiegogo to raise funds to launch and publish the Reckon Comic Magazine 1st edition. Here is the campaign link www.indiegogo.com/projects/reckon-comics-magazine-for-all-lgbtq-communities/x/7814737#/

Reckon Comic Magazine consists of both Comical and Digital format, so readers can read the magazine in both formats including LGBTQ students, teachers and celebrities live interviews, talent and project launching, Comical stories of both fiction and nonfiction; and romance chapter all buckle up in 150 coloured pages of Reckon Comic Magazine.

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/reckon-comics-magazine-for-all-lgbtq-communities/x/7814737#/


The Comic magazine is a 150 page comic Magazine in full color with 5 sections, filled with monthly editions of hilarious, awkward, and true stories about life events in high schools and colleges. 

It is educational, entertaining and socially enabled and situable for all ages.

The 1st Section is called PROs & CONs: This section will consists of 10pages and speaks of the talented professionals, the Nerds and the Hackers in High Schools and Colleges. There will be a monthly interview that will be conducted to special students from different schools to speak of their works, experiences and talents.

The 2nd Section is called "PROYECTO CAMPAÑA": This section consists of 10 pages and speaks of big projects that students have to showcase to the world. The project could come in Science, Technology, Art, Entertainment and Charity.

The 3rd Section is called "THE STORY": This section is in Comic Format and consists of 50 pages, it will speak of different story every month. The 1st story is titled "Gays ain't Fags, Bullies are the Fags". The next story for the upcoming month will be titled "Professor NerdChick". The stories are full of suspense, intrigued and laughter. Watch out.


The 4th Section is called "WAZ UR FLAVOUR?": This is a paid promotional pages for marketing and advertising of companies, products and services, and it consists of 7 pages. 

The 5th Section is called "360°": This section consists of 2 pages and its only for Jokes, Riddles, Essays and Quotes.


How will the funds be used?

The estimated plan of the funds is as follows:

1. PATENT &TRADEMARK REGISTRATION OF THE COMIC MAGAZINE. 

2. ISBN REGISTRATION NUMBER

3. 1ST EDITION PRE-LAUNCH

4.  FIRST 5000 COPIES PUBLISHING FOR MARKETING

5. CARTOONIST FEES (PDP GROUP)


The 1st Edition has been sheduled to be published on July if the funds are completed.

"Reckon Comic Magazine" is produced and founded by Jaguar Intel Corporation. 


"Reckon Comic Magazine" is raising funds of $35,000 in indiegogo to start the Comic Magazine. Your support and contribution will be highly appreciated.

We have amazing perks of interest JUST FOR YOU. Why don't you check it out?

Here is the campaign link www.indiegogo.com/projects/reckon-comics-magazine-for-all-lgbtq-communities/x/7814737#/Reckon Comic Magazine consists of both Comical and Digital format, so readers can read the magazine in both formats including LGBTQ students, teachers and celebrities live interviews, talent and project launching, Comical stories of both fiction and nonfiction; and romance chapter all buckle up in 150 coloured pages of Reckon Comic Magazine.https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/reckon-comics-magazine-for-all-lgbtq-communities/x/7814737#/The Comic magazine is a 150 page comic Magazine in full color with 5 sections, filled with monthly editions of hilarious, awkward, and true stories about life events in high schools and colleges. It is educational, entertaining and socially enabled and situable for all ages.The 1st Section is called PROs & CONs: This section will consists of 10pages and speaks of the talented professionals, the Nerds and the Hackers in High Schools and Colleges. There will be a monthly interview that will be conducted to special students from different schools to speak of their works, experiences and talents.The 2nd Section is called "PROYECTO CAMPAÑA": This section consists of 10 pages and speaks of big projects that students have to showcase to the world. The project could come in Science, Technology, Art, Entertainment and Charity.The 3rd Section is called "THE STORY": This section is in Comic Format and consists of 50 pages, it will speak of different story every month. The 1st story is titled "Gays ain't Fags, Bullies are the Fags". The next story for the upcoming month will be titled "Professor NerdChick". The stories are full of suspense, intrigued and laughter. Watch out.The 4th Section is called "WAZ UR FLAVOUR?": This is a paid promotional pages for marketing and advertising of companies, products and services, and it consists of 7 pages. The 5th Section is called "360°": This section consists of 2 pages and its only for Jokes, Riddles, Essays and Quotes.How will the funds be used?The estimated plan of the funds is as follows:1. PATENT &TRADEMARK REGISTRATION OF THE COMIC MAGAZINE. 2. ISBN REGISTRATION NUMBER3. 1ST EDITION PRE-LAUNCH4.  FIRST 5000 COPIES PUBLISHING FOR MARKETING5. CARTOONIST FEES (PDP GROUP)The 1st Edition has been sheduled to be published on July if the funds are completed."Reckon Comic Magazine" is produced and founded by Jaguar Intel Corporation. "Reckon Comic Magazine" is raising funds of $35,000 in indiegogo to start the Comic Magazine. Your support and contribution will be highly appreciated.We have amazing perks of interest JUST FOR YOU. Why don't you check it out?

story:
Our Story

Arkansas Circus Arts is a community, professional performance group, and Circus Arts studio in Little Rock, AR whose mission is to build community and wellness through Circus Arts and playful movement. We wish to enrich the culture and health of our community through providing a safe space for circus arts for youth and adults here in Arkansas! 

We've been looking for the perfect place to call home and we've finally found it in downtown Little Rock (conveniently located off 630 and close to MacArthur Park).  ACA is currently renting space at CrossFit Little Rock. While this has been a fabulous location and relationship for us, it's time to expand! We want to offer more to the community and having our own studio space will truly allow us to serve our community more fully. 

ACA is a grassroots, community driven organization. We would not exist without the contributions our community makes through attending classes and booking our performers for events. Our goal is to make Circus Arts and unique forms of exercise accessible to more Arkansans including at-risk and underprivileged youth, persons with special needs, and out-of-town students who may not normally be exposed to Circus or have access to safe instruction. 



What We Need & What You Get

We began remodeling  our new downtown Little Rock location several months ago and we are so close to being done! The building (like most older downtown buildings) needed some work to make it feel like home and to meet building code requirements. 

Would you consider donating a small gift or sum to assist us in getting there? We do not consider ourselves a "big-top" Circus and we are not heavily funded by private groups. ACA is funded by the people, FOR the people of Arkansas. In return for your gift, you will receive ACA swag, T-shirts, private lessons, group classes, parties, or entertainment for your event! 

To give you an idea of what it takes to create a safe and top-notch Circus Center for the community, here's a breakdown of the costs we are looking at for the remainder of remodeling and equipment. This list does not include everything we would like to purchase for the studio or decor such as furniture, fabric, and art to make the studio feel warm and welcoming to children and adults. 


  • Space Renovation Break-Down & Equipment Costs

    Demo walls @ bathrooms, remediate/remove mold $400

    Framing @ restrooms $700

    Framing @ mechanical closet, fur out @ exposed duct $700

    Sheetrock at new stud walls, tape and mud $250

    ADA comliance issues, grab bars, fixtures $200

    Provide/install water bottle filler $100

    Toilet paper holders, towel dispensers, soap, mirrors, signage $200

    Lift rental $400

    Prime, texture, and paint $600

    Caulk & air seal walls  $300

    Mirror (glass)  $1,047

    Pull Up Rig  $850

    Sprung Subfloor/sqft (600sqft)  $3,726

    1/2" MDF/sqft (600sqft) $372

    Marley/sqft (600sqft)  $1,758

    Barre 16' Double Barre  $365

    Barre 8' Double Barre  $219

    Crash Mats  $2,450

    Insurance  $5,445

    Rigging Equipment  $500

    Fitness Poles  $770

    Pole Crash Mats  $600

    Little Giant Ladder  $300 

    Gym Rings  $144

    TOTAL RENOVATION COST $22,409



Campaign Funding Perks!!

$5 - Thanks You! Social Media Shout-Out

$10 - Sticker

$25 - Sticker & Aerial Fitness Class

$50 - Sticker & T-Shirt

$75 - Sticker, T-Shirt, Invitation to Soft Opening Party

$100 - Sticker, T-Shirt, Aerial Private Lesson

$250 - Sticker, T-Shirt, Birthday Party Entertainment! (Stiltwalker & Hooper/Juggler/Clown/Character)

$250 - Sticker & T-Shirt, 2 Aerial Private Lessons, Unlimited Open Gym for a month

$500 -  Sticker, T-Shirt, Unlimited Classes & Open Gym for a month (aerials included)

$1000 - Circus Party in the New Space! - Includes entertainers, DJ, group hoop lesson, group aerial lesson, group juggling lesson, circus party games



What happens if we don't reach our goal? 
ACA will put all money donated through our campaign towards the above renovations and equipment. All money donated is put towards community use. 

The Impact

Arkansas is one of the most obese, one of the poorest, and least educated states in the U.S. Many children and adults do not have access to unique and fun forms of exercise such as Acrobatics, Aerial Arts, and other Circus/Flow Arts. We truly believe that Circus changes lives. By learning to juggle balls, an adult might find it easier to juggle different responsibilities or stressors in their life. Handstands can help you find balance when other areas of life may not seem that way. Circus Arts and playing in general are healing for the body, mind, and spirit (especially for adults!). We want to share that healing with our home state. ACA is the only Circus education center of its kind in Arkansas. 

Even a contribution of $5 can make a difference in our campaign! No amount of money is too small. 

We are hoping to open our new space this Spring just in time for Circus Summer camps! 

Having a space is SO important for the community- it allows artists a safe place to train, it allows teachers a space to teach and support themselves, and it will allow us to offer more art to the state. 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, that's okay! You can still help us in the following ways: 

  • Share our campaign on social media platforms! Ask your friends to contribute
  • Send us a message or an email about upcoming volunteer opportunities: arkansascircusarts@gmail.com
  • Share our Facebook page and Social Media links to get awareness going about who we are!

story:
Who are we?:


Kristen, Compton and Kevin are three individuals from very different backgrounds that have come together to provide a physical space for collaborative projects of all different styles. Over the past year, we have worked tirelessly to build our community and we have hit a point where the need for our services and use of our space has outgrown the capabilities of our current location. We feel strongly about the need for a truly INCLUSIVE venue in New York City as we have watched many of the outlets for new art and music disappear or become inaccessible over the past decade.

What have we done so far?:

Backdrop Brooklyn has become a safe, comfortable space for hundreds of artists and musicians of all genres and disciplines to come to create and collaborate on projects of all types. 

Backdrop has become an all inclusive creative hub for the following services:

  • Rehearsal space for bands
  • Recording for music projects
  • Photo and video shoots and production
  • Visual art shows
  • Film screenings
  • Workshops and seminars
  • Weekly jam sessions

Links to examples of our work can be found on:

YouTube

Soundcloud


Moving forward - what does the future hold?:

We currently are running all of these events and services out of just ONE ROOM!

Our new space will allow for a separate sound proof recording studio, soundproof rehearsal studio and separate event and production space. This will allow us to run all of these services simultaneously to meet the growing demand as our community continues to expand. 

We need your help to be able to continue to provide accessible creative services and outlets to all of the super talented people here in New York City.




What We Need & What You Get


No Donation is too small!! And we have perks from merchandise to services for all price ranges.
We need to raise $60,000 to get us into a bigger space. This will cover the large security deposit required to obtain a lease on a commercial space, as well as building materials and equipment that we need to be fully functional.
The perks will be focused mainly on services in the new space, but for anyone from out of town that can't make it to us, we also have merchandise and media for you to enjoy. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still use every dollar towards securing the physical space and building as much as we can to be as functional as possible.


The Impact


New York City has long been known as the creative center of the entire world; however, due to changing economic landscapes over the last decade there has been a major loss of INCLUSIVE creative spaces. This has left many young visionaries without a home to express themselves. Since opening, we have heard from our community constantly how important it is for them to have finally found a place where they can see their creative projects come to life. The diverse population that Backdrop is servicing has also helped the artists and musicians grow and influence each other past certain boundaries and limitations.
We have exceeded our own expectations and reached more people quicker than we had originally dreamed possible. We have had an overwhelming positive response and we know that we will continue to grow with a bigger space.




Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate then you can still help by sharing our campaign and other media with anyone and everyone that you feel would care as much as we do about continuing to provide accessible creative outlets for all of the amazingly talented people of New York City.

story:
The Opportunity

Scotiabank CONCACAF Champions League provides an opportunity to showcase world-class soccer and a chance to celebrate the game’s inherent power as a catalyst for positive change. Sounders FC is teaming up with Seattle International Foundation (SIF) to tackle youth homelessness though community-building activities and projects in conjunction with Sounders FC Champions League quarterfinal matches vs. Club America.

Sounders FC and SIF will work locally with Street Soccer Seattle and abroad with Street Soccer Mexico to reinforce each organization’s collective mission to leverage the game of soccer to empower homeless youth. Outreach efforts will include youth clinics in Seattle and Mexico City, as well as financial commitments to support long-term community interventions in each region. Former Sounders FC star Gonzalo Pineda and Director of Community Outreach Roger Levesque will be leading the soccer clinics with homeless youth in Seattle and Mexico City. 

Here's more on what Street Soccer Seattle brings to our community.


The Fundraiser

Sounders FC and SIF are thinking BIG. Engaging in an authentic way and making a lasting impact is of the utmost importance, which to us means not only on-the-ground inspiration, but long-term capacity building to facilitate change.
Our fundraising goal is $40,000, to be split between Street Soccer Mexico and Street Soccer Seattle. These grants will be used to fund the following projects:

Street Soccer Mexico
  • Having already established eight developmental leagues serving homeless populations in Mexico City, Street Soccer Mexico is a leader among 'Street Soccer' organizations worldwide. This grant would allow expansion into an already identified marginalized community to implement a 12-month intervention for youth in Mexico City.
  • Interventions are need-based, but can include access to social housing programs and health services, conflict resolution, school retention, skills training for improved job prospects, or treatment for drug addictions.

Street Soccer Seattle
  •  Street Soccer Seattle's biggest needs are twofold: 1) a physical space for day-to-day operations to establish consistency for the youth that they serve and 2) resources to increase capacity and expand programming to reach more youth and better address their needs.
  • In addition to providing the stability of a permanent space, this grant would provide resources for Street Soccer to hire a Program Manager, an individual dedicated to the expansion of programs  based on shared-knowledge and lessons learned from Street Soccer Mexico.

A portion of the proceeds will subsidize Seattle Sounders FC and Seattle International Foundations travel expenses to Mexico City to engage Street Soccer Mexico and the homeless youth that they serve. Watch this video to see how Street Soccer Mexico is positively affecting lives in Mexico City.



Passion for our team. Compassion for our community. We are Sounders FC. Join us!

story:
Getting Started

Guess what! It’s that time again. We’ve almost reached the end of the test results from the first fundraiser, 5 Oils 10 Companies, so now it’s time to get started on the second one.


Why do I want to start a second fundraising campaign?

I am still overwhelmed by your positive comments as well as your funding support from the first fundraiser. Our goal was $10,000 to test 5 oils from 10 companies. All of you surpassed the goal with $12,340 donated and we were able to test 5 oils from 18 companies.

It could not have happened without your amazing support!


What is at the heart of this campaign?

We all love essential oils. We love using them, smelling them, and studying them. We want the best we can buy at an affordable price. All of us, company and consumer alike, want to know that the essential oils we depend on meet the basic expectation of purity.

There is a balance of trust throughout the essential oil supply chain. Consumers trust their companies. Companies trust their suppliers.  Suppliers trust their distillers. When tests of all the oils from a company show there are no adulterations, it keeps the trust throughout the chain. But when an adulteration is found, either intentional or unintentional, the trust is broken. That is when the dialogue can begin. In the first round of testing, we invited companies to be part of an open and frank dialogue with the consumers. We asked: How did it happen? Where is the break in the chain of trust? Can I trust this company? What will the company do now to fix it? Those discussions were informative, respectful, and did much to bring company and consumer together.

Third party testing serves as a necessary part of the system of checks and balances. It benefits consumers, it benefits the reputable companies, and it benefits the honest suppliers. Independent testing run by consumers helps keep the system of checks and balances running smoothly. However, while we need GC tests to help us see the purity of the oils, these tests can be expensive for any one individual to pay for. That is why we need this fundraiser.

What did we learn from the first round of essential oil testing?

  1. There are some companies who care a great deal about integrity.

  2. Of the companies we tested, the problematic oils that were uncovered were adulterated by suppliers to the companies rather than the companies themselves. This was interesting.

  3. All the Vetiver oils that were sourced from Sri Lanka were adulterated. None of the Vetiver oils from other countries were adulterated. That raises questions that should be pursued further.

  4. All of us learned more about GC testing — how to read the test results and how to use those test results for ourselves.

  5. There are some amazing and positive things that can be accomplished when the community works together.

  6. The presentation of testing results is critical. We scraped by in the beginning with posting the first round of results on Facebook. But the sheer number of test results became too messy and hard to access. I set up the  Essential Oils Awareness  website to alleviate the challenges of posting and storing documents on Facebook. There you can truly see the tremendous amount of information that was gathered by the first fundraiser, as well as what can be accomplished through this fundraiser. 

What is the fundraising goal?

The target goal of $20,000.00 (USD) will facilitate the testing of 5 oils from 30 different companies. How exciting is that?! The amount of information all of us can gather from that will be priceless.

Any amount can be donated whether it be $5, $50, $5,000 or the entire amount. Whatever you can give will be more than welcome. And take note, the more money sent in, the more oils I can test. 

Who can donate?

Anyone! Essential oil customers, company owners, friends, family, foes, and random people who just like to donate to fundraisers. All money will be pooled together no matter who it came from and it will all be used together. 

How will the testing be run?

When the fundraiser ends, the 30 companies with the most nominations will be tested.  5 oils from each company will be sent to a reputable essential oil chemist for GC/MS testing. All test results, good or bad, will be made public.

Let me say that again. All test results, good or bad, will be made public.

If a test comes back showing an adulteration, the company in question will be notified privately and given three days to handle the issue themselves and then the test result along with the company’s response will be published for all to see on the Essential Oils Awareness website. 


What is the plan for choosing companies, essential oils, ordering, etc?

Because it worked so beautifully the first time, the plan is to do things in the same way on this testing run:

1. Companies: In the first fundraiser, 27 companies were nominated and because of your generous donations, I was able to test 18 of them. However, that leaves 9 companies that were nominated and not tested. Out of respect for the previous donors, those companies are automatically transferred to this fundraiser and their previous votes will be tallied with the final results.  

The companies already tested on the first fundraiser are not eligible for nomination in this fundraiser. They are as follows:

  • Apothecary Shoppe
  • Appalachian Valley
  • Aromatics International
  • Aura Cacia
  • Barefut
  • Eden Botanicals
  • Edens Garden
  • Essential Oil Exchange
  • Essential Wholesale
  • Gritman
  • Jade Bloom
  • Majestic Pure
  • Mountain Rose Herbs
  • Nature's Gift
  • Now Solutions
  • Organic Infusions
  • Oshadhi
  • The Essential Oil Company

 — As multi level marketing (MLM) companies are being tested by other 3rd party testing groups at this time, I will not be testing any on this testing run.  Those results can be found on the Essential Oils Awareness website. (These companies are Young Living, doTERRA, Melaleuca, AMEO, GoDesana, ItWorks, Scentsy, Essante, Forever Young, Be Young, Youngevity, Nature's Sunshine, Neal's Yard Remedies, Simply Aroma. These are the ones I know of.)

 — While you may, of course, nominate smaller companies, the best ones to nominate will be those who are selling more than 20 single oils, because it will be easier to compare the same oils from company to company.


2. Essential Oils: I will buy specific oils from the companies — the same oils from each company — to be tested, which allows us to compare results across companies. These will be some of the top ones that are most often adulterated. The oils chosen will be ordered by botanical name, not common name, so there will not be any mix-ups. Just like on the first fundraiser, the orders will be sent directly to the chemists and will be opened by the chemists, not by myself. I want to keep the chain of custody completely intact. And as much as I would rather not, I will once again have to keep the list of oils tested anonymous as well. This keeps the companies from looking for orders containing those specific 5 oils. (I will not be testing the exact same ones as the first testing run.) 

3. Purchasing: The companies will not know who is buying the oils from them. The orders will be done so they will not have my name on the orders. When needed, they will be shipped to a person who does not appear to have any connection to myself and will be forwarded, UNOPENED, to the chemist. The chemist and the company will be the only ones who will touch the bottles in any way. I will obtain from the chemist a statement saying that the oil packages came to them unopened.

Once again, this is to keep things fair. It will give every company a fair chance and will make sure that what is in their actual stock is what is sent in to the chemist. It will also preserve the chain of custody and keep it above reproach.

4. Results: As I have stated before, all test results will be public. Every single one of them. It won't matter if they are good or bad. They will be public. If a company has a bad test or two or even all five, I will notify them of the bad results and they will be given 3 business days to respond. Then the results will be made public. They can choose to announce it themselves and handle the publicity first. They can choose to give me a response to publish with the results. They can also choose to not respond at all. That will be up to them. Regardless of what they do, I will still make the test results public.

5. Agenda: No private agendas are allowed in this testing venture. This means that no donor — company or consumer — can manipulate the process. The chemist will give his written conclusions of the test results and if there is anything unclear or if a report somehow slips through the cracks without the chemist's conclusions, I will make sure to check with the chemist first before posting.


Are there perks for donating?

Yes! I want you involved in more ways than just financially. Just like with the first one, donations of certain amounts give you a specific number of companies you can nominate to be tested. Beginning with $25.00, there are seven levels of perks and with each level, you will be able to nominate essential oil companies to be tested.

  • Level 1: $25 — 1 nomination

  • Level 2: $50 — 2 nominations

  • Level 3: $100 — 5 nominations

  • Level 4: $200 — 10 nominations

  • Level 5: $300 — 15 nominations

  • Level 6: $400 — 20 nominations

  • Level 7: $500 — 30 nominations


When you have sent in your qualifying donation, you will receive an email within one week asking for your nominations. You may vote multiple times for one company or distribute votes among multiple companies. It is your choice. The more you donate, the more nominations you can make!

 — Because of the nature of this testing and the need to keep it honest and aboveboard, company donations are not eligible for making nominations.


The Impact

Through this independent testing, we will all be able to band together as consumers and companies to keep the chain of trust intact from distiller to consumer. We can begin a movement to find more ways to help the essential oil community.


Things to take note of

This testing run is for companies you love or are interested in or have questioned. This is to help us all have a better understanding of the purity of their oils as well as the quality of the company.

There is no guarantee that the company you nominate will be selected. Nor is there any guarantee that your favorite company will pass all of the tests. What these tests will do is make sure you have more information to work with when it comes to the companies you choose from.

As the money to pay for the testing will be pooled together, there will be no private testing for any individual or company.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that for some of you, it is very difficult to contribute to this campaign but you still want to participate. I can understand that! So please, help all of us by getting the word out.

  • Make some noise about this campaign.

  • Share our campaign on your social media sites.

  • Try the indieGoGo share tools.

  • Invite your friends to contribute. Let's see how many people we can get involved.

And that's all there is to it. Separately, we are weak. Together, we are strong. We have already started a positive change to the essential oil community with the first testing run. Come and join us! Let’s keep it going!
story_txt:
Getting Started
Guess what! It’s that time again. We’ve almost reached the end of the test results from the first fundraiser, 5 Oils 10 Companies, so now it’s time to get started on the second one. 
Why do I want to start a second fundraising campaign?
I am still overwhelmed by your positive comments as well as your funding support from the first fundraiser. Our goal was $10,000 to test 5 oils from 10 companies. All of you surpassed the goal with $12,340 donated and we were able to test 5 oils from 18 companies.
It could not have happened without your amazing support! 
What is at the heart of this campaign?

We all love essential oils. We love using them, smelling them, and studying them. We want the best we can buy at an affordable price. All of us, company and consumer alike, want to know that the essential oils we depend on meet the basic expectation of purity.
There is a balance of trust throughout the essential oil supply chain. Consumers trust their companies. Companies trust their suppliers.  Suppliers trust their distillers. When tests of all the oils from a company show there are no adulterations, it keeps the trust throughout the chain. But when an adulteration is found, either intentional or unintentional, the trust is broken. That is when the dialogue can begin. In the first round of testing, we invited companies to be part of an open and frank dialogue with the consumers. We asked: How did it happen? Where is the break in the chain of trust? Can I trust this company? What will the company do now to fix it? Those discussions were informative, respectful, and did much to bring company and consumer together.Third party testing serves as a necessary part of the system of checks and balances. It benefits consumers, it benefits the reputable companies, and it benefits the honest suppliers. Independent testing run by consumers helps keep the system of checks and balances running smoothly. However, while we need GC tests to help us see the purity of the oils, these tests can be expensive for any one individual to pay for. That is why we need this fundraiser.
 
What did we learn from the first round of essential oil testing?

There are some companies who care a great deal about integrity. 
Of the companies we tested, the problematic oils that were uncovered were adulterated by suppliers to the companies rather than the companies themselves. This was interesting.
All the Vetiver oils that were sourced from Sri Lanka were adulterated. None of the Vetiver oils from other countries were adulterated. That raises questions that should be pursued further. 
All of us learned more about GC testing — how to read the test results and how to use those test results for ourselves.
There are some amazing and positive things that can be accomplished when the community works together.
The presentation of testing results is critical. We scraped by in the beginning with posting the first round of results on Facebook. But the sheer number of test results became too messy and hard to access. I set up the  Essential Oils Awareness  website to alleviate the challenges of posting and storing documents on Facebook. There you can truly see the tremendous amount of information that was gathered by the first fundraiser, as well as what can be accomplished through this fundraiser. 



 

What is the fundraising goal?
The target goal of $20,000.00 (USD) will facilitate the testing of 5 oils from 30 different companies. How exciting is that?! The amount of information all of us can gather from that will be priceless. Any amount can be donated whether it be $5, $50, $5,000 or the entire amount. Whatever you can give will be more than welcome. And take note, the more money sent in, the more oils I can test. 
Who can donate?Anyone! Essential oil customers, company owners, friends, family, foes, and random people who just like to donate to fundraisers. All money will be pooled together no matter who it came from and it will all be used together. 

How will the testing be run?
When the fundraiser ends, the 30 companies with the most nominations will be tested.  5 oils from each company will be sent to a reputable essential oil chemist for GC/MS testing. All test results, good or bad, will be made public.
Let me say that again. All test results, good or bad, will be made public.
If a test comes back showing an adulteration, the company in question will be notified privately and given three days to handle the issue themselves and then the test result along with the company’s response will be published for all to see on the Essential Oils Awareness website. 
What is the plan for choosing companies, essential oils, ordering, etc?
Because it worked so beautifully the first time, the plan is to do things in the same way on this testing run:
1. Companies: In the first fundraiser, 27 companies were nominated and because of your generous donations, I was able to test 18 of them. However, that leaves 9 companies that were nominated and not tested. Out of respect for the previous donors, those companies are automatically transferred to this fundraiser and their previous votes will be tallied with the final results.  
The companies already tested on the first fundraiser are not eligible for nomination in this fundraiser. They are as follows:


Apothecary Shoppe


Appalachian Valley


Aromatics International


Aura Cacia


Barefut


Eden Botanicals


Edens Garden


Essential Oil Exchange


Essential Wholesale


Gritman


Jade Bloom

Majestic Pure

Mountain Rose Herbs

Nature's Gift

Now Solutions


Organic Infusions


Oshadhi

The Essential Oil Company


 — As multi level marketing (MLM) companies are being tested by other 3rd party testing groups at this time, I will not be testing any on this testing run.  Those results can be found on the Essential Oils Awareness website. (These companies are Young Living, doTERRA, Melaleuca, AMEO, GoDesana, ItWorks, Scentsy, Essante, Forever Young, Be Young, Youngevity, Nature's Sunshine, Neal's Yard Remedies, Simply Aroma. These are the ones I know of.)
 — While you may, of course, nominate smaller companies, the best ones to nominate will be those who are selling more than 20 single oils, because it will be easier to compare the same oils from company to company.

2. Essential Oils: I will buy specific oils from the companies — the same oils from each company — to be tested, which allows us to compare results across companies. These will be some of the top ones that are most often adulterated. The oils chosen will be ordered by botanical name, not common name, so there will not be any mix-ups. Just like on the first fundraiser, the orders will be sent directly to the chemists and will be opened by the chemists, not by myself. I want to keep the chain of custody completely intact. And as much as I would rather not, I will once again have to keep the list of oils tested anonymous as well. This keeps the companies from looking for orders containing those specific 5 oils. (I will not be testing the exact same ones as the first testing run.) 
3. Purchasing: The companies will not know who is buying the oils from them. The orders will be done so they will not have my name on the orders. When needed, they will be shipped to a person who does not appear to have any connection to myself and will be forwarded, UNOPENED, to the chemist. The chemist and the company will be the only ones who will touch the bottles in any way. I will obtain from the chemist a statement saying that the oil packages came to them unopened.
Once again, this is to keep things fair. It will give every company a fair chance and will make sure that what is in their actual stock is what is sent in to the chemist. It will also preserve the chain of custody and keep it above reproach.
4. Results: As I have stated before, all test results will be public. Every single one of them. It won't matter if they are good or bad. They will be public. If a company has a bad test or two or even all five, I will notify them of the bad results and they will be given 3 business days to respond. Then the results will be made public. They can choose to announce it themselves and handle the publicity first. They can choose to give me a response to publish with the results. They can also choose to not respond at all. That will be up to them. Regardless of what they do, I will still make the test results public.
5. Agenda: No private agendas are allowed in this testing venture. This means that no donor — company or consumer — can manipulate the process. The chemist will give his written conclusions of the test results and if there is anything unclear or if a report somehow slips through the cracks without the chemist's conclusions, I will make sure to check with the chemist first before posting.
Are there perks for donating?
Yes! I want you involved in more ways than just financially. Just like with the first one, donations of certain amounts give you a specific number of companies you can nominate to be tested. Beginning with $25.00, there are seven levels of perks and with each level, you will be able to nominate essential oil companies to be tested.

Level 1: $25 — 1 nomination
Level 2: $50 — 2 nominations
Level 3: $100 — 5 nominations
Level 4: $200 — 10 nominations
Level 5: $300 — 15 nominations
Level 6: $400 — 20 nominations
Level 7: $500 — 30 nominations

When you have sent in your qualifying donation, you will receive an email within one week asking for your nominations. You may vote multiple times for one company or distribute votes among multiple companies. It is your choice. The more you donate, the more nominations you can make!
 — Because of the nature of this testing and the need to keep it honest and aboveboard, company donations are not eligible for making nominations.

The Impact
Through this independent testing, we will all be able to band together as consumers and companies to keep the chain of trust intact from distiller to consumer. We can begin a movement to find more ways to help the essential oil community. 
Things to take note of
This testing run is for companies you love or are interested in or have questioned. This is to help us all have a better understanding of the purity of their oils as well as the quality of the company.
There is no guarantee that the company you nominate will be selected. Nor is there any guarantee that your favorite company will pass all of the tests. What these tests will do is make sure you have more information to work with when it comes to the companies you choose from.
As the money to pay for the testing will be pooled together, there will be no private testing for any individual or company. 
Other Ways You Can Help
I know that for some of you, it is very difficult to contribute to this campaign but you still want to participate. I can understand that! So please, help all of us by getting the word out. 

Make some noise about this campaign.
Share our campaign on your social media sites. 
Try the indieGoGo share tools.
Invite your friends to contribute. Let's see how many people we can get involved.
And that's all there is to it. Separately, we are weak. Together, we are strong. We have already started a positive change to the essential oil community with the first testing run. Come and join us! Let’s keep it going!

story:
On Monday, January 11th a fire destroyed the livelihoods of six families who had stores at the Ranomafana Village central market in Southeastern Madagascar.

There had been heavy rains earlier in the evening that had knocked out the power. When the rain passed, the power came back on, and a spark from a fuse box set the market ablaze. Community members used garden hoses and buckets of water to surround and contain the fire, but before they were able to put the fire out, several shops had been destroyed.

This damage comes at a particularly bad time as it is the rainy season in Madagascar and shelter is an absolute necessity in order to protect goods. The affected shops are the only source of income for many of these families. Some lost everything in the fire and none of the shop-keepers have the resources to rebuild the market structure or replace goods that have been lost or damaged.


The mayor of Ranomafana Village is working to assist the victims but resources in Madagascar, where the average income is less than $1.25/day, are limited.


The staff and researchers of the CentreValBio Research campus in Ranomafana have created this campaign to raise funds for assisting the shop owners who have lost their businesses. 

Below are short profiles of a couple of the shop owners and how they have been affected.
Alphine (pictured in the campaign's Pitch image)

Alphine sold a variety of packaged goods from her shop in the market and lost all of her supplies in the fire. On top of this tragedy, due to renovations at their home, she and her husband were storing personal belongings, including furniture and appliances, in the shop. Everything was lost in the fire.


Harilalaina

Harilalaina sells mainly spices (salt, sugar, cloves) and small packaged goods. The interior of her shop was entirely destroyed by the fire. She is renting a temporary stand from the town but it has to be hauled out every morning and back every evening. Being that it is the rainy season, her products are threatened with potential exposure to rain.

Two of the six stalls belonged to family members of Centre ValBio staff. It is our wish that these funds will help all of the affected families rebuild their businesses, and with enough funds, construct a safer and sturdier building like the newer, undamaged market building that Centre ValBio helped construct a few years ago (pictured below). Modernizing the rest of the market will help prevent future disasters. 

 
It is absolutely imperative that we raise as much money as possible as soon as possible as the community will not be able to recover without our immediate assistance. These families and the community simply do not have the resources to rebound from this disaster on their own. 

All at Centre ValBio and the Ranomafana community will be grateful for any contribution you can make toward rebuilding these livelihoods.

Centre ValBio was established by Dr. Patricia Wright in 2003 to facilitate science and conservation in one of Madagascar's most biodiverse rainforests, Ranomafana National Park. Centre ValBio works with national and international scientists to expand the understanding of Madagascar's unique plants and animals. CVB also works with the local communities toward improving their lives through education, health initiatives and the conservation of the natural world that surrounds them.

story:
Chaque mois, 18 000 enfants de 0 à 5 ans ne mangent pas à leur faim dans la grande région de Montréal. 

La Grande récolte pour les enfants (#GRPE) est une campagne de collecte de fonds annuelle pour aider les trois Moisson du grand Montréal à les nourrir. 

En tant que parrain de la GRPE, je lance ma propre petite récolte. Mon objectif est modeste comparativement à l'objectif total de 350 000 $ mais c'est avec des sous qu'on fait des dollars et ainsi de suite! Si chacun d'entre vous fait un don avant de quitter cette page, nous surpasserons l'objectif!

Voici 3 bonnes raisons de donner à la GRPE

  1. Un don de 10 $ à Moisson Montréal permet de nourrir un enfant pendant un mois. C'est un excellent investissement!
  2. Une saine alimentation chez les enfants favorise un bon développement et un bon état de santé à l’âge adulte. Vous contribuez donc à un avenir meilleur!
  3. Vous vous sentirez beaucoup mieux! Donner aux autres rend heureux, c'est prouvé! Alors achetez un café de moins cette semaine et faites un don à la GRPE!  

Où iront les dons?

Tous les dons serviront à acheter des denrées pour tout-petits et à les distribuer à des organismes communautaires qui apportent de l’aide alimentaire aux futures mamans et familles avec jeunes enfants.

Pour en apprendre plus sur cette campagne : http://www.granderecolte.com/

Message des Moisson :

« Moisson Montréal, Moisson Rive-Sud et le Centre de bénévolat et Moisson Laval travaillent au quotidien afin d'offrir, directement ou par le biais d'organismes partenaires, une aide alimentaire aux parents et enfants vivant dans la précarité. Toutefois, les dons en denrées pour nourrissons et bambins se font aussi rares que les besoins sont grands. Votre contribution à La Grande récolte pour les enfants nous permettra d'offrir davantage de ces produits réellement essentiels. »

story:
Dear Folks, I hope you will read this in a very fine spirit.  A close friend of mine Ms. Jyoti Rajput is facing difficulties in sailing through her difficult time.

From last four years she working as recruiter in Delhi, and at present drawing a salary some of approx US $ 360.00, every month. This amount is quite reasonably earning for those who are living alone/ single in India. She was living very happily.

But since October 2014 her life has changed very much. Her elder sister, with whom she is attached very much , had to leave her husband house with her two children (Pratistha (16 years ), and Shreyansh (9, Years)) due to extreme domestic violence. She just left her well off husband house to save her own and their children life.  She was suffering from last 16 years.

When elder sister came to her parents house nobody was ready to help financially or by any other means.  As they are fearing of that she would ask for her part in parental property.

The eldest daughter was already studying in class 10th DPS of her home town in 2014, her final exam was in March 2015. But she could not appear as they feared to go their home town, due to his father. She again took the admission in class 10th in DPS Aligarh.  DPS is an expensive school in India , but they had left with no choice as no school was ready to take the admission in class 10th due to rule of CBSE(Central Board of Secondary Education, Delhi, India). In India 10th is most basic education.

The fee of DPS Aligarh is something around US $ 1253.00/ per year (Rs. 84,000, however I am not sure about this figure but it may not be less than US $ 1050.00 (Rs. 70,000) for both the children, which need to paid on quarterly basis. They have already paid three quarters of fee from their saving and loan from their relatives, and the last quarter fee is due in January 2016.

Jyoti elder sister is also fighting legal case against husband. Fighting a legal court in India is tedious and timing consuming. Also it has its own expense. Honestly I am not aware about that expense.

Since the case  is in court her elder sister cannot work anywhere, as she would lose the compensation from her husband. She is also fighting the case for the custody of her children.

Another problem Jyoti has loan on her credit card of amount US $ 552.00 (Approx INR 37, 000). For which she is liable to pay a quite a portion of her salary. I am sharing the proof of loan , as a screen shot which she had share with me recently when I asked for the money as a proof that she has no money.

I understand that sharing of such information is not appropriate. So I am only sharing the relevant part of screen shot.

Now days Jyoti is working in two jobs to meet her and her sister and her children requirement, but still her total earning is simply not enough. As total early expenditure of four people with legal case and expensive DPS fee should be  approx US $ 7,762.00 per year ,  Where as Jyoti is earning US $ 5,300.00 per year,  after  doing two jobs

I can assure with personal experience that this family is bunch of good people and they are fighter against whatever the circumstances is.

Through this I would request you to help this family whatever way you may like.

What this family need as help 

Since, I am not aware about what would be appropriate suitable amount for this family. I am putting this figure as US $ 1,195.00 (Approx INR 78,000.00). The reason of giving this figure is as follows

US $ 552.00-  This amount would help Jyoti to get rid of her Credit Card loan.

US $ 313.00-  DPS Aligarh last quarter fee for both of the children

US $ 330.00-  to repay their old loan taken from lose friends and relative .

Any extra amount would be an additional help to this family.

As total early expenditure of four people with legal case and expensive DPS fee
should be  approx US $ 7,762.00 per year
,  Where as Jyoti is earning US $
5,300.00 per year,  after  doing two jobs
I can assure with personal experience that this family is
bunch of good people and they are fighter against whatever the circumstances is.

Through this I would request you to help this family whatever
way you may like. 
What this family need as help Since, I am not aware about what would be appropriate suitable amount
for this family. I am putting this figure as US $ 1,195.00 (Approx INR
78,000.00). The reason of giving this figure is as follows 
US $
552.00-  This amount would
help Jyoti to get rid of her Credit Card loan.
US $
313.00-  DPS Aligarh last
quarter fee for both of the children
US $ 330.00-
 to repay their old loan taken from
lose friends and relative . 
Any extra amount would be an additional help to this family.

story:
Fantastic gift idea for your children.   Imagine their excitement when they receive such an unique and meaningful gift. 


Kids Eye Smartwatch 

Kids Eye Smartwatch is an integrated kids smart watch that provides a lot of fun and entertainment for children to play and learn on the go.
Smartwatch is not only for an adult, children can have it too.

What is Kids Eye Smartwatch?

Kids Eye Smartwatch is a multi-functional smart watch that is specially designed for kids to play and learn.  The touch screen lets kids easy to use.  It provides a variety of entertainment  for kids, such as camera, video, voice recorder, time, alarm clock, games, stopwatch and timer.  It keeps kids busy on the go anywhere, anytime.  Every kids dream of having.


What can Kids Eye Smartwatch do?


   Overview

    Size of smartwatch: 1.5 x 5 x 23 cm
    Weight: 49.5 grams
                              

Color

Blue, Yellow, Pink & Black                 

Why Kids Eye Smartwatch?

  • CE Standard, safety for kids

  • All-in-one smart watch

  • Great entertainment for kids

  • More fun for children while on the go

  • Play conveniently


  • Explore creativity


  • Brain training


  • Educational activities


  • Interesting games


Features

Touch Screen   

Easy to use, children simply touch what they see on the screen.


Camera & Video

     

•Photo 640 x 480 (JPEG)

•Video 320 x 240 (AVI)    

Rotatable camera allows children easy to take photos, selfie & video.  


3 Built-in Games 

The educational games help children develop their motor skill, creativity and brain training.    Have fun playing and learning.


Make friends with Hippo


Voice Changer

Children can speak to Hippo, it will change your voice to sound just like a robot.   



Funny Emotion  

This interesting activity provides lots of fun and interaction between kids and Hippo.   Simply tap Hippo’s body to show you different emotions, such as laugh, sad, angry, sleep, clip hands and lose balance.


Tell Time   

Mr. Penguin helps children learn to tell time using the analog clock.  Play this fun and interactive tool to practice telling time.  

  


Multi-language Interface

English, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese &  Russian   


Rechargeable Battery


Connectivity

Use an USB cable to connect the Kids Eye Smartwatch to the computer for data transfer, such as photos, videos and voice files.


Box Includes

     

 1 x Kids Eye Smartwatch        

 1 x USB Cable

 1 x User Manual

    

                                                     



Timeline

                        

                              



FAQ 


Q1  What age is suitable for Kids Eye Smartwatch?

A1  This smart watch is suitable for children from 4 years and above.


Q2  Is the battery replaceable?

A2   No, it is a built-in battery that is not replaceable.


Q3  Is the Kids Eye Smartwatch water reistant?

A3  No, it is not water reistant.


Q4  How do I choose the color I want?

A4  We will contact all backers after the campaign ended. 


Q5  When will Kids Eye Smartwatch be available for shipping?

A5  We plan to ship in March 2016.     We will keep you informed once the delivery is ready.


Q6 Where do we ship?

A6  We ship to almost every country.   Please contact us to check if your country is  available for shipping.


If you need more information, please feel free to contact us at info@parpee.com

Thank you for your support!
