story:
What we want to do

We are a handful of musicians, playing regular gigs in various bands in Bucharest. All of us share a passion for music and teaching music to children, including our own.  

All of us are big rock fans, and plan on mainy covering the range of rock and roll, classic rock, alternative, reggae, funk, heavy metal, indie and progressive rock, 

Our project is an after school program, which would start with individual lessons, and transition into group band rehearsals, in order to build and develop upon the foundation of team work and band cohesion.  We want to help the children to play, and play together as a band, as quickly as possible, because that it what they want to do to begin with.  They gradually discover the benefits of theory, and keep broadening their horizons. The next step would be to arrange gigs at local venues (fortunately, smoking ban will be enforced in all public places in Bucharest, effective March 2016!!!), where young musicians will be exposed to real live audiences and authentic concert settings.

An important element of the program is community outreach.  We have been contributing to a center which helps low-income family children with after school programs, which they otherwise cannot afford.   We would like to offer the opportunity to get free classes to those who display musical or academic talent in school, yet cannot afford instruments or classes.  

We believe that our children's lives should not be spent staring at computer, TV or phone screens, and really want to offer an incentive to them, through rock music, to get off their couches, rock hard, and truly enjoy it!  One little rocker at a time, we could make changes to both the music community, and lessen the numbers of the couch-potato-club members.

HOW WE PLAN ON ACCOMPLISHING IT

Through the means of this crowdfunding event, we hope to collect enough money to be able to rent a space, soundproof it (we plan on doing the labor ourselves, just need to coer the cost of materials), acquire the necessary sound equipment, and a few spare musical instruments, and cover the salaries of the trainers (on a part-time basis) for a perio of six months, until we can become self-sustainable.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHERE IT GOES

We will need a location, as close to central as possible without breaking bank on lease.  While many have already expressed interest in attending, if the location is not within everyone's reach, given the city traffic in the late-afternoon hours, interest will drop.  

The school should be in a single-family house, in order to avoid complaints about noise from neighbors.  About three practice classrooms should suffice.

The rooms will be soundproofed, including window seals and doors.  We plan on doing the labor ourselves, for cost saving purposes, and will only need to cover the cost of materials.

Equipment required (per room):

-  Guitar/bass amp combo + cables

-  Drum kit

-  Mixing board 

-  Microphones + amp + cables/stands

The total needed for opening the doors to students is estimated at 40,000 euros.  The description of the expenditures can be found in the table below.  Lease/utilities and salaries are considered for a period of 6 months, until the school is self-sustainable.

Should the full amount not be collected, we will still pursue the project, on a smaller scale (e.g. less space and equipment or a location less central and convenient).

Itemized anticipated costs

(a period of 6 months is considered)

Item

Qty

Cost per unit

TOTAL

SALARIES:

Teacher

Grand Total

  39.790,00 € 

The Impact

Because most every parent is familiar with the benefits of exposing children to music, in particular music which keeps them enticed, we will spend little time on developing this topic.

It will boost their brain power

It will improve their memory

It helps them socially

It's a confidence builder

It teaches patience

It can help them connect

It's constant learning

It's a great form of expression

It teaches discipline

It fosters creativity

The following link gives a well-rounded overiew of the real advantages of teaching music to children.  http://www.childrensmusicworkshop.com/twelve-benefits-of-music-education/

Then why rock music? It really could be any genre which appeals to your child, and keeps them enticed, but we are rockers, and we have the drive, passion and dedication  to teach your children, and keep them engaged.  The confidence booster is huge once you learn how to play an instrument, even bigger when you know you can support your friends in the band, and culminates when you are on stage, overcoming all fright, which later translates into hurdle in your social and professional areas inolving public speaking, relationship building, etc etc.

Your contribution will help develop uninhibited children, ready for life’s callenges, and give a chance to those who cannot afford to express themselves, as we plan to seek out and inolve underpriviledged students who display musical or academic talent in school, yet cannot afford instruments or classes  (transportation and instrument).

HOW DO WE THANK YOU

For your kind contribution, we would like to reward and recognize you in the following ways:

After School Rockers Wall of Fame:  everyone who contributes gets their name permanently engraved on our Wall of Fame.

Free tickets to After Scool Rockers Shows will be sent out to all who donated 10 euros and up.

T-shirts with our logo and the message „I supported After Scool Rockers”,  „my daughter/son goes to After Scool Rockers” and ”I rocked for the After Scool Rockers” will be sent out to all contributors who have donated 15 euros and higher.

CD recordings of performances, signed by the performers will be send out to everyone who donated 20 euros and up.

Skype Guitar/Bass/Drums classes:  contributors of 25 euros and up become eligible for 2 free classes in the instrument of their choice, led by our instructors.

All perks are cummulative!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risks in not being able to achieve our goals is the lack of sufficient funding.  We already have enough expressions of interest from parents whose children would fill an eventual second location. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please, please, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Indianapolis - Cologne Jazz Exchange, Building Bridges and Creating History

The exchange between Sister Cities helps foster understanding of cultures, world history, and languages. Cologne and Indianapolis have developed a thriving partnership over the years, exchanging firefighters, mayors, soccer teams, and more. Three years ago, a jazz group from Cologne came to Indianapolis for a series of concerts and visits encountering some of the regional jazz legends such as David Baker and Duncan Schiedt as well as learning about the rich Indiana music culture. We would like to provide a similar opportunity for a local combo but need support with the immense travel costs.

A group of three outstanding young musicians under the mentorship of German-American jazz pianist Monika Herzig is scheduled to travel to Cologne during the last week of June. They will share Indiana jazz history as well as experience Cologne culture. 

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately there are only minimal city funds to support and the high costs of flying, lodging, van and instrument rental, etc can't be covered by the young musicians. You can help support these young musicians and facilitate a two-way cultural exchange. In return, you can choose home-made goods, German cooking lessons, music, concerts, and so much more for your own personal cultural enrichment. Please help us make this exchange possible and build global trust and understanding.

The Impact

Your contributions will facilitate

  • Cultural understanding and exchange
  • Raising awareness about the rich tradition of jazz in Indiana
  • Matching the support provided by the Sister City community

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please help spread the word by sharing the link to the campaign and letting your friends know about this important cause!

story:
A young adult novel that dares to be different. 

Eddie just turned 14. He has a talking cat named Oliver, newly discovered super powers and He happens to be Autistic. 

 

Eddie Nelson is a new superhero for a new generation. 

YES!

here's more-

EDDIE is moving back to his parents home town-Brooklyn, along with his family.

 

 

Now he has to start a new life, in a new town + he has new found super powers that he's not sure what to do with. But he's about to make a new friend that might help and she's probably the coolest 14-year-old girl ever. Her name is MERCY, and she happens to be Blind. 

 

But Eddie doesn't like change and everything is changing. Eddie works best when the outside world runs smooth because, on the inside, things are usually at top speed. 

The outside world is starting to move just as fast as the inside world. Things are going to get messy. But life is a mess sometimes. 

 

This story sounds really good.

But hang on - it gets better!

Let me tell you ... THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY

 

This young adult novel was truly meant to be, and not in the, "Oh we are soo meant to be don't you think huh, don't you??” way - but in the "Holy Cow the universe has totally aligned itself and there's nothing I can do but do what it's telling me to do." kind of way, and here’s why.

This novel started as a middle school workbook that was co-written with a special education teacher Janine Fiorie. Janine wanted to create a teachers aid workbook to educate non-autistic students about autism's wide-ranging ruffles. 

 

 

Janine asked me to help write the workbook, I was super excited but had little knowledge about autism. I would start this project and follow her lead.

 

 

Last December, we met to brainstorm. Eight hours later, we completed the workbook but I was left with a worried outcome, the voice of an autistic teen. I would find it in research. 

 

Later that night, I was online, sorting lists for a marketing arts final. I came across Pure Vision Arts. It caught my attention. 

 

 

I thought, “Blind artists, my people!” - I’m also blind in my right eye.  

It turns out that Pure Vision  Arts is a non-profit art studio supporting self taught autistic artists.

It was a sign.

So I did, which launched my research. 

Meeting with Pam, the director. I had the opportunity to spend time at Pure Vision and talk with several autistic artists.  

Things were evolving. 

After that, I became consumed - but this was not typical research.

I had long talks with David, a tender autistic teenager who loves music, math, and really cool handshakes. I visited Ezra, working at a comic store in midtown. Ezra is 18, autistic and a comic historian. Like a serious - I don't think anyone knows more than him about comics - comic historian. Ezra provided me with a giant list of autism and comics sites that I was instructed to check out, and I did, reading countless blogs, stories, watching videos, talks, documentaries, all told by people on the autistic spectrum. 

With stacks of notes were piling.

Expression, imagination, and concentration within the autistic spectrum is really a Super Power.

 

 

Then it hit me, there's a Super Hero inside of Eddie.

Almost a year later we enter the world of Eddie the Original.

Now, 55,000 words in, the journey of this young adult  novel is nearly complete. 

 

 

SO WHAT MAKES THIS PROJECT SO AWESOME?

I’d say Everything.

The story is fantastic in so many ways! (everyone whose read it, said it, including a really smart, fancy publisher :)

 

 

EDDIE, OLIVER, and MERCY are Breaking Tradition with THEME.

Eddie's loyal wise-cracking Oliver has been with him from the start and finding a friend in a blind girl named Mercy, was a perfect addition, sharing insights only diversity can provide. 

And it takes place in (my hometown) Brooklyn.

That's a whole lot of Awesome!

 

Book Progress

In book talk, there are about 25,000 words left to write.

And with the help of all you folks, the story and artwork should be completed by January, which would be a superb start to the year.

 

Check in for daily project progress, chapter releases, artwork, and other cool happenings!

 

 

WHAT'S THE MONEY GOING TOWARDS?

If we reach our goal for the book, we can release a professionally edited,  professionally typeset, professionally-designed, nontraditional, limited edition, book edited by our very patient, thorough and kind editor-Josh Cohen and artwork! 

 

WE HAVE REWARDS

 

Be sure to check out the Rewards Section.

By contributing to this awesome project, you’ll receive some major perks. The first is feeling really good about your donation - after your warm and fuzzy feelings, you’ll get great stuff like ...

Oliver's little bouncy Super Ball (superpowers not included)

Eddie's Reality Wristband, Mercy's Cool Cat Ears headband, E-books, Hardcover books and lots more. 

And the most Stupendous reward is being a part of this awesome story that we will make happen TOGETHER!

If you can’t donate, that's okay too.

 

 

 

 

 

 

SHARE this special project with a friend and YOU have contributed!

 

Thanks For All Your Support!
story_txt:
A young adult novel that dares to be different. 
Eddie just turned 14. He has a talking cat named Oliver, newly discovered super powers and He happens to be Autistic.  Eddie Nelson is a new superhero for a new generation. YES!here's more-EDDIE is moving back to his parents home town-Brooklyn, along with his family.  Now he has to start a new life, in a new town + he has new found super powers that he's not sure what to do with. But he's about to make a new friend that might help and she's probably the coolest 14-year-old girl ever. Her name is MERCY, and she happens to be Blind.  But Eddie doesn't like change and everything is changing. Eddie works best when the outside world runs smooth because, on the inside, things are usually at top speed. The outside world is starting to move just as fast as the inside world. Things are going to get messy. But life is a mess sometimes.  This story sounds really good.But hang on - it gets better!Let me tell you ... THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY This young adult novel was truly meant to be, and not in the, "Oh we are soo meant to be don't you think huh, don't you??” way - but in the "Holy Cow the universe has totally aligned itself and there's nothing I can do but do what it's telling me to do." kind of way, and here’s why.This novel started as a middle school workbook that was co-written with a special education teacher Janine Fiorie. Janine wanted to create a teachers aid workbook to educate non-autistic students about autism's wide-ranging ruffles.   Janine asked me to help write the workbook, I was super excited but had little knowledge about autism. I would start this project and follow her lead.  Last December, we met to brainstorm. Eight hours later, we completed the workbook but I was left with a worried outcome, the voice of an autistic teen. I would find it in research.  Later that night, I was online, sorting lists for a marketing arts final. I came across Pure Vision Arts. It caught my attention.   I thought, “Blind artists, my people!” - I’m also blind in my right eye.  It turns out that Pure Vision  Arts is a non-profit art studio supporting self taught autistic artists.It was a sign.So I did, which launched my research. Meeting with Pam, the director. I had the opportunity to spend time at Pure Vision and talk with several autistic artists.  Things were evolving. After that, I became consumed - but this was not typical research.I had long talks with David, a tender autistic teenager who loves music, math, and really cool handshakes. I visited Ezra, working at a comic store in midtown. Ezra is 18, autistic and a comic historian. Like a serious - I don't think anyone knows more than him about comics - comic historian. Ezra provided me with a giant list of autism and comics sites that I was instructed to check out, and I did, reading countless blogs, stories, watching videos, talks, documentaries, all told by people on the autistic spectrum. With stacks of notes were piling.Expression, imagination, and concentration within the autistic spectrum is really a Super Power.  Then it hit me, there's a Super Hero inside of Eddie.Almost a year later we enter the world of Eddie the Original.Now, 55,000 words in, the journey of this young adult  novel is nearly complete.   SO WHAT MAKES THIS PROJECT SO AWESOME?I’d say Everything.The story is fantastic in so many ways! (everyone whose read it, said it, including a really smart, fancy publisher :)  EDDIE, OLIVER, and MERCY are Breaking Tradition with THEME.Eddie's loyal wise-cracking Oliver has been with him from the start and finding a friend in a blind girl named Mercy, was a perfect addition, sharing insights only diversity can provide. And it takes place in (my hometown) Brooklyn.That's a whole lot of Awesome! Book ProgressIn book talk, there are about 25,000 words left to write.And with the help of all you folks, the story and artwork should be completed by January, which would be a superb start to the year. Check in for daily project progress, chapter releases, artwork, and other cool happenings!  WHAT'S THE MONEY GOING TOWARDS?If we reach our goal for the book, we can release a professionally edited,  professionally typeset, professionally-designed, nontraditional, limited edition, book edited by our very patient, thorough and kind editor-Josh Cohen and artwork!  WE HAVE REWARDS Be sure to check out the Rewards Section.By contributing to this awesome project, you’ll receive some major perks. The first is feeling really good about your donation - after your warm and fuzzy feelings, you’ll get great stuff like ...Oliver's little bouncy Super Ball (superpowers not included)Eddie's Reality Wristband, Mercy's Cool Cat Ears headband, E-books, Hardcover books and lots more. And the most Stupendous reward is being a part of this awesome story that we will make happen TOGETHER!If you can’t donate, that's okay too.      SHARE this special project with a friend and YOU have contributed! Thanks For All Your Support!

story:
What is DOPECAUSEWESAID?

DOPECAUSEWESAID is an online platform and brand based in Raleigh, NC that is an aggregator for all things DOPE relating to music by emerging artists, as well as culture, style, and creative arts. Utilizing our website DOPECAUSEWESAID.com, social media, and live events such as day parties and in-store performances, we showcase the best new music by emerging artists in the genres of Pop, Hip-Hop, Soul, RnB, Rock and Electronic music and spotlight the products and services of emerging creatives and brands from around the world. We strive to be digital media influencers, connecting the world to amazingly talented emerging artists, creatives and brands through the DOPECAUSEWESAID purview.

DOPECAUSEWESAID is the brainchild of Simon Boamah and Carlton Boyd and the idea went from concept to reality in July 2014 when the two founders first launched the DOPECAUSEWESAID website. Since then, the platform and brand have grown in scale and scope but it always come back to the original question: "What can we build to showcase the great work of emerging artists, creatives and brands and connect them with people from around the world?" With your financial contribution, the DOPECAUSEWESAID team can continue finding answers.

What others are saying about DOPECAUSEWESAID: 

DOPECAUSEWESAID is an amazing platform that showcases, supports and promotes new talents from all over the world. It’s been a pleasure collaborating with people who are committed to delivering quality content. - Charlotte Gomes, Project Light Agency, UK

DOPECAUSEWESAID has been a huge positive driving force in my career, always making sure to lift up my music. They've written incredible, well thought out articles regarding my music as well as introduced to me to dope music from around the world! - Bateau, Melbourne, Australia (Trip-Hop/RnB/Hip-Hop)

Everyone over at DOPECAUSEWESAID is the homie. They've always showed hella genuine love & it's evident that they want to see good people & good music win. - Dylan Reese, Massachusetts (RnB)

Why this campaign matters

This crowdfunding campaign matters because we aspire to take the DOPECAUSEWESAID platform and brand to the next level and you can help us do it. Our goal for this campaign is to raise $5,000; your donations will assist us in a number of ways and allow us to: 

1) host artist showcases, pop-up shows, and artwalks in the Raleigh-Durham area featuring local emerging artists, painters and artisans;

2) host networking events for emerging artists, creatives, and brands in the Raleigh-Durham area;

3) develop a DOPECAUSEWESAID mobile application (Android/iOS) which will further enable our ability to connect the world to the featured artists, creatives, and brands showcased on our platform; 

4) develop a DIY webinar video series for emerging artists/producers with tips, tools, and suggestions that they can use to propel their musical careers;

5) film a documentary on the music scene for emerging artists in the Raleigh-Durham area; and 

6) develop a mentorship program called “Creativity Plug”, which will connect Raleigh-Durham area at-risk high school students who have an interest in creative arts such as graphic design, website development, music production, photography, etc. with professionals in that career area who will mentor and guide them toward success.

DOPE Perks!

When you make a $10 contribution, you will receive a shoutout from us on our website DOPECAUSEWESAID.com.

When you make a $25 contribution, you will receive an official DOPECAUSEWESAID coaster and a handwritten note from the founders, Carlton Boyd and Simon Boamah, thanking you personally.

When you make a $50 contribution, you will receive an autographed official DOPECAUSEWESAID picture book with photos of artists, pictures taken by photographers, and artwork by painters who have been featured on our website. 

When you make a $100 contribution, you will receive a DOPECAUSEWESAID Perk Pack which includes a DOPECAUSEWESAID tee shirt, a compilation album featuring new music by artists who have appeared on our website, a DOPECAUSEWESAID coaster, and a DOPECAUSEWESAID magnet.

How Can You Help?

Beyond making a financial contribution to our campaign, you can also help us by spreading the word about DOPECAUSEWESAID and inviting your family, friends and social media followers to do the same with the Indiegogo share tools! 

Thank you,

Carlton Boyd & Simon Boamah, founders of DOPECAUSEWESAID.com

Who We Are

We are Rice Eclipse, Rice University's rocket club dedicated to designing, building, and launching hybrid rocket technologies in a safe and fun manner that fosters learning and leadership development. We have won several university awards for our research, and plan to publish a paper on hybrid motor fuel grains in the near future.

We are raising funds for our Mk2 hybrid rocket motor, a 3500 N motor that we hope to launch by the end of the year. While our goal is ambitious, we have the knowledge and machinery required to achieve this feat and are excited to begin. 

However, rockets are expensive, and that's where you come in. With your help, we can help design, build, and launch a hybrid rocket that will catapult our dreams and careers to the future. 

Check out our website: riceeclipse.com, for more information!

What We Need 

While we do receive donations from Rice University and several companies, these are often not enough to meet our demand. Your donation could be the difference between a beautiful rocket launch or us remaining on the ground for another year. 

Our Current budget is as follows:

  • Propulsion: $6700
  • Aerodynamics: $3200
  • Avionics: $1950

What You Get

If you donate to our education, we will give you the following perks:

  • $10- Astronaut: An email thank-you note with a picture of the team
  • $50- Martian: (Individuals) Your name on our website as an official sponsor, plus previous perks
  • $100- Jumping Jupiter: (Corporations) Your logo on our website as an official sponsor, plus previous perks
  • $500- Saturn Cosmonaut: Your logo on all of our rockets, published materials, and the like, plus previous perks.
  • $1000- Pluto Fly-by: You can personally choose part of our cargo during a launch (within size/weight constraints). Send a penny to thousands of feet in the air and brag to your friends! Plus previous perks. 

The Impact

Your generous donation will help us reach for the stars and further our educational and career goals. Because Rice does not have an aerospace program, we've essentially made our own. Rice Eclipse Alumni have gone on to work for NASA and SpaceX, and their experience here directly correlated to their job opportunities. 

Risks & Challenges

Building a hybrid motor of this size isn't easy. It's literally rocket science. But our passion, iterative design and prototyping process, and team of mentors and associates help us along the way. Now you can, too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Numerous companies and associates have donated their time, parts, or mentorship to our club, and we appreciate them greatly. If you are interested in donating something other than cold hard cash, please contact us at riceeclipse@gmail.com. Thank you again for your donation, with your help, we'll reach the stars!

story:
I'm Creating a DIY Website Course for Small Business Owners

Most business owners acknowledge the advantage of having a website. But having a website and having a website that helps your business are two different things. Having a site that is inadequate can be worse than having no web presence at all. It can make an otherwise professional operation look amateur and drives potential customers away. 

If you want a site that's more than just a digital business card, it takes resources that many small businesses don't have, especially if they're just starting out. 

  • Small business owners need affordable website solutions that are also effective marketing tools.
  • There are a lot of cheap DIY solutions out there that are not a good foundation for long term growth and success, and can even cost you more in the long run.
  • Even with all the of money in the world, if you don't understand HOW to market your business online, your website will fail.

Understand the Basics Before You Invest Your Time and Money

There's nothing more frustrating than trying to accomplish something completely outside of your expertise, with no clear roadmap. And there are few things more overwhelming to decipher than the world of websites, design, development, code, and marketing. 

People create entire careers out of any ONE of those disciplines so it's no wonder that business owners are overwhelmed trying to navigate the process while also building a business. 

Websites That Work is a Blueprint for Effective Online Marketing

The full course is six weeks of pre-recorded, self-paced lessons that teach the foundation of successful online marketing. Students will learn how they can create a professional looking site with little or no coding.

The hardest part of a great website isn't actually the technology, it's figuring out exactly WHO you're trying to reach, HOW to reach them and WHAT TO SAY when they land on your site.

The six week course covers:

  • Foundation: What is a domain? What is a web host? Why should you care?
  • Discovery: Understanding your business, your customer, your market, and strategies to reach your potential customers
  • Content: Understand how you will use content to convince your audience to buy, join, or donate.
  • Technology: Learn the best tools and short cuts to use the WordPress platform to make a professional looking site without having to code.
  • Marketing: Learn how to get visitors to your new site and make your website your hardest working employee.
  • Launch!: Get your new creation onto the web. You'll get a 32 point check-list to make sure your launch is a success. 
There will also be weekly coaching calls to help students understand new concepts and implement them.

Testing the Waters

Between November 2015 and January 2016, I ran a six week pilot program for this course with a small group of beta testers, using live webinars and weekly office hours. I'll use the feedback from this beta to make the course more useful so it solves the right problems for my students.

Noni Learned the Hard Way



Your Funding Dollars

Creating this much content is going to take time. With your help, I will focus on creating the course content and building out the learning management system and launch the new course by May 1st, 2016.
Your money will go towards: 
  • Development
  • Design 
  • Equipment (camera, microphone)
  • Software (webinar, automation platforms)

Why WordPress?

WordPress powers 25% of the Internet. It's a solid platform with a huge community around it and a ton of resources for people who are new to the platform. 

Why Me?

I've been creating sites professionally with WordPress for four years. I've trained students and clients to use WordPress, as well as created documentation and screencasts to empower site owners to manage their own sites.

I've spoken at Wordcamp conferences about technology and business and spent six weeks mentoring students of diverse backgrounds and skill levels to become contributors to open source projects.

I've spent the past year studying with some of the best web professional mentors in the industry, like Troy Dean, Brent Weaver & Ryan Deiss.

I'm sick of watching small business owners struggle with their websites. Help me build a solution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, please help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with those who might benefit.

Thank you for your help!

story:
D.N.A - Designing New Advances

(Note: If you can pay with creditcard, make sure to use our Generosity link! This will save us a lot of money! https://www.generosity.com/education-fundraisin... )

At the institute of Exponential Sciences, we work towards realizing the future by connecting scientific, corporate and public leaders to accelerate progress. To that end, the IES organizes an annual grand congress covering a promising field of study or technology. For 2016, we have chosen the field of gene therapies and their application in healthy human lifespan extension.

By doing so, the IES has set an ambitious goal: Not only to organize the most impactful congress in the field of gene therapies and life extension in Europe for bringing together academia and the corporate world, but also to make this event a major step forwards for the mainstream visibility of the field. To make this a reality, we realized that we would need to look beyond our own organization and collaborate with important actors working in the field today.


With this, the idea of the D.N.A Congress was born. Working from this idea, the Institute of Exponential Sciences has reached out to it's international allies, such as the SENS Research Foundation, Bioviva Inc, LEAF, The International Longevity Alliance, HEALES and many others. We have successfully arranged for some of the biggest names in the field, as well as the endorsement of many community leaders world-wide.


D.N.A has been endorsed by:


Aubrey de Grey
BioViva Inc
Life Extension Advocacy Foundation (Also operating as lifespan.io)
HEALES vzw
International Longevity Alliance
People Unlimited
Singularity Network


Our line-up is as follows:


Opening
The Congress will officially be opened by Demian Zivkovic, President of the IES.

First Speaker
Opening the event will be Oliver Medvedik, Ph.D, director of scientific programs at genspace. Dr. Medvedik has earned his Ph.D at Harvard Medical school in the biomedical and biological sciences program. Since graduating from Harvard, he has worked as a biotechnology consultant, taught molecular biology to numerous undergraduates at Harvard and mentored two of Harvard’s teams for the international genetically engineered engineered machines competition (IGEM) held annually at M.I.T.  

Second speaker
Our second speaker is Aubrey Grey, Ph.D, an English author, Chief Science Officer of the SENS Research Foundation and editor-in-chief of the academic journal Rejuvenation Research. Aubrey de Grey is well known for his focus on regenerative medicine and views on human aging. He will take the stage talking about the applications of current and upcoming technologies and studies which hold the potential to greatly extend our healthy lifespan.

Third speaker
Our third speaker is Tatjana Kochetkova, Ph.D a fellow of the Institute of Exponential Sciences, working as a bioethicist for the institute's Ethics & Interdisciplinary Future Studies department. Dr. Kochetkova will follow up discussing the ethical and philosophical side of the technology and will adress questions of what exponential technologies in biotech mean for society.

Fourth speaker
Our fourth speaker is Elizabeth Parrish, a fellow of the Institute of Exponential Sciences and the Founder and CEO of BioViva Sciences Inc, a Delaware corporation based in Seattle, WA. with labs and participating clinics in South/Central America where the majority of practical work is carried out. Bioviva has been noted for being the first corporation in the world to treat a patient with gene therapy to reverse aging. The woman who wants to genetically engineer you will cover the basics of BioViva’s approach and vision for the the future, as well as the potential that gene therapies hold for radically improving our health and lives in the future.

Fifth speaker
Our fifth speaker will be Keith Comito, who is the founder and president of the Life Extension Advocacy Foundation (LEAF), a 501(c)(3) non-profit and a partner organization of the Institute of Exponential Sciences. Through LEAF, he operates the crowdfunding platform Lifespan.io, which funds biomedical research aimed at extending healthy human lifespan. He also serves as policy coordinator for the Global Healthspan Policy Institute, which facilitates relationships between researchers and government to advance initiatives in support of healthy life extension.

Goals:
The major goal of this congress is to create a high-profile event which will greatly increase the field's visibility to the mainstream, both academic as corporate investors. D.N.A will bring together the talent, money and passion of the gene therapies & health extension field to demonstrate to the public the advancements in the field. However, we can not do this alone. To organize an event on this scale, we need funding: this is why we need you, the community that has stood by our field for years, so that we can push the science and the business into the public eye and connect the right people to accelerate the change towards a tomorrow with less suffering, disease and death.

 not do this alone. To organize an event on this scale, we need funding:
 this is why we need you, the community that has stood by our field for 
years, so that we can push the science and the business into the public 
eye and connect the right people to accelerate the change towards a 
tomorrow with less suffering, disease and death.

story:
Why are we starting The Coding Ground? 

Together we've been practicing Software Developers for over 2 Decades and have always been passionate about Software Development. Combined with our passion for helping others changing their lives, we are embarking on a journey to create world class software craftsman of unemployed, resource-poor South Africans.

By working hard and being passionate about Software Development, Mandla has changed the life of him and his family. Read more about why this is so important to Mandla and Theo. You can also watch a talk Mandla did on the topic at RubyFuza, a local developer conference.

By contributing to our campaign, you can change the trajectory of one of over 50% of South Africa's unemployed youth boys and girls, to not only help them provide for their families, but also help shape the future of their Country and Continent.

What do we need?

In short, we need ~$170 000, this will allow us to secure funding for a minimum of 30 students (our stretch goal would be 80 students) for a year, with either one full-time craftsmen to mentor, or two part-time craftsmen.

Your contribution will go to the following:

  • A premises able to accommodate the 30 students.
  • Equipment including mid-level laptops for the students, network infrastructure, an internet connection, projectors and other items needed
  • Monthly utility bill including water & electricity 
  • A travel stipend that will help the students get to and from the grounds
  • 2 Meals per student per day
  • Furniture
  • A Library of relevant books
  • Creation of additional coursework

Because we aim for The Coding Ground to be completely self-sufficient, we will work with companies so that the students' fees are entirely sponsored with the obligation to work for the sponsoring company for a year. Should a student that has been paid for by the crowd funding campaign be taken on at a client, that money will then be made available for another student.

Our dream is to not only help students to find jobs, but also to create a fund where the students can apply for funding to start their own initiatives. This will truly change South Africa.

What if we don't meet the minimum requirements to start?

Should we not meet our minimum requirements to start our fund, we have investigated a number of alternative strategies to reduce costs, including using Raspberry pi's (or similar, more powerful variants) and reducing the salaries and time spent by the craftsmen. After all, even being able to change 1 individual's life is worth it.

The Impact

To An Individual

With our previous involvement at Sisonke Rising, where we taught individuals between 12 and 25 how to code on Saturday mornings for 2 years, we realized just how much of a difference a mentor can make. The privilege of helping someone realize that they are capable of so much is a massive responsibility. Watch a video of Moral, a Sisonke Rising student, sharing what a difference Sisonke Rising has made in his life.

To A Country

The average wage for a low-skilled individual in South Africa is around $9 per day if they even are employed. With your contribution and The Coding Ground's mentorship, the student will immediately go to earning a starting salary almost three times as much, with the potential of tripling that salary again in a matter of ~3 years.

The change does not just stop at earning a salary, however. Once an individual can provide for their households, they will become active participants in the economy and will be able to help catapult the country into the new digital era.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

What are you going to teach?

We are going to use a combination of online resources, including Harvard CS50, Free Code Camp and various other resources including books, regularly scheduled talks. 

So which programming languages are you going to teach?

We are going to teach Javascript (client side and server side) as well as C#. More importantly, we are going to teach our students how to easily adopt new languages and skills required.

What will happen to the funds should you receive external sponsorship?

The more funds we can raise, the more students we can help. If we raise more funds than students we can take in the first year, the funds will roll over to the next year's students.

Can you guarantee that after a year the students will be able to contribute at their employers?

Simply put, we cannot. We can, however, use our combined knowledge of more than 20 years including all the lessons we've learned from teaching Code to children on Saturday mornings for the past 2 years to do our absolute best to ensure this is a success.

 

Campaign Update

 

Thank you for being patient while we ‘failed fast and often’ in starting up the Code School – The Coding Ground. Until now we have not sent you feedback as we had nothing concrete to give feedback on.

 

However, it gives us great pleasure to send this update to you, now. We have signed our rental agreement to lease premises and will be facilitating our first Bootcamp this Saturday,  the 1st of July 2017. We will be selecting our first five students from this group.

 

Despite the fact that the funding did not meet our expectations, we've learnt numerous invaluable lessons in getting things started and we still know and believe that this is simply too important to give up on. We embarked on a mission for The Coding Ground to fund the students and with your contributions, we have enough funding to officially start the process. Our primary mission remains the same, to give hope and skills to those with aptitude, determination and a willingness to work hard for their future.

 

Our strategy for the next year is to:

  • Facilitate Bootcamps;
  • Structure the Bootcamps in such a way that they are beneficial regardless of whether the attendee is selected or not; and
  • Provide a stipend, training material, constant mentorship, life skills and a safe environment conducive to learning, over a period of 12 months.

 

The possibilities for the students are endless after the twelve months, and although we might have a number of potential forks in the road, in future; we are not limiting ourselves or our students just yet.

 

We look forward to giving you more good news, and as soon as we have selected our students we will send the perks your way.

story:
THE STORY

Mikey, a 7 year-old American gutt (boy), who has recently moved to Norge (Norway), is having trouble adjusting to his new surroundings. When these troubles become too overwhelming for him, Mikey runs away and ends up lost... in Norway... with only himself and his backpack but, not to fear!

Astrid, a precocious, 7 year-old, Norwegian jente (girl) finds Mikey. She is just the person to help Mikey find his way back to his hus (house). Along the way, Astrid invites Mikey to explore Norway alongside her, she introduces him to all of her animal venner (friends), and she even begins to show him how to make Norway his hjem (home).

EXT. BILLY GOAT FIELD - DAY (Concept Art by Lauren Holzer)


THE SUBTITLES

Although Mikey speaks Engelsk (English) and Astrid speaks Norsk (Norwegian), the two children find ways to help and understand each other.

As Mikey and Astrid embark on their adventure together, they (and the audience) must negotiate the language barriers.

Barn (Children) who watch TADPOLES and the series of films to follow will not only benefit from exposure to different cultures and languages, but also, can reinforce their reading abilities by following the subtitles in their native languages.

TADPOLES is a foreign subtitled film designed and crafted for young audiences and new readers

EXT. SHEEP HILLSIDE - AFTERNOON (Concept Art by Lauren Holzer)


THE FOREIGN FILM

TADPOLES will be the first in a line of movies designed to introduce children to different cultures, different languages, and different backgrounds so that young audiences may broaden their perspectives on the world around them.

It is important to introduce young audiences to the lives of other kids around the world so that they can wrestle with ideas and questions of culture during their formative years.

TADPOLES could be a child's first foreign subtitled film and could help them to develop the toolkit they will need to prosper in this increasingly interconnected world.

EXT. TADPOLES CREEK - LATE AFTERNOON (Concept Art by Lauren Holzer)


THE FILMMAKERS

In 2014, TRISERRATOPS flew across the Atlantic to meet DUOfilm! There in Norway it became official: TADPOLES is an American-Norwegian co-production that will be distributed to children both domestically (within the US and Norway) and internationally (with the rest of the world)!

DUOfilm AS

TRISERRATOPS Productions

EXT. DARK FOREST - NIGHT (Concept Art by Lauren Holzer)

THE FINANCES

In March of this year, the filmmakers were awarded a generous grant from VestNorsk Filmsenter in Bergen, Norway. As such, a significant portion of our production's budget has been financed! 

IndieGoGo is frequently used by artists and filmmakers to build community around the visions they have and to raise funds to bring those ideas to life. 

This IndieGoGo campaign will allow us to raise the final amount we need to have met our budgetary requirements and to bring TADPOLES to our campaign's community!

In case you're curious to know how the funds will be distributed, please check out the financial breakdown below:

*If you're interested in having us put your donation towards a specific category, please let us where you'd like for us to direct these funds!


THE INCENTIVES

Every donation comes with a reward! Check out the great incentives on the right-hand side of the screen to see what you'd like to receive in return for your kind donation to our film.

Local artist, Rosario Chinchilla, also put some fun artwork together to give your children a more visually stimulating experience when choosing the prizes they hope to receive! Check them out!

* * * 

A plantable takkebrev (thank you letter) from the Director! Just find some soil, sprinkle some water, and watch wildflowers grow! Donation type: $10+

Your child's name will appear in the credits of our film! Any child enthusiastic to see TADPOLES made, is a child we'd like to share it with. Donation: $40+

A signed, green-friendly (downloadable) screenplay for your child! We're excited to share the TADPOLES story word for word. Donation: $50+

The original TADPOLES soundtrack for children, so that they can listen to the movie's musikk (music) over and over again! Donation: $100+

Want to stay in the loop during the filming of TADPOLES? Someone from our cast or crew will send you your very own personal production update from Os, Norway! Donation: $125 (includes rewards through $100 donations).

Do you have a lucky charm? Astrid does! It's her dream-catcher... This handcrafted dream-catcher will be made just for your child. LIMITED ITEM!

Want to grow carrots just like Astrid? She'll send you your very own gardening kit... plant some seeds, take good care of them, and keep a diary of your garden's growth! Donation: $225 (includes rewards through $100 donations).

Mikey's hardhat helps guide our characters through the deep forests of Norway. Your child will receive their own, personalized hardhat! Great for daytime and nighttime play, this hardhat comes with a bright headlamp and is a great tool for outdoor exploration! Donation: $300 (includes rewards through $100 donations).

We'll send you child their very own disposable camera filled with special behind-the-scene photos taken during the filming of TADPOLES. The photos will be remain a secret until the film is developed! Donation: $425 (includes rewards through $100 donations).

That's right! Your child will be given the chance to name one of Astrid's favorite sheep featured in the film. They may choose from a list of Norwegian names, or they can even make up their own (within reason)! LIMITED ITEM

Signed by the cast and crew, this 24X36 TADPOLES  poster can hang in your child's room... Designed and printed in Norway - it's an original! Donation: $750 (includes all rewards through $100 donations).

Take a peek inside the production of TADPOLES: read interviews from the Producers/Director, view behind-the-scenes content, and learn about the story that inspired the film. Donation: $1250 (includes rewards through $100 donations).

Have TADPOLES come to you! Enjoy a private screening of the film at your school, organization or private event! Includes a Q&A session and/or an open discussion with the Director.

We shall crown you Associate Producer of TADPOLES.

 
Care for a larger crown? We shall crown you Executive Producer of TADPOLES.


Risks & Challenges

"Never work with animals or children."

-W.C. Fields, a player in early-American cinema

Although we greatly appreciate the advice Mr. Fields has shared with us, TADPOLES is a film that involves the participation of animals and children exclusively.

That's right! Two kids out in nature, a Norwegian slug, a ferocious billygoat, a noble Fjord horse, about two dozen sheep, and some tadpoles -- are the components of our film.

What were we thinking, you might ask? Well, we're creating a film FOR children who are experiencing the world AS CHILDREN. So, therefore, we wanted to INCLUDE CHILDREN and anything children may find admirable, exciting, or familiar - which in this case... are ANIMALS.

Yes, this is a challenge and some may see this as a risk, but the film we've come together to create is the film we will accomplish together. We have a wonderful crew, very talented specialists on board to assist us with these 'challenging' aspects, and two child stars who are eager to help us bring this beautiful vision home!

When it comes down to it, if we raise our funding goal - we feel confident that we will have enough time and resources to 'pull it off' and make something that will not only move young audiences, but will inspire them to explore the foreign film genre, subtitled films, foreign languages, and last but not least, the world outside their own.


TUSEN TAKK & FARVEL ...

(A thousand thanks and farewell...)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alan Bray I'm the founder of Bray Media. I've worked in the sales segment of several technology organizations and have a data-driven and strategic mindset. I'm a diversity and inclusion enthusiast. I love to help and motivate people to accelerate in their prospective careers; that's why I decided to create a platform that put diversity first. 
I've started this campaign because I'm in the new pre-seed process of developing my company, and I'm looking to create an MVP (Proto-type) to show investors and grow my brand, but I need your help.
By funding Bray Media, you contribute to the foundation of my platform and a solution that will mend the gap where luck meets opportunity for so many young minority business professionals. During this stage, helping my company will help create a solution that's needed for so many minority business professionals to give them the competency that will allow them to strive within their perspective careers.

What We Need & What You Get

Bray Media LLC needs $20,000 to help build our MVP. It will cost $8,000 to fund the UI/UX developer to create and design my web-based platform. $6,000 pays for the OTT (Over The Top) media integration needed to help business professionals upload and stream presentation content (Live, Broadcast, Video, Podcast). $3,000 goes to marketing for brand awareness and content strategies (Ad campaigns, marketing content, Hootsuite, google ads). $3,000 will go towards the back end, recruiting platform integration. 

Bray Media will act as an access -point for digital content for young minority business professionals. The platform will provide users with media content (Video Podcast, Podcast, Masterclass presentations, blog forums ) to access first-hand introductions from influential business professionals. The latter inspires to motivate, educate, and inspire youth to create a more diverse workforce. 
If I don't reach my entire goal, the funding will still go towards the Bray Media platform's design and development. 

The Impact

We have in mind to create a secure and reliable platform operating in the inclusion based edTech industry. We have in mind to create valuable content that promotes and incentives user awareness under various themes by including diversity acceptance, inclusion, and social worth. This will enable underrepresented minorities with the access of content that accelerates their perspective careers.

Risks & Challenges

A 2019 survey by Schoology indicated that 15% of students in the United States are without access to broadband internet. Since then, the coronavirus pandemic has created a virtual schooling environment, which resulted in an unavoidable learning and achievement gap. 
Many internet providers stepped in to offer free Wi-Fi access to ensure that students could continue learning. Still, broadband internet is, unfortunately, not the only barrier to student success in online environments. As online learning remains the new normal, educators must employ best practice strategies to make this experience inclusive and welcoming. Giving careful consideration to students’ various learning styles and needs will help create positive experiences, even when teaching and learning from a distance. 

A comprehensive online course welcomes content that is diversified and speaks to all students in the online classroom. Course content should be free of implicit and explicit bias and filtered through a multicultural lens. A successful online class will always promote diversity and inclusion, and invite students to participate meaningfully in their learning community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, I completely understand that it's tough to set out additional funds during these times. But one way you can help is to promote this product via Facebook, Instagram, and Linkedin. Regardless of your financial capabilities to contribute, I believe that it is mandatory to spread the word about this platform. Bray Media is in the business of philanthropy using technological advances doing so. Any support is much needed!

This will enable underrepresented minorities with the access of content that accelerates their perspective careers.

Risks & Challenges
A 2019 survey by Schoology indicated that 15% of students in the United States are without access to broadband internet. Since then, the coronavirus pandemic has created a virtual schooling environment, which resulted in an unavoidable learning and achievement gap. Many internet providers stepped in to offer free Wi-Fi access to ensure that students could continue learning. Still, broadband internet is, unfortunately, not the only barrier to student success in online environments. As online learning remains the new normal, educators must employ best practice strategies to make this experience inclusive and welcoming. Giving careful consideration to students’ various learning styles and needs will help create positive experiences, even when teaching and learning from a distance. 
A comprehensive online course welcomes content that is diversified and speaks to all students in the online classroom. Course content should be free of implicit and explicit bias and filtered through a multicultural lens. A successful online class will always promote diversity and inclusion, and invite students to participate meaningfully in their learning community.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, I completely understand that it's tough to set out additional funds during these times. But one way you can help is to promote this product via Facebook, Instagram, and Linkedin. Regardless of your financial capabilities to contribute, I believe that it is mandatory to spread the word about this platform. Bray Media is in the business of philanthropy using technological advances doing so. Any support is much needed!

story:
Ever Forward-Siempre Adelante supports young men of color to express their ideas and achieve their dreams.

 

We need your help to expand

We started in 2004 as a lunchtime support group in a public high school in Oakland.  Today, we are a youth development organization with a big vision: a nationwide network of in-school clubs, certified mentors, and workshop programs.  The future begins now.

 

LET'S START STRONG: DOUBLE YOUR IMPACT BY DONATING TODAY!

All donations in the first 48 hours will be MATCHED dollar for dollar by an anonymous donor up to $25K!!  Every dollar you donate is worth 2X.  This means a $50 dollar donation becomes a $100 donation!  $25K BECOMES $50K.

 

The Problem

Our nation is in crisis.  Many young men of color across the United States are neglected, abandoned, and abused by their communities. They are dropping out of school and falling into the criminal justice system at staggering rates.  We cannot continue to fail our young men. Help us create a better future for them.

 

Our Mission

We cultivate social-emotional learning among at-risk young men of color.  We exist to combat the forces that lead to achievement gaps, dropout, violence, incarceration, mental health afflictions, and early death among young men.

Our Work

We help our young men realize their potential and overcome adversity. Through our in-school Club program, we create safe spaces for young men to come together and take off their emotional "masks."  We help them address the layers of pain, frustration, fear, sadness and anxiety driving their thoughts and behaviors.  Over time, they learn to:

  • Speak from their hearts without fear of ridicule or shaming

  • Set and achieve goals, inside and outside of the classroom

  • Engage in school and within their communities in a new way

  • Show up with greater passion and purpose, and a clearer life direction

  • Take responsibility for their actions

  • See the true potential within themselves

Our Impact

  • To date, 100% of Ever Forward Club members have graduated from high school (n​early all of our students come from inner-city neighborhoods where dropout rates climb as high as 45%).
  • 93% of have gone on to attend two- or four-year colleges, military, or trade school.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to join the Ever Forward-Siempre Adelante movement!

  • Spread the Word.  Please share our campaign with your networks - via email, twitter, Facebook, or any other social media platform!
  • Double your impact with your employer's matching dollars.  Please utilize any matching program offered by your employer when you contribute to the Ever Forward-Siempre Adelante!
  • Stay in touch.  Please register to be on our email list here.

Ever Forward-Siempre Adelante in the News:

  • TEDx
  • Wisdom 2.0
  • The Big Ideas Fest
  • Aspen Institute
  • Talks @ Google
  • News outlets including NPR, NBC, CBS and PBS.  
  • Ever Forward-Siempre Adelante was also featured in the documentary, The Mask You Live In, which premiered at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival.

About Ashanti Branch

Ashanti has over 19 years of experience as a teacher, mentor, and youth advocate.

  • Background: Ashanti was born and raised in the inner city by a single mother on welfare in Oakland, CA. He attended California Polytechnic - San Luis Obispo, where he earned a BS in Civil Engineering. After college, Ashanti worked as a project manager and a volunteer tutor for struggling students. As a tutor, he realized his passion for teaching and suddenly found the “fire” that was missing in his life.  Today, Ashanti is on a mission to change the way that students interact with their education and the way schools interact with students.
  • Awards & Accolades: Ashanti has been an Education Fellow at the Stanford d.school, and received the Fulbright Exchange Fellowship to India, the Rotary Club Cultural Ambassadorial Fellowship to Mexico, and the 2010 Teacher of the Year Award from the Alameda-Contra Costa County Math Educators.

“When my students aren’t learning, it’s not usually because they can’t. It’s because they have deep-seated barriers that are holding them back. We can’t change their past, but we can teach them to hold safe space, add to their emotional toolbox, and help each other.” - Ashanti Branch

story:
Welcome to Bilin Academy

 www.bilin.academy

 

A global language immersion classroom for bilingual children.

 

Our Purpose.

Empower children worldwide by giving them access to multilingual, global, diverse education. 

 

Our Background.

The birth of BILIN Academy comes from a personal interest in teaching, studying languages and intercultural connections. Growing up, I was educated in a monolingual, monocultural curriculum. I was always eager to see the outside world. Studying in the US was a life-changing event that reshaped my way of thinking and vision for the world. Now I want to bring children worldwide an international classroom experience, where they can learn their subjects of interest from professionals worldwide and acquire a second language while doing it.

We believe our classes not only provide children with a better way to learn a second language, but also help to promote global understanding and respect of cultural differences among our next generation of global citizens.

 

Our Impact on Global Education.

Our classes represent the next wave in language learning. we support content and language integrated learning approach where students learn a subject and a second language at the same time. We offer 100% language immersion class on different subjects, taught by native speaker teachers.  Here are some examples:

 

  • Weiqi/Go Class (Mandarin Immersion)
  • Fashion Design Class (Mandarin Immersion)
  • Classical Chinese Poetry Painting Class (Mandarin Immersion)
  • Harry Potter Art Class (English Immersion)
  • Chess Class (English Immersion)
  • Making your own piñata (Spanish Immersion)

Each class distinctly caters to children's interests as well as bringing out cultural motifs in the respective language. 

Our students hail from all over the world including China, the UK, Japan, Vietnam, Australia, and Canada. We have reached 1000 account registrations and 200 active students after a year of launching our website.

 

Our Project & Perks

Our greatest project right now is technological development. We have already begun working on an app that will make it more convenient to sign up for class, share assignments directly with teachers and get feedback, get class reminders, and allow parents and students to connect with each other in class groups.  It will also have smart functions such as making recommendations based on a student’s interest and language level. These specific details may come in stages, but the idea is that the app will improve the whole Bilin Academy experience for students, parents, and teachers.

We are asking for $50,000 to support our continuing website and app development.

  • For every dollar you give to us, we’ll give you the equal amount of credits toward our classes, valid at any time in the future.
  • Donating to our project is a great way to support worldwide language learning and to become an advocate of the Bilin community.

We're offering special prices for class credits, which you can use for your own child or give to someone else. Take advantage of this offer in our indiegogo campaign. Click on the perks for more information.

 

    Risks & Challenges

    Currently our classes are only in Mandarin and English. We hope to expand to other languages, but it will be difficult because we do not have the contacts readily available. We hope to include many languages such as Spanish, Japanese, Korean, and more.

    How to do this? We already have a well-built system for English and Mandarin classes, so we do have a head start towards our goal of adding more languages. We have a strong customer base and ways to find and interact with people in different countries. Our plan is to focus first on hiring Spanish-speaking and Japanese-speaking teachers through online platforms and slowly increase our reach.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Use our website, https://www.bilin.academy, and the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with these people:

    • Advocates for multilingual education. 

    • Supporters of integrated studies and content-based learning.

    • Anyone who'd like to see a global learning community for children in action.

    We are also looking for partners and mentors. Partners can help us expand our class offerings. If you are running a learning program and are interested in reaching the global market, contact us.

    Professional mentors can help us move onto the next stage of expanding the business and maintaining all the different aspects. Please contact us if you have experience in business and would like to do this.

Please contact us if you have experience in business and would like to do this.

story:
International Leadership Academy of Ethiopia is a not-for-profit high school (grades 9-12) that opened in 2013 in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.  We currently serve 100 students in the next school year. Our founding vision targets underserved, talented students with academic and leadership potential to become future leaders in Ethiopia.

In the three years of our existence, we have already exceeded our greatest hopes for these students.  Here are some examples:

  • This past summer we sent three students to Yale University 's highly competitive Young Global Scholars summer program on full scholarship.
  • All of our 10th graders ranked in the top 2 percent in the brutal, required national exam, the Matric, which is taken by just under 1,000,000 students.
  • Our students won a national Math competition.

 

A new school location we have found requires us to raise $150000 by Dec 2016

  • The funding will be to help pay for the new facilities.
  • Preserving a place for these students will help ensure they can continue their education uninterrupted
  • We are trying to reach as many people to help us as possible, and we have many fundraisers going on in parallel.
We truly believe in what we do, and the growth and developments of these students is an indication of the hard work and dedication of all involved in the school
 

If you cannot contribute, that's OK!  We would appreciate you helping get the word out and sharing this with your friends and family.

story:
ABOUT ME

Hi. My name is Sam Weaver and I live with my wife in Norfolk, Virginia (USA). I’m semi-retired from a lifetime of working mostly in sales, marketing and sales management. I’ve also taught business courses at several colleges. Recently I came across a company that’s making an impact on the business world and I want to help them grow and reach more business owners and entrepreneurs.

WHY THIS?

Forbes magazine tells us that 90% of new business FAIL. We’ve all seen businesses that have gone under after just a short time. Harvard Review tell us the number one reason for business failure is Lack of Experience. For instance, someone opens a restaurant because they love to cook and create scrumptious meals. They’re so good at it, their friends and family convince them they should go into the restaurant business, and maybe even help with the initial funding. But being a good cook isn’t enough, is it? They need to know how to staff and train their employees, how to properly market to attract customers, how to manage the business, how to keep records, develop a website, become knowledgeable about the legal issues, etc., etc.

Where does a business owner get the training they need? Universities offer MBA programs, but who has both the time to attend classes and the thousands of dollars required for tuition, books, etc?

Now there’s an answer… Digital Business Training. We provide the courses needed by business owners and entrepreneurs for a fraction of what the universities charge for their MBA courses. Most of ours are less than $100 each and almost all are under $300 each. We also offer personal coaching and live 3-day seminars featuring some of the best business trainers from around the world. Since we offer these courses digitally, we can make them available to anyone anywhere in the world… Cleveland to Cairo, Austin to Amsterdam.

Our goal for this project is $38,000. That’s the total needed to become positioned as a Top Consultant and for the training which requires me to first complete some weeks-long online courses (done), then to attend several live-event training sessions in the months ahead. The amount also allows for initial marketing costs.

When I taught college business courses, I could only reach a small number of students at a time. Now, through this digital format, we can reach thousands! To me, that’s exciting. Knowing how beneficial these top-notch courses are gives me the satisfaction of making a positive impact on the business world. I believe it’s our duty to “Pay It Forward” to the best of our ability. If you agree, please support this effort.

WHAT DO YOU GET?

First, of course, there’s a great feeling that comes from helping a business, any legitimate business, get up and running. And if that new business is one that provides critical help for OTHER businesses to survive and thrive, then that good feeling is multiplied many times. But it’s not just about the feelings… there are tangibles, too.

You’ll see there are different levels of “perks” based on your donation amount. You’ll receive a list to choose which course(s) you’d like to have, FREE for your donation. It might be something that will benefit your personal development, or something that will help you be a better businessperson or entrepreneur. Or, maybe you’d like your “perk” be a gift to someone you know who is struggling in business. The choice is entirely yours. The point is, you’ll be receiving good value for your involvement in helping us reach our goal and helping business people and entrepreneurs worldwide.

WHAT IF WE FALL SHORT OF THE GOAL… OR GO OVER IT?

This effort will go forward regardless of the amount of the total funding. If we fall short, it will just make progress slower. We’ll need to use the proceeds from sales to fund further training and marketing. I am totally dedicated to making this work because it’s so important to help struggling businesses.

If we go over the goal, it means we can do more marketing to spread the word that what we have is available, worldwide. It also allows for more training for myself and others that come on board to assist. More trained consultants means more personal business coaching we can offer.

IF YOU CAN’T CONTRIBUTE BUT STILL WANT TO HELP…

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Indiegogo provides some “share” tools for this purpose. Think of all the people you know, not just business people and entrepreneurs. Use your email list, Facebook, Twitter, and any other means to spread the word. Believe me, it all helps.
