story:
Phase I:  Emotional Intelligence

Short Summary

We'll create a free online library for the healthcare workforce designed to promote emotional intelligence (EQ) and interpersonal skills!  There isn't much of this training in medical and nursing schools and the skills are essential for working together in teams and providing care that is heartfelt and safe!  


These alarming and pervasive problems can all be linked to difficulties with , ineffective communication, teamwork, & leadership!

  • Over 1100 preventable deaths in USA/per day associated with medical errors! 
  • Occupational injuries to the healthcare workforce that are 30x the rate of construction workers!
  • A destructive lack of respect that runs rampant in many facilities!

Learn more about how emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills are contributing to above problems and why improv is a perfect solution!




Just imagine:

  • Doctors and nurses listening!
  • Nurses, patients, and families speaking up!
  • The healthcare team working together extremely well!
  • Respect and compassion are in the air!
  • Care is heartfelt and safe (workplaces are too)!

The online Improvoscopy library will be full of resources designed to promote positive human interactions, (EQ in Phase I,  followed by, communication, teamwork, and leadership in Phases II-IV).  

Project backers will be helping to create A FREE website that all hospitals, nursing homes, clinics etc will have access to!  



When Phase I is complete,  doctors, nurses, administrative leaders everywhere will find lesson plans and teaching videos for 4-5 activities all geared towards building EQ!  (Links are to draft demos.)  


Improvoscopy: 

Serious Play for Safe Care! 



How will the money be spent?

In phase I, we'll get some healthcare professionals, improvisors, and trainers to become the Improvoscopy Players and gather for a full day of learning  improv activities that focus on building EQ. With some improv consulting input, I'll teach the group and have the process filmed. Once done,  I'll design lesson plans, and with help,  edit the film to bite-size learning moments.  We'll create and launch the website and 'VOILA' improvoscopy.com will be out there! 

Your contribution will help cover workshop development, filming, editing, participant' stipend and lunch, artwork, website development, executive assistance, perks, and miscellaneous administrative costs.  

Budget

Cost of Project:  $17,423

Cost of Fabulous Perks & shipping: $ 15,569

Total Cost:  $32,992

You'll find a detailed budget here.


Magnitude of Impact

The positive rippling effect of improved emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills will have a huge and positive impact on patient safety, patient experience, workforce safety, and career satisfaction.  

Also, because healthcare professionals care for and work with the entire spectrum of human diversity,  positive human behaviors could reach deep into our social fabric in immeasurable and healing ways. 
Who is leading the project?


Beth's Track Record


My biggest projects include: two books, the ground-breaking textbook, Successful Nurse Communication  and award-winning self-published Confident Voices.  I  also publish and write for the "Confident Voices in Healthcare" blog, and led the grassroots effort resulting in the youtube:  Interruption Awareness:  A Nursing Minute for Patient Safety.  In grad school, I built a model that used theatre games to teach emotional intelligence to kids! I love projects with a mission and if you'd like more details of my career, please check out my CV.  


Who else is on the team?

Joanne is a talented and enthusiastic graphic design artist who has a passion for projects that help our planet and our species.  I'm very happy she said she'd do the artwork and be a creative consultant for Improvoscopy!


Currently:  VP Marketing at PS It Matters

Previously: 

-Project Manager, Mayo Designs

-Owner, Redwing Hill Designs, www.redwinghill.com

Paul is has a rare combination of social service, teaching,  and IT work in healthcare so he is the perfect person to create the Improvoscopy.com website!  I'm delighted that he's said "Yes!".   


Currently:  Healthcare for the Homeless IT
Families First Health & Support Center

Previously:  

-Assistant Director, SeaCare Health Services

-Protective Service Social Worker, Massachusetts Department of Social Services


I have people in mind for other roles so stay tuned to meet them as the launch unfolds.  (If you are a healthcare professional or improvisor and would like to apply to be one of the Improvoscopy Players, email beth@bethboynton.com.)


Stretch Goals

Any funds exceeding our goal will go towards Phase II-Communication, Phase III-Teamwork, and Phase IV-Leadership.  And if we surpass that we will hold a workshop devoted to more complex activities like status games.  If we fall short, the money donated will go towards fulfilling perks and free local med improv workshops. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'll be grateful for your help in any way that you are able to!  Here are some ideas:

  • Sign up for "Confident Voices in Healthcare" Blog.  I'll be promoting from there and it would be great if you can share on your social media channels.
  • Would you talk it up with your friends and maybe your local healthcare professionals and promise to email them a link to the campaign?
  • Do you have a story about an experience in healthcare that could support the cause.  This could be a positive or negative one that highlights how emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills made a difference or maybe a time when you were frustrated and something went wrong.  These make great blogposts. Here's a one I recently wrote:  A Simple Gesture and Beautiful Story about Building a Therapeutic Relationship. 
  • Do you know any journalists or reporters who might publish a story?  I'm happy to help with interviews or a press release!
  • Maybe you'd like to donate something as a perk?  

Have questions?  Ideas?  Concerns?

Please email beth@bethboynton.com.  We'll start an FAQ!
Thank you!

Sign up for "Confident Voices in Healthcare" Blog.  I'll be promoting from there and it would be great if you can share on your social media channels.

story:
Short Summary

Starting a movement to introduce tech into education, in a world where people are resistant to change, is not a short-term effort. Hi, I'm Joan and we are a bunch of slightly-crazy young professionals and students who will introduce tech entrepreneurship to high school students across the country by sharing our love for business, science, and technology!  

Our first project TechClash 2016 is a High School startup innovation competition with talks, workshops, and demos to let students see that this IS the 21st century, and technology is in their hands.

Learn more: http://thegarageph.com/

What We Need & What You Get

  • $300 to feed 120 HS Students (and 20 organizers) for the event, or they will go hungry.
  • $100 for printing expenses and petty logistics (IDs, tarpaulins, pens, paper, and tape).
  • $100 for speaker and judges' tokens, and TechClash shirts as give-aways! So that it's not a dull event.

The Impact

The Garage is a community that aims to inspire and enable the Filipino youth to start the next billion-dollar tech startup in the Philippines.


One day we'll have amazing conferences like this that showcase the cutting-edge with Filipinos leading that innovation.

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge is convincing high schools to send students because most of them have no idea what a "startup", "hackathon", or "pitch contest" is. We're in it for the long haul. We will slowly spread the tech & startup culture, building stronger Filipino talent and innovation in the unlikeliest of places.

Other Ways You Can Help

* If you know any HS students you can have them register for our contest! 

* College kids can sign up here.

* Freebies to give away would be awesome too!

Our first project TechClash 2016 is a High School startup innovation competition with talks, workshops, and demos to let students see that this IS the 21st century, and technology is in their hands.
Learn more: http://thegarageph.com/
   What We Need & What You Get  $300 to feed 120 HS Students (and 20 organizers) for the event, or they will go hungry.
$100 for printing expenses and petty logistics (IDs, tarpaulins, pens, paper, and tape).
$100 for speaker and judges' tokens, and TechClash shirts as give-aways! So that it's not a dull event.


The Impact 


The Garage is a community that aims to inspire and enable the Filipino youth to start the next billion-dollar tech startup in the Philippines.

One day we'll have amazing conferences like this that showcase the cutting-edge with Filipinos leading that innovation.
   Risks & Challenges Our greatest challenge is convincing high schools to send students because most of them have no idea what a "startup", "hackathon", or "pitch contest" is. We're in it for the long haul. We will slowly spread the tech & startup culture, building stronger Filipino talent and innovation in the unlikeliest of places.
    Other Ways You Can Help * If you know any HS students you can have them register for our contest! 
* College kids can sign up here.
* Freebies to give away would be awesome too!

story:
What's Happening?

My name is Bailey! I am seventeen years old and am currently in Huron Heights' OUTREACH club! We will be travelling to Panama in the Spring of 2017!

In order to embark on this journey I need to be able to pay for it! The cost of the trip is $2800, I need to raise $2000 more in order to be able to send myself to Panama and help make real change!

This trip is life changing. Of course it is a first for me and that is incredible, but the opportunities provided to the citizens of Panama is even more spectacular. As students we will be arriving in Panama with the goal of making education accessible for all, and in order to do that we will be learning as well. Learning with farmers, children and people from all walks of life in Panama.  

This trip will provide me with a learning curve steeper than any that I have ever endured and I could not be more thrilled. 

Can't Contribute?

Any help on this journey is great! Make sure to give this page a share and spread the word, anything helps!

Thank you for providing  Huron Heights' the opportunity to change the world.

Baaaailey Shantz

story:
It's a Dream we have for these Children

The school we want to build is for providing good, competitive education to the children in Jaora and near by 20 small Villages, We want to start this school for Students who are financially weak. We have a vision to give these great minds a chance to explore and learn, develop and compete with the challenging society we want to implement a new model of education while is more skill based, career development oriented as the need of time is.

The place Jaora a small town in India (Madhya Pradesh State), You would be in love with this place the moment you will be here. It is  full of natural beauty and beautiful people around. 

 My dad has been a part of an educational NGO (Saraswati Shishu Mandir) for  12 year now, he and the team has build the school from scratch to over 1000+ student, over which nearly 40% students study with Scholarships or free. 

I had my primary education from Jaora, went out of station for secondary and higher education and now I am working in a multinational company as a Software Developer. 

I have been an Educationalist since my college days, have taught more than 1000+ student during my college as a teacher in  three  different NGO's, I have also been conducting free career counselling session for helping student choose the correct career path.

The standard of teaching in Indian Engineering College's lacks the industry standard and requirements, after realizing this we also started an Internship program to link college student to software companies. This helped student gain more practical knowledge gave them required skill set. We wish to provide the same standard of education to students in schools.

 My Uncle, is a social activist, he started a NGO "Atal Gram Vikas Samajik Sansthan"  in 2003 for educational development in villages. He is deeply attached with upliftment of villages in the area and has also been part of  "Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan" a pilot programme by Indian Government which aims at providing free primary education to children of  Indian villages with population of over 5000. We are a team of 40 social activist joining hands to fight the illiteracy. 

It's time to take a big leap! 

As you saw in the video still a big set of students are still uneducated and the no. is growing, we want to join our hands to the government efforts to "Teach India" and "Skill India" with this project, we want to upgrade our educational standard, sports facilities and give opportunity to explore the world to as many students as we can for free . The reason we say Competitive is because 60% of youth from city has to go outstation for work, many of them fail to compete with the challenging society. We envision to provide student the best of class education, including smart classrooms, open school policies for developing skill, entrepreneur club, linking them to international/national societies, sports Facilities, Helping them explore their abilities and providing them  a chance to grow .

Project Plan: 

The Need Right now is to start with the Civil Works ( building Construction ), so that we can start the session in 2017 April, We now need the Global Community Support to get this plan to real:

Costing Details to start the School:

  • Building Construction 11 classrooms, 2 office, 2 labs ( Chemistry and Biology ), sports room, music rooms, sanity, Computer lab, Entrepreneur club house more like a incubation centre. Construction: 20,000 sq ft
    Costs Around: 80,000$
    Phase I: 8 Classrooms, Computer Lab, Sports room, 1 Staff Room. (80,000 $)
    Phase II: 3 Classrooms, 2 Labs, Music Room, Incubation Centre. (30,000$)
  • Site development: sports Facilities: Costing 20,000$
    InDoor Sports Facilities (Badminton, Carrom, Chess, Tcondo, Yoga, Gymnasium ) and OutDoor sports: Football, Cricket, Volleyball, Badminton, Swimming.
  • Your Donation Directly go to the Construction of the School, We would be starting the construction in next 2 months, each donation Accounts to least a Brick in the School and a step in the life of thousands of Students who would study here for going years, this is no short thing we are planning, it's a dream of lifetime and a reality to many.
  • For us there is no turning back, even if we could not arrange the funds instantly, we will be starting the school without any delay at a rented place and will also continue making effort to  finance  our own building as planned,
  • Your small help could change lot of innocent lives.

I make a Difference:

Educating a kid is no less than giving someone a life, think about our life's if we were not educated, Education does not just mean bookish knowledge, it's about knowing everything we need to survive, to give back to the society we have grown from.

  • This Project is not just about a building a school, it's about helping students with a new life, educating them to compete with the Society, a chance to stand and develop themselves as a human with feelings for other living. Being a developing nation, our economy depends on the people completely, the need of the time is skilled people, with a vision to create the same, we need to support each other for a  better world. By 2022 the world would have the maximum youth population, how amazing it could be with young educated minds.
  • We have worked in setting up many primary schools in villages with the help of local and Government policies, this time we want to create a much developed education system to make justice to the Students at small place.
  • If this Goes Possible we move on to Develop more Schools in other part if the Country.

Risks & Challenges

The Biggest Risk we are at is we have already been "all in" to get a suitable place for developing this school. In case we could not receive enough funds to build the School right away, it would be a delay in starting the School. We have promised many student for this. We would have to start the School at a rented place with not enough facilities as we planned for the kids.

  • We will do all possible things to achieve the target, campaigns, counselling sessions, fundraising events to get this project live, this is just the start to our educational reform. 

Volunteer:

Every one is most welcome to be a part of the School, With the sweet voices of the children we request you to support in every possible way:

  • Speak about this to your friends, family, help us gain funds to achieve the targets.

  • Please share Online links are just a click away, this is how we can achieve this, please spread the word.

  • As the school starts you can even teach Students with your expertise through online classes.

  • Last for now, Stay Connected, your support does much for us to stand.

story:
Executive Summary

I am very concerned about the lack of learning and studying skills I see in many kids.  Many teachers and parents teach knowledge but not the basic skills needed to learn and apply such knowledge.  Students also struggle with the expression of their ideas in part because they do not know how to organize them in ways that others can follow easily.

I developed three writing lessons that are guaranteed to help students write better AND faster.  I have taught these lessons in workshops and private sessions but I can only reach a few students this way.  I want to share my ideas and impact more students.  Students are more likely to watch videos than read through a stack of paper.  Therefore, I'm raising funds to make videos of these lessons for them.  Funds will be used to make the videos, distribute them online for free, and buy advertisements to bring in more viewers.

There's one more lesson included in the package: How to Study (and Take Notes).  It covers everything from when-where-and-how study techniques and a note-taking system (yea, a whole system, not just some random techniques).  This lesson by itself is worth more than $5!  Or you can spend hours researching on the Internet and create the system on your own...

The four lessons are being "sold" as one perk that will help students write better and faster and study better, guaranteed!  By using modern computer-based tools instead of just paper & pen, one can categorize ideas, organize his thoughts, structure the writing properly, get more feedback from others, and improve the final product much more easily than ever before.

I believe critical learning skills should be made freely available to everyone.  I'm using the written curriculum to raise money to achieve that goal.  By buying what I offer here, you'll be benefiting many more students in the future while helping your kids today!

What I Need

I set a very small goal of $10,000 to be raised by selling my written curriculum for just US$5 each.  You, by buying the written curriculum, will help me buy time from my day-time job to work on the videos, pay for a small video lab at a local school so they can use my project to each kids video production, and help pay for online advertisements and social media campaigns.  The funding priorities are: video lab, my time, and online advertising.  We are also working on equipment donation for the video lab.


What You Get

I think this curriculum would have such a great appeal to most parents that I can raise the funds I need by charging very little but encouraging everyone to spread the word.  But instead of waiting for the videos which may take time to design and produce, you will receive the written curriculum now and benefit your children today.  If your child does not want to read through them and practice, you may have to learn the techniques yourself and teach them.  But at least you'll have something in hand in exchange for the small contribution you make here.  If the video is not produced due to lack of funding, at least you are not left empty-handed.

Indiegogo requires that we offer you the items as "perks" and so this 4-part curriculum on writing is being "sold" for just $5.  I encourage you to get the curriculum and if you like what you see, come back and leave a comment (hopefully a favorable one), and spread the word.

I know this curriculum will help students with their writing, research, and speech preparations.  They may learn more skills such as critical thinking and analysis through these practices.  I promise you this will be the best $5 you will ever spent for your child.

Some of you may wish to contribute more than the minimum amount because you believe in what I do and want to be part of this effort.  I made a few perks that are purely for such contributions.  In exchange, you will be recognized in the videos and on the website that I will build.  I may throw in more education-related freebies.

If I don't get the money I need, I'll still figure out a way to make this happen because I care about this cause.  If I don't have money for advertising, it just means fewer students will find out about this.  That's why your supplemental contributions will be very helpful.


Other Ways You Can Help

The best thing anyone can do for this project is to spread the word by e-mail or via various social media channels.  Even the best students can benefit from having more ideas to do things better and faster.

I also want to improve the curriculum.  Please send me your ideas.  I may not be able to answer your e-mails individually, but I will try to answer them by posting responses here.

I have other curricula that I wish to develop.  I just need time and money, and in my case money can actually buy time away from my work.  If you are interested in supporting my efforts, please contact me through the e-mail address you'll receive with any purchase and let's find ways to help our children.  Together we can make a difference in millions of lives.


Frequently Asked Questions

(Actually, these are questions that I think you may want to ask but may be too embarrassed to do so...)

How would I find out about the videos once they are ready?

I'll e-mail all backers and put the links on this page.  (Hmmm, that's one more reason to buy one of the perks here...)

Why should I pay for this written curriculum if you are going to produce videos?

Three simple reasons:
1.  You get the lessons today and can teach your students now.  Depending on funding, it may take me a long time to get the videos made.  Is your child's success in school worth more than $5?
2.  It's not everyday that you can be part of something so beneficial to so many for so little money.  For a contribution of $50 or above, you get your name mentioned in the video(s).
3.  Unless you are on my mailing list by buying at least the $5 perk, how would I know to tell you when the videos are made?

Are these copyrighted materials?

Yes.  I applied for copyright in the US and was accepted.  I did not do this so I can sue violators.  Rather, I want to prevent someone from taking this material and limiting the distribution in the future.  I'm not in a position to fight such legal battles.  Thus I hope by applying for copyright up front, I can deter such schemers.

Can I give this curriculum to my friends?

You will be violating the copyright laws of the US.  I made the cost as low as I can and I have to wonder what is the motivation for giving this out in violation of the law when the cost is so low.

Also in my experience, most people do not treasure what they did not pay for.  If they actually paid $5 for this, they will be more likely to read and use it.

I'm a school teacher.  Can I use this in my class?

Yes.  As I said, no one should really own these critical learning skills.  Please teach them whatever you see suitable.

I'm a for-profit educational firm.  Can I use this in our classes?

Sure, but I think it's only fair if you donate some money to the cause.  You will also be mentioned in the videos as one of the supporters!  Consider your contribution advertising for your firm.

I don't agree with your philosophy, perspective, or techniques.  What can I do?

I welcome all comments and criticisms for it is through such feedback that I can learn and improve my curriculum.  Once you purchase any of the perks, you'll see my e-mail and can e-mail me in private.  I may not have time to answer your questions but be assured that I'll read them, eventually.

You can also leave comments on this site also, but please keep in mind that if your negative remarks are excessive, you may deter some students from getting these lessons and learn something valuable.  So please keep your differences of opinion as just that -- differences.  Let the other students judge for themselves.  Please don't try to sabotage this campaign just because we disagree on some of the points I make.

My kid doesn't want to read the material.  What can I do?

That's the exact reason why I want to produce the videos.  Now you know my frustration.  Even my own kid doesn't want to read my instructional materials.

As for you, I'd encourage that you go through the lessons, learn the tools and techniques, and work with him on one or two writing assignments.  Once he sees how this can really help him write better and faster, he will keep using it.  People are lazy, and will always accept ways to do less work to get the same or better results.  That's how we make progress.

I like what you do.  What else are you working on?  Can I be part of it?

First of all, I'm very honored that you read through this long webpage and are truly interested in this initiative.

If this campaign is successful, I may do this again for the other lessons.  The media lab I build will enable me to make more videos.  Please express your interest and we can discuss possibilities.  As of this writing, I haven't decided on what to do.  Let's just finish this campaign and see if this is a viable model of financing worthwhile projects.

story:
URBAN HARVEST FARM AT UJIMA …
GOOD FOOD EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN IN EAST NEW YORK, BROOKLYN

Slow Food NYC is dedicated to Good, Clean, and Fair Food for All.  We believe that everyone has the right to ample, culturally meaningful, delicious food that is good for human health and well-being, the planet, and those who labor to bring food to our tables. 

We bring these values to Urban Harvest Farm at Ujima, our tuition-free, educational, urban farm in East New York, Brooklyn.  East New York suffers limited availability of fresh, wholesome food and disproportionate incidences of diet-related disease - obesity and diabetes.  Your financial support of Urban Harvest at Ujima will help us EXPAND and IMPROVE the educational experiences we can provide to help meet these challenges.

ABOUT URBAN HARVEST AT UJIMA

In 2010, Slow Food NYC turned an abandoned community garden into a thriving educational urban farm - bringing a little more beauty, good and clean food, and laughter and learning into the neighborhood. 

Urban Harvest at Ujima is a safe, secure place where children are provided with a structured, five-day program of hands-on gardening experiences, age appropriate food and farming focused lessons and activities, nutrition education, and communal good food preparation and enjoyment... experiences that help prepare them to make healthy choices, lead healthy lives, and act for the health of their families and community. 

WE HAVE BIG PLANS FOR UJIMA THIS SUMMER AND YOU CAN HELP!

With the support of community partners and supporters, like YOU, we will continue to dedicate our time and passion to this important work because we believe that learning about and experiencing Good, Clean, and Fair Food in a convivial atmosphere has great impact on children.  

Building upon the success of 2015, our goal is to EXPAND and IMPROVE the educational experiences we can provide at Ujima.  The funds raised through this campaign will go towards:

  -  Farming an additional, near-by lot and erecting hoop houses to increase the amount of good, clean food we can grow and bringing laying hens and honey bees to the farm;

-  Expanding farm operation hours to incorporate afternoon gardening opportunities for senior citizens (providing inter-generational education opportunities for the children);

-  Developing a “food box” program to provide fresh vegetables and herbs (and flowers for the table) to each Student and Senior Farmer each week;

-  Conducting a weekly Student Farmer-operated, community farm-stand.

Our plans are ambitious and will come to fruition with YOUR SUPPORT!

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP

Slow Food NYC is run entirely, with love and dedication, by volunteers and 100% of the funds raised for Urban Harvest at Ujima are used for farm operation.  Here is what your contributions can help accomplish:

  -  $25 can help stock the cupboard with food preparation staples;

  -  $150 can help buy a new pop-up tent to cover our “farm stand”;

  -  $250 can build a new hoop house to extend the growing season or a new chicken coop for laying hens;

  -  $500 can compensate a neighborhood high school youth to work as a Student Farmer Peer Mentor for a month, during July or August;

  -  $1,000 can help provide Student Farmers with lunch, prepared with fresh, seasonal, local, ingredients, for a month during July or August;

  -  $1,200 can help build new raised planting beds at a new farm site.

The Impact

During the summer of 2015, Student Farmers:

  -  Planted and tended 60 varieties of vegetables, herbs, and flowers;

  -  Harvested about 150 pounds of herbs, salad and cooking greens, and other vegetables;

  -  Prepared lunch together every day, incorporating fresh food from the farm (about 2,000 snacks and lunches, largely plant-based, were prepared and enjoyed);

  -  Composted about 175 pounds of plant material and food scraps; and

  -  Increased, while at the farm, the number of fruits and vegetables they consumed daily by about 100%. 

Check this for more about Urban Harvest at Ujima 2015 - http://www.slowfoodnyc.org/download/sfnyc-uh-2015-report.pdf

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about us! please like us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/Ujima-Garden-192106040837994/ and https://www.facebook.com/SlowFoodNYC/

CONTACT US

We would LOVE to tell you more about what we do and how important Ujima is to the community.  E-mail Dee Dee Tiller – deedeertiller@gmail.com - for more information!

story:
We are a group of people from several different churches coming together to organize a festival with the purpose to promote unity within the body of Christ and to bring people to Christ. A lot of the time we go through the motions of life, with a sense of complacency, and we stick to our church and don't desire to fraternize with other churches. Imagine how much would change in our cities if we broke out of the four walls of our churches and joined hands with others. This vision is important to us because we believe that there is power in unity and that God has called us to do big things.  This festival will have music, food, games, information booths; something for everyone. We have a church that has graciously opened its doors to hold the event, and we are raising money to pay for the sound equipment and other necessary expenses. Our goal is to raise $1600.00 and it will all go towards this event and its expenses. No donation is too small and any help is appreciated. If you cannot help with a monetary donation, please share this link and help us get the word out. We are excited to hold our first ever annual festival and know that it won't be the last. Thank you for your time. God bless. 

Somos un grupo de personas dediferentes iglesias unidas para organizar un Festival Cristiano. El proposito del Festival sera promover la unidad dentro del cuerpo de Cristo y evangelizar a los que todavia no conocen de Jesus. Muchas veces nuestra vida se convierte en una rutina, no pensamos en hacer algo mas que asistir a nuestras iglesias los domingos, noconfraternizamos con otras iglesias en otras actividades. Imaginese cuanto cambiaria nuestras ciudades si salieramos de las cuatro paredes de nuestra iglesia y nos unieramos con otras.
Esta vision es importante para nosotros porque creemos que hay poder en la unidad y que Dios nos ha llamado a hacer grandes cosas. En este festival tendremos musica, comida, juegos, puestos de informacion y varias otras actividades; habra algo para todos. Ya contamos con el local, sera en una iglesia que generosamente nos a abierto las puertas, pero hay otros gastos que tenemos que cubrir como ejemplo el equipo de sonido. Nuestro objetivo es recaudar $1600.00 y todo se destinara a este evento y sus gastos. Ninguna donacion es demasiado pequena, y cualquier ayuda se les agradece. Si no puede ayudar monetariamente, le pedimos que comparta este enlace y nos ayude a correr la voz. Estamos muy contentos de celebrar nuestro primer festival, y sabemos que no sera el ultimo. Gracias por su tiempo, que Dios le bendiga.

story:
Short Summary

The High Distinction Academy is a tutoring center for High School students to be opened in Sydney in 2017.

How will the High Distinction Academy set itself apart from other tutoring centers?

  • Students will only be taught by qualified teachers.
  • It will adopted a flipped classroom learning method - Students will watch prerecorded lessons by their teachers from home on their electronic devices, so that when they come to class, the time in the classroom is most efficiently spent on problem solving and focusing on the areas that need the greatest attention. 
  • Parents will have complete visibility at all times - Parents will have the ability to log onto our learning management system at any time and view their child's progress and attendance.

But there is more to the High Distinction Academy than just being a brilliant tutoring center...

Each term of the school year, the High Distinction Academy will fund four different causes:

  • Term 1 - "Refreshing the thirsty"
    During this term, the High Distinction Academy will partner with charities that build wells in areas without fresh drinking water.
  • Term 2 - "Feeding the hungry"
    During this term, the High Distinction Academy will partner with charities that feed those around the world that are starving.
  • Term 3 - "Rescue"
    During this term, the High Distinction Academy will partner with charities that rescue and rehabilitate those that have been trafficked.
  • Term 4 - "Homes for the homeless"
    During this term, the High Distinction Academy will partner with charities that build homes for those without shelter.

The motivation and reason behind the good works performed by the High Distinction Academy can be found in its motto:

"Let your light shine before others, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven"
                                                  -Jesus (Matthew 5:16)
 

Both the students and the parents will be continuously kept up to date on the progress of each of these projects. They will see evidence of what it looks like when you shine a light in the darkness and help those that are suffering. 

During our end of year Christmas party, the High Distinction Academy will showcase a powerful summary of all the projects that were funded that year.

Students and parents will see videos of all the lives that were impacted and know that they were part of their journey, and that they played a role in making a difference in the world by choosing to study at the High Distinction Academy.

During this night, the High Distinction Academy will award key students demonstrating innate social entrepreneurial talent with a Gold Philanthropy Award and an internship with a successful social entrepreneur. 

The High Distinction Academy will raise future doctors, lawyers, engineers, and scientists with a heart to care for the broken and change the world!
 

An elite educational center. 
A social enterprise.
A light in the darkness.
Creator of future world changers.

This is the High Distinction Academy.
 

What We Need
 

  • Give towards this cause. Every cent will be used to fund the startup of the High Distinction Academy and give us the security we need to ensure that we launch strong. 
  • SHARE SHARE AND SHARE - Share this campaign with all of your friends and family, the more people we reach, the higher our chances of meeting our target ! 
     

Thank you for taking part in this journey!

By helping you are playing a pinnacle role in the creation of the High Distinction Academy. When we are established and you hear of all the lives that have been impacted, you will know that you helped make it possible!

story:
Who we are?

•We are a group of pupils in Year 11 at St. Joseph's College. We entered the F1 in Schools competition in order to take part in a very exciting, unique project and also to push ourselves in different ways while undertaking different responsibilities.

•Our objective as a team is to design an highly effective car that is capable of outperforming our competitors and a car led campaign that can allow us to do well in the competition.

Sponsorship and Perks

•The competition promotes skills such as marketing, finance and media skills. We are looking to get sponsorships in order to manufacture the car and manage a budget for travel, accommodation, R&D and marketing.

•Sponsorship is a necessity for a team such as ours. We have a lot to offer but we need the investment to be able to deliver this project efficiently.

• Since we are entering this unique competition we need your support to help us win.

The Impact

The competition will allow us as a group to grow as people and help us to build and learn skills that will help us in the future world of work. We also want to share our skills and inspire young people to learn new skills and push themselves to achieve their full potential.

We also want to help our local community so if exceed our target amount we will donate any surplus to local charities that help disadvantaged young people. If we win we will also donate the £10,000 of equipment to a school and allow it to be used by community groups to help benefit the wider society.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We need you help to win this competition so of you have any skills or services you can offer contact us @igniteformula1 on Twitter and Facebook. Please share this page with all your friends and follow us on twitter and Facebook @igniteformula1 .

story:
Bugs are everywhere. Regardless of place, age, status, etc., everyone knows a bug! Because of their ubiquitousness bugs are often overlooked or ignored in our everyday lives, and many may not know that a miraculous micro world of insects and arachnids exists right under our noses, just waiting to be explored!

Portland Insectarium: We are an all-women team of biologists, artists, and entrepreneurs with a love of bugs and the desire to bring fantastic science knowledge and experiences to everyone.

Our Impact: We believe in promoting diversity within the sciences. Because we are mobile, Portland Insectarium’s BugMobile will allow us to bring educational museum experiences directly to the community, including to those who would otherwise have little access to such activities. 

To realize our vision of a unique mobile museum, we are remodeling a donated 20 ft RV, converting the interior and exterior into exhibit and display space. This involves removing several large appliances from the RV, adding additional counter space, building displays, signage and more. (Thanks to the ADX Portland fabrication team for their awesome assistance in making the BugMobile come to life!)

We believe in the power of hands-on and inquisitive learning. To develop engaging and memorable exhibit experiences we are also in need of equipment for interactive exhibits, such as magnifying glasses, microscopes, signage and visual media. 

PLEASE DONATE! Your contribution supports these first stages of Portland's only natural history museum!

Share your support and follow Portland Insectarium and the BugMobile's transformation:

www.instagram.com/pdxinsectarium

www.twitter.com/pdxinsectarium

www.facebook.com/portlandinsectarium

story:
لمتحدثي اللغة العربية الرجاء الذهاب إلى الفقرة الثانية 

Introduction: 

Innovast Technology was founded in 2014 in Istanbul, Turkey to help students reignite their curiosity, love and passion for knowledge and learning through technology! 
Our focus is to use Educational Robotics to improve the educational and psychological status of refugee children.
Robot Cafe is a program we created to help students that are behind or have dropped out of school catch up with their peers. In addition to providing social and mental support, we've customized our program to meet STEM education guidelines, and have integrated additional subject areas such as literature, art, and philosophy.

We believe that educational robotics is a powerful tool that can help students of diverse backgrounds learn how to work together, and also bring their families close together through collaboration and empathy.

Check out our work : 

Find us on Facebook:  
http://facebook.com/Innovast-Technology/posts

Our goal

Our goal is to raise $68,000. When you sponsor a child for $23, it provides the following:

  • Transportation for students from home to the center
  • Robotic Trainers to work with students
  • Psychological evaluations to ensure a safe learning environment
  • Supplies (from paper to desks)
  • Laptops
  • Robot's kits
  • Training mats

With your help, we hope to build a strong, optimistic generation and a bright, secure future for many kids.

The Impact

  1. The very first impact is the logical thinking gained from the programming skill that the children will learn
  2. Mechanical aspects that will make the children's imagination vision come true in physical shapes
  3. Teamwork and collaboration skills through "group work division" way and tasks distribution
  4. Closing the educational gaps by providing a scientific experiment compatible with formal curriculum
  5. Psycho-social support

Our children have the right to learn 
"Everyone has the right to an education" 

#Innovast_children 

 

Former Projects and Reports:

Syria’s Hope Project:

In cooperation with  Physicians Across Continents we started Syria's hope project, It focuses on the group affected most by the war in Syria, the orphans in particular and the refugees in general. By introducing Robotic Technology in the form of classes in school.
Project Goals:
Encourage the kids to learn science by using Robot Technology in the form of scientific experiments. Provide social behavior and scientific assessment.
Provide psycho-social support and boost the children’s self confidence.
Strengthen the children’s mechanical, programming and visual skills as well as their recitation skill.

First Stage:
June 2015 - 125 orphans - 7 hours (English subtitle included) 

 

Second Stage:
School year of 2015/2016 - 300 children - 24 hours 

Alaan TV report: https://youtu.be/7li5rIt-j-c

Al Arabiya Tv report:  https://youtu.be/Qsy_e9R1QJo

 

Future Scientists Tournament (FST):

It’s a series of competitions held by Innovast Technology to train children and young people in order for them to compete in local and global finals.
AJ+ report: (Arabic)

 

Aljazeera report: http://www.aljazeera.net/news/reportsandinterviews/2016/4/25/الروبوتيك-لتعليم-أطفال-سوريا-في-جنوب-تركيا

 

Orient TV report: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ucXON4tyBVc&amp...

Alaan TV report:  https://youtu.be/tpV8UZ3uS8U
 

Robot Cafe:

First Stage: 
Target no.:50 Children - Training hours: 30 hours - Project duration: 2 months.

First report: 

Second Stage:

Target no.:500 Children -Training hours: 48 hours - Project duration: 6 Months 

With your support we will be able to start this stage

Risks & Challenges

The main risks are reaching out to children to enrolled them in the program. Consistent attendance is challenging, as many children are working to help support their family. In addition to that, we need to earn their parent's trust in order for them to send their children. For that risk, we plan to invite parents to the school to see projects being presented by past students. We're hoping they will see the benefits of our work. Traveling to and from school can be another challenge. Our students' safety is our top priority. By working closely with the parents, we will help transport them to and from class. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? sure you can! please make some noise about Robot Cafe and share it with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools.
together we achieve more.

مقدمة:

أنشأت انوفاست تكنولوجي عام 2014 في استانبول - تركيا، لمساعدة الطلاب لاستعادة فضولهم وحبهم وشغفهم بالمعرفة والتعلم باستخدام التكنولوجيا! 

نركز على استخدام الروبوت التعليمي لرفع سوية التعليم والحالة النفسية للأطفال اللاجئين.

روبوت كافيه هو برنامج بدأناه لمساعد الطلاب المنقطعين عن التعليم، الأيتام والأطفال العاملين ليستطيعوا اللحاق بالأطفال المساوين لهم بالعمر. ولدعمهم نفسيا وعلمياً، برنامجنا معد حسب معايير STEM التعليمية، وأضفنا مهارات أخرى كمهارة العرض، البرمجة، الميكانيك، الرياضيات وعلم الأحياء.

الفئة الأكثر تضرراً هم الأطفال العاملين الذين يسعون لتأمين لقمة العيش لذويهم مما اضطرهم لترك المدرسة.

نؤمن بأن الروبوت التعليمي هو أداة تعليمية قوية تساعد الطلاب من فئات مختلفة ليتعلموا كيف يعملون سوياً، يطبقون ما تعلموه مباشرة بتجارب علمية مبنية خصيصاً لتناسب عمرهم الدراسي أيضاً تحفزهم أن يكونوا مشاركين في العملية التعليمية وليسوا فقط متلقين للمعلومة.

انظر عملنا:

صفحة الفيس بوك: https://www.facebook.com/Innovast.Technology

هدفنا:

نسعى للوصول إلى 500 طفل لتعليمهم لمدة ست أشهر. بكلفة 23 دولار شهريا للطفل الواحد نحتاج إلى 68,000 دولار ستستخدم لـ:

  • مركز مجهز للتدريب لمدة 6 أشهر فعلية.
  • مواصلات من وإلى المركز.
  • فريق من المدربين المحترفين لتدريب الأطفال ( 3 فرق، 3 أشخاص بكل فريق)
  • تجهيزات ( قرطاسية، طاولات، وأدوات أخرى...)
  • أجهزة كمبيوتر
  •  مجموعات الروبوتات EV3 مع مجموعات الإضافات
  •  رقعات تدريب

بجهودكم نستطيع بناء جيل قوي، متفائل ومشرق، بمستقبل آمن للكثير من الأطفال.

حملتنا مرنة الهدف، نحصل على دعم أكثر ندرب أطفالاً أكثر والعكس بالعكس.
يمكنكم مساعدتنا بالتبرع بأي مبلغ تريدونه أو عن طريق اختيار أحد الميزات الموجودة على اليمين ذات المبالغ المحددة

الأثر:

  1. الأثر الأول هو التفكير المنطقي الذي سيكتسبه الأطفال من خلال مهارة البرمجة المعطاة.
  2. المفهوم الميكانيكي الذي يجعل خيال الأطفال النظري يطبق أمامهم من خلال الأشكال التي سيبنوها.
  3. مهارة العمل الجماعي "العمل ضمن مجموعات" ومهارة توزيع المهام.
  4. ترميم الثغرة التعليمية من خلال توفير تجارب علمية متناسبة مع المنهاج المدرسي.
  5. دعم نفسي اجتماعي.

 

أطفالنا لهم الحق في التعلم - الجميع له الحق في التعلم - إيثار قصاب #أطفال_انوفاست


 

مشاريع وتقارير سابقة:

 مشروع أمل سوريا :

بالتعاون مع اطباء عبر القارات بدأنا مشروع أمل سوريا، يركز المشروع على الفئة الأكثر تضررا من الآثار السلبية للحرب في سوريا و هم الأيتام خاصة و اللاجئين عامة  و ذلك من خلال إدخال تقنية الروبوتيك على شكل حصص درسية في مدارسهم 

أهداف المشروع :

  • دعم الأطفال علميا حيث دخلت تقنية الروبوتيك على شكل تجارب علمية مناسبة لعمرهم الدراسي
  • توفير تقييم سلوكي اجتماعي و تقييم علمي للأطفال
  • توفير دعم نفسي اجتماعي و تعزيز ثقة الأطفال بنفسهم
  • تعزيز المهارات الميكانيكية و البرمجية و البصرية بالاضافة لمهارة الالقاء لدى الأطفال

المرحلة الأولى:
 شهر حزيران 2015 - 128 طفل يتيم - 7 ساعات
 

المرحلة الثانية:
العام الدراسي لسنة 2015 / 2016 - 300 طفل - 24 ساعة
قناة الآن:

قناة العربية:

 

مسابقة علماء المستقبل FST :

هي سلسلة من المسابقات التي تقيمها شركة انوفاست لتدريب و تأهيل الأطفال و اليافعين و ذلك للوصول بهم للنهائيات المحلية و العالمية.

تقرير قناة AJ+ :

تقرير قناة الجزيرة : http://www.aljazeera.net/news/reportsandinterviews/2016/4/25/الروبوتيك-لتعليم-أطفال-سوريا-في-جنوب-تركيا
 

قناة أورينت:  

https://youtu.be/ucXON4tyBVc

قناة الآن:

https://youtu.be/tpV8UZ3uS8U

روبوت كافيه :

المرحلة الأولى : 

العدد المستهدف : 50 طفل - عدد الساعات التدريبية: 30 ساعة - مدة المشروع: شهران

المرحلة الثانية :  

العدد المستهدف: 500 طفل – عدد الساعات التدريبية: 48 ساعة - مدة المشروع: 6 أشهر

بدعمكم سنستطيع أن نبدأ هذه المرحلة

 

المخاطر والتحديات:

التحدي الرئيسي هو تأمين اشتراك الأطفال لينضموا للمشروع والحفاظ على حضورهم. الأهالي بحاجة ليكسبوا ثقتنا ليرسلوا أطفالهم للمركز. لهذا التحدي سنقوم بدعوة كل الأهالي لتقديم المشروع وفكرته لهم، والشي الأساسي الذي سيساعد بالحصول على ثقة الأهالي بكثرة هو تأمين المواصلات من وإلى المركز.

طرق أخرى تستطيع مساعدتنا فيها

لا تستطيع المشاركة؟ بالتأكيد يمكنك! رجاءً تأكد من أنك أخبرت كل أصدقائك بمشروع روبوت كافيه وشاركته على صفحات التواصل الإجتماعي لجلب الانتباه لأهميته باستخدام أدوات النشر لموقع انديغوغو.
معاً نستطيع أن ننجز أكثر.

أنشرو الحب، أنشرو الروبوتات  .^_^.

story_txt:
لمتحدثي اللغة العربية الرجاء الذهاب إلى الفقرة الثانية Introduction: Innovast Technology was founded in 2014 in Istanbul, Turkey to help students reignite their curiosity, love and passion for knowledge and learning through technology! Our focus is to use Educational Robotics to improve the educational and psychological status of refugee children.Robot Cafe is a program we created to help students that are behind or have dropped out of school catch up with their peers. In addition to providing social and mental support, we've customized our program to meet STEM education guidelines, and have integrated additional subject areas such as literature, art, and philosophy.We believe that educational robotics is a powerful tool that can help students of diverse backgrounds learn how to work together, and also bring their families close together through collaboration and empathy.Check out our work : Find us on Facebook:  http://facebook.com/Innovast-Technology/postsOur goalOur goal is to raise $68,000. When you sponsor a child for $23, it provides the following:
Transportation for students from home to the center
Robotic Trainers to work with students
Psychological evaluations to ensure a safe learning environment
Supplies (from paper to desks)
Laptops
Robot's kits
Training mats
With your help, we hope to build a strong, optimistic generation and a bright, secure future for many kids.The Impact
The very first impact is the logical thinking gained from the programming skill that the children will learn
Mechanical aspects that will make the children's imagination vision come true in physical shapes
Teamwork and collaboration skills through "group work division" way and tasks distribution
Closing the educational gaps by providing a scientific experiment compatible with formal curriculum
Psycho-social support
Our children have the right to learn "Everyone has the right to an education" #Innovast_children  Former Projects and Reports:Syria’s Hope Project:In cooperation with  Physicians Across Continents we started Syria's hope project, It focuses on the group affected most by the war in Syria, the orphans in particular and the refugees in general. By introducing Robotic Technology in the form of classes in school.Project Goals:Encourage the kids to learn science by using Robot Technology in the form of scientific experiments. Provide social behavior and scientific assessment.Provide psycho-social support and boost the children’s self confidence.Strengthen the children’s mechanical, programming and visual skills as well as their recitation skill.First Stage:June 2015 - 125 orphans - 7 hours (English subtitle included) 

 
Second Stage:School year of 2015/2016 - 300 children - 24 hours Alaan TV report: https://youtu.be/7li5rIt-j-cAl Arabiya Tv report:  https://youtu.be/Qsy_e9R1QJo 
Future Scientists Tournament (FST):It’s a series of competitions held by Innovast Technology to train children and young people in order for them to compete in local and global finals.AJ+ report: (Arabic) 
Aljazeera report: http://www.aljazeera.net/news/reportsandinterviews/2016/4/25/الروبوتيك-لتعليم-أطفال-سوريا-في-جنوب-تركيا
 Orient TV report: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ucXON4tyBVc&amp...
Alaan TV report:  https://youtu.be/tpV8UZ3uS8U Robot Cafe:First Stage: Target no.:50 Children - Training hours: 30 hours - Project duration: 2 months.First report: Second Stage:Target no.:500 Children -Training hours: 48 hours - Project duration: 6 Months With your support we will be able to start this stageRisks & ChallengesThe main risks are reaching out to children to enrolled them in the program. Consistent attendance is challenging, as many children are working to help support their family. In addition to that, we need to earn their parent's trust in order for them to send their children. For that risk, we plan to invite parents to the school to see projects being presented by past students. We're hoping they will see the benefits of our work. Traveling to and from school can be another challenge. Our students' safety is our top priority. By working closely with the parents, we will help transport them to and from class. Other Ways You Can HelpCan't contribute? sure you can! please make some noise about Robot Cafe and share it with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools.together we achieve more.Spread the love, spread the robots  .^_^.Who are we:Innovast Technologyhttps://www.facebook.com/Innovast.TechnologyThe company implementing the project.Strategic partners:Refugee Open Ware (www.row3d.org)Supports the use of advanced technology for helping refugeesNextFab (www.nextfab.com)Provides technical and educational support.Partners:Rahma Relief Foundationhttps://www.facebook.com/pg/RAHMA.RELIEF.FOUNDA...The sponsor of the first stage of the project that included 60 children for 2 months.assisting parties:The Educational and Cultural CenterOne of the projects of Homs League Abroad and one of the hosts of Robot Cafe.https://www.facebook.com/homsleague/?pnref=storyKareem HomeThe orphans are participants in the project.Pixle Art4PrintSupplier of printing services.https://www.facebook.com/Arak.print2/?pnref=lhcTeam: Mahmoud Al ShakfehFounder and Executive Director of Innovast TechnologyFounding Member and a member of the Board of Directors at Zaid Ibn Thabit Foundation - volunteerFounder and Director of ngo syria - http://ngosyria.org/ - volunteerA Contributor to Development Activities and Education.Judge of teamwork at The Robotic Championship, Syria.Founder and Board Member at SDI, Turkey - volunteerFormer Development Director at Brightsoft, SyriaFormer Development Manager at Bawabaty.netLamia Gorra:Bachelor in EconomicsTech with confidence - certified from queen Rania universitychildren Psychological Health - certified from queen Rania universityTRT trainer at children and war foundation

مشاريع وتقارير سابقة:
 مشروع أمل سوريا :
بالتعاون مع اطباء عبر القارات بدأنا مشروع أمل سوريا، يركز المشروع على الفئة الأكثر تضررا من الآثار السلبية للحرب في سوريا و هم الأيتام خاصة و اللاجئين عامة  و ذلك من خلال إدخال تقنية الروبوتيك على شكل حصص درسية في مدارسهم 
أهداف المشروع :

دعم الأطفال علميا حيث دخلت تقنية الروبوتيك على شكل تجارب علمية مناسبة لعمرهم الدراسي
توفير تقييم سلوكي اجتماعي و تقييم علمي للأطفال
توفير دعم نفسي اجتماعي و تعزيز ثقة الأطفال بنفسهم
تعزيز المهارات الميكانيكية و البرمجية و البصرية بالاضافة لمهارة الالقاء لدى الأطفال

المرحلة الأولى: شهر حزيران 2015 - 128 طفل يتيم - 7 ساعات 

المرحلة الثانية:العام الدراسي لسنة 2015 / 2016 - 300 طفل - 24 ساعةقناة الآن:

قناة العربية:

بدعمكم سنستطيع أن نبدأ هذه المرحلة
 
المخاطر والتحديات:
التحدي الرئيسي هو تأمين اشتراك الأطفال لينضموا للمشروع والحفاظ على حضورهم. الأهالي بحاجة ليكسبوا ثقتنا ليرسلوا أطفالهم للمركز. لهذا التحدي سنقوم بدعوة كل الأهالي لتقديم المشروع وفكرته لهم، والشي الأساسي الذي سيساعد بالحصول على ثقة الأهالي بكثرة هو تأمين المواصلات من وإلى المركز.
طرق أخرى تستطيع مساعدتنا فيها
لا تستطيع المشاركة؟ بالتأكيد يمكنك! رجاءً تأكد من أنك أخبرت كل أصدقائك بمشروع روبوت كافيه وشاركته على صفحات التواصل الإجتماعي لجلب الانتباه لأهميته باستخدام أدوات النشر لموقع انديغوغو.معاً نستطيع أن ننجز أكثر.
أنشرو الحب، أنشرو الروبوتات  .^_^.

:محمود الشقفة
مؤسس و المدير التنفيذي لشركة انوفاست تكنولوجيعضو مؤسس في مؤسسة زيد من ثابت الأهلية و عضو مجلس إدارة - متطوعمؤسس و مدير موقع دليل الخير   http://ngosyria.org- متطوعمساهم و مهتم في النشاطات التنموية و التربية و التعليممحكم عمل جماعي في بطولة الروبوتيك – سوريامؤسس و عضو مجلس ادارة في المؤسسة الدوليه للتنمية الاجتماعية و دعم الإنسان – تركيا - متطوعمدير التطوير سابقا في شركة برايت سوفت – سوريامدير التطوير سابقا في شركة بوابتي.نت – سوريا

-مستشارة تعليمية في شركة انوفاست تكنولوجي في تركيا.

story:
“This program changed my life; it improved my emotional and physical well-being. It gave me the tools I needed to be a self-advocate, peer leader, succeed in college and Reach my potential!”  Lazaro, a GDS Youth Advocate


What We Do!

Founded in 1996, Growth and Development Services (GDS) empowers youth challenged by social, educational, emotional and behavioral issues to Reach their Potential!  In 2002, GDS built out raw space in NYC’s Fort Washington Armory and developed a license agreement with the Department of Homeless Services (DHS) to help bring most needed therapeutic and recreational and programs to the Washington Heights/Inwood communities. Our program outcomes show that GDS’ multifaceted programs equip participants with the tools they need to be healthy, excellent leaders, succeed in college, and cope with life adversities.

GDS' Reach Your Potential (RYP) Program provides youth and young adult with the tools they need to succeed in school, college, work and life. The following services are offered for FREE to help youth develop their full potential:

  • Leadership Development and Life Skills Training
  • Mental Health Counseling
  • College Readiness/Success
  • Advocacy through Arts
  • Job/Career Readiness
  • Track and Fitness
  • Yoga and Meditation
  • Mentoring Program

Community in Need

The youth GDS works with live in some of the toughest neighborhoods in New York City:

  • the local high school graduation rate is approximately 55%
  • 14% of seniors at the local the high school are college-ready
  • 9% of low-income students graduate from college
  • mental health services are scarce
  • opportunities to learn are limited
  • community-based organizations are struggling with an increase in need and decreases in resources and funding

All of these factors put youth at risk for going down an unhealthy road in life and highlight the need for GDS’ therapeutic and educational programs. GDS’ programs make a direct impact in the lives of challenged youth. The Reach Your Potential Program provides a safe, educational and fun environment which fosters positive youth development and community engagement.


Our Impact and Proven Success: 

Our program outcomes/surveys from 2015-2016 show the Reach Your Potential Program equips participants with the tools they need to cope with school, work and “life.”

  • 100% of youth participants reported being more self-aware and had improved communication skills
  • 100% had a better understanding of self-advocacy
  • 100% of participants want to return to the program
  • 100% had a better understanding of advocacy and community issues

Campaign Goal

The $50,000 goal of our Campaign will go towards youth participants in the Reach Your Potential program! 

The Program components have been included within the perks to indicate where your donation will be utilized. 

                 We also invite you to Join our 20th Anniversary Celebration

                                   Saturday, November 19th, 7pm.

                                             Click below for Details.

20th Anniversary Event

Course Description

 

Important:-

The course audio is designed to play with earplug/headphone!

 

What is the course about?

This course is about writing a Arduino sketch from basics to complex project the microSD Temperature Logger and to simulate it in Proteus

The Supplement Materials such as sketch, schematics for Simulations and datasheets are given

This Course takes only 25 min to complete

 

The content of this course:-

Learn the hardware connection of serial-UART, SPI SD/uSD and i2C sensor

Explore the given schematic of uSD Temperature Logger

Learn the Arduino programming by using the provided error free sketch

Display and enter choice on serial-Monitor

ADC sensor operation

LCD Display Operation

i2C sensor oepration

SD card operation

Firmata Serial-USB operation

All combination of above operation into one piece the uSD Temperature Logger

 

At the end of this course, student is able to create their own uSD Temperature Logger using Arduino UNO and its shields

 

Keywords: arduino, Arduino, certified, Certified, programmer, Programmer, programming, Programming

 

What are the requirements?

The basic concepts of logic low (0) and logic high (1)

Setting up of Arduino IDE

Setting up of Proteus and WinImage

 

What am I going to get from this course?

At the end of this course, student is able to create their own uSD Temperature Logger using Arduino UNO and its shields

 

What is the target audience?

All Levels of Arduino Lovers

story:
ABOUT OUR PROJECT

A never before seen money management app that shows you the path to making your finances a walk in the park. 

  • Take back control to own your money, own your home, and smash your goals. 

7 Simple Tools For Financial Freedom:

  • A GOALS function that will help you set your sights on what you want.

  • PODCASTS for those that prefer to listen to secret insights from the world’s top advisers.
  • WATCH videos from the worlds top money making masters. 
  • TOOLS to assist modelling, projections, and budgeting.

  • Joining a COMMUNITY to share ideas with. Share the experience of building wealth. 
  • An amazing DASHBOARD to keep track of your progression. 

  • COMPETITIONS amongst other users on your level for real financial rewards. 

  • AD FREE. No advertising.  
  • We are planning so much more but we cannot give it all away!

One Percent Wealth is exclusive and available only through Indiegogo. All of the funding we receive goes directly towards producing our high-powered finance application for delivery early 2018. The only pockets getting filled by this campaign will be yours when the app arrives. No advertising, no hidden commissions, just results. 'YOUR PLAN IN YOUR POCKET'. 

WHY DO WE NEED ONE PERCENT WEALTH?

 

Financial planning as it currently stands is expensive and is quite a long, drawn out process. The cost and complexity of advice inhibits the majority of the 99% from being able to obtain it with upfront costs starting at $1,500 - $10,000+ for the right advisers. The advisers most of you can access also often push products with hidden commissions.

We believe that there is a better way of doing things.

All we need now is YOU. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Exclusive to Indiegogo backers, we are offering a once in a lifetime opportunity. To pledge $99 AS A ONE OFF PAYMENT, which will be the annual subscription fee come 2018, to become a LIFETIME MEMBER. One Percent Wealth will NOT be available to buy at launch come January 2018 at such a discount, and the cost will revert back to $99 per year.
  • We are so confident that One Percent Wealth will get your financial house in order OR you are entitled to receive a 110% money back guarantee for the first 90 days of product use. We are prepared to do this because we know this app will give you what you need to succeed financially. In the event you fail to achieve progress, we expect you to profit from this experience.
  • All of the advisers who are a part of this professional money application are award winning and are amongst the best young advisers within Australia. We are all University degree-qualified in Finance and are trained to the highest standard in Australia. We have been working on this for over 3 years to get us this far and we will not stop until the world gets what it needs.
  • We believe $20,000 is a fair amount of money to build a clean coded application. Right now we have a prototype however it is not yet suitable to handle the volume of people that we want to get this application out to. Furthermore, we want to be able to invest into continuous development to improve the app on an ongoing basis. This costs money. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still fight and develop the best app we can and allocate an appropriate amount to marketing. We will never give up as the world needs this .

The Impact

Your contribution will make a massive impact on the way people access financial planning across the globe. Financial planning is typically a costly and complex process, and if we can give people the power over their financial futures for no more than $99 - then this is game-changing. Imagine a world where we, the 99%, can start to tip the scales in our favour. 

Risks & Challenges

As Financial Advisers, we are formally trained to price risk. Like everything in life, there is risk - but if you are willing to pledge the $99 today your risk is capped at that. You will not be charged another cent again EVER for access to One Percent Wealth, and this is in return for your vote of faith in becoming an original lifetime member. We will be accessible via email to answer any concerns you may have or general questions at onepercentwealthhq@gmail.com 

FAQ

Rollout Plan?

One Percent Wealth will be available from the 1st of January 2018. We will need a full year to rigorously build the platform, test the functions, film and record quality material, and also market the app appropriately. We will build this in a lean and methodical way to ensure minimal bugs and errors. Countries that the app will initially be available to are the USA, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, and the UK. We will progressively open the product to other countries as of launch.

Will the platform receive updates after launch?​

It most definitely will as we endeavour to improve One Percent Wealth to increase the satisfaction of your money making experience. Like other successful applications, it will only get better with time and usage. One Percent Wealth is here to stay.  

What if you fail to reach the funding target?

We appreciate every bit of support we receive during our campaign, and every backer will be welcomed into the One Percent Wealth community. If we don’t reach our target then we will still build our app and market within tighter constraints to deliver what will still be a highly valuable product. 

What warranties apply to One Percent Wealth

If you are not happy with the product, you may seek a 90 day 110% money back guarantee after launch. Please note, we are initially strictly providing GENERAL ADVICE only which does not take into account your individual circumstances or needs. IF you want PERSONALISED financial advice you should see a trusted  financial adviser. 

What if my question isn’t answered here?

We’re happy to respond to any other queries you might have about One Percent Wealth, the Indiegogo campaign, and our company as a whole. Email us at onepercenthq@gmail.com 

Can I donate from outside the USA?

Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. 

What payment methods do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards and we DO NOT ACCEPT PayPal.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Personally message someone who needs this to exist
  • Donate the smaller amount to get behind us 

Thank you from all of us at One Percent Wealth.

#yourplaninyourpocket

What We Need & What You Get

Exclusive to Indiegogo backers, we are offering a once in a lifetime opportunity. To pledge $99 AS A ONE OFF PAYMENT, which will be the annual subscription fee come 2018, to become a LIFETIME MEMBER. One Percent Wealth will NOT be available to buy at launch come January 2018 at such a discount, and the cost will revert back to $99 per year.
We are so confident that One Percent Wealth will get your financial house in order OR you are entitled to receive a 110% money back guarantee for the first 90 days of product use. We are prepared to do this because we know this app will give you what you need to succeed financially. In the event you fail to achieve progress, we expect you to profit from this experience.
All of the advisers who are a part of this professional money application are award winning and are amongst the best young advisers within Australia. We are all University degree-qualified in Finance and are trained to the highest standard in Australia. We have been working on this for over 3 years to get us this far and we will not stop until the world gets what it needs.
We believe $20,000 is a fair amount of money to build a clean coded application. Right now we have a prototype however it is not yet suitable to handle the volume of people that we want to get this application out to. Furthermore, we want to be able to invest into continuous development to improve the app on an ongoing basis. This costs money. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still fight and develop the best app we can and allocate an appropriate amount to marketing. We will never give up as the world needs this .


The Impact
Your contribution will make a massive impact on the way people access financial planning across the globe. Financial planning is typically a costly and complex process, and if we can give people the power over their financial futures for no more than $99 - then this is game-changing. Imagine a world where we, the 99%, can start to tip the scales in our favour. 

Risks & Challenges
As Financial Advisers, we are formally trained to price risk. Like everything in life, there is risk - but if you are willing to pledge the $99 today your risk is capped at that. You will not be charged another cent again EVER for access to One Percent Wealth, and this is in return for your vote of faith in becoming an original lifetime member. We will be accessible via email to answer any concerns you may have or general questions at onepercentwealthhq@gmail.com 

FAQ
Rollout Plan?
One Percent Wealth will be available from the 1st of January 2018. We will need a full year to rigorously build the platform, test the functions, film and record quality material, and also market the app appropriately. We will build this in a lean and methodical way to ensure minimal bugs and errors. Countries that the app will initially be available to are the USA, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, and the UK. We will progressively open the product to other countries as of launch.
Will the platform receive updates after launch?​
It most definitely will as we endeavour to improve One Percent Wealth to increase the satisfaction of your money making experience. Like other successful applications, it will only get better with time and usage. One Percent Wealth is here to stay.  
What if you fail to reach the funding target?
We appreciate every bit of support we receive during our campaign, and every backer will be welcomed into the One Percent Wealth community. If we don’t reach our target then we will still build our app and market within tighter constraints to deliver what will still be a highly valuable product. 
What warranties apply to One Percent Wealth
If you are not happy with the product, you may seek a 90 day 110% money back guarantee after launch. Please note, we are initially strictly providing GENERAL ADVICE only which does not take into account your individual circumstances or needs. IF you want PERSONALISED financial advice you should see a trusted  financial adviser. 
What if my question isn’t answered here?
We’re happy to respond to any other queries you might have about One Percent Wealth, the Indiegogo campaign, and our company as a whole. Email us at onepercenthq@gmail.com 
Can I donate from outside the USA?Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. 
What payment methods do you accept?Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards and we DO NOT ACCEPT PayPal.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
Personally message someone who needs this to exist
Donate the smaller amount to get behind us 

Thank you from all of us at One Percent Wealth.#yourplaninyourpocket

story:
What is the fundraising about?

Ralph Dunex Gustave is raising 15,000.00 USD to cover the tuition of his 14 weeks Bootcamp at Coding Dojo for the coming cohort of June 19, 2017. The cost of the program is $11995. However, the $3000 extra are to cover his bills and expenses for the period due to the high concentration time needed in order to succeed in the Bootcamp. 

 

Who is Ralph Dunex Gustave?

Born in Camp-Perrin, Haiti on January 2, 1993, Ralph is a young motivated full-time student at West Los Angeles College since January 2016. With a current 3.5 GPA, Ralph has first used a computer at the age of 15, so late compared to the average US youth but enough for him to know 5 years later how to build websites with Wordpress or even learn the basic of programming in Python by watching Youtube videos. 


Image of me on my way to work in the field in 2013

Ralph is devoted to his education and wants to be one of the best computer engineers in Haiti. As a true patriot, he wants to devote his life and knowledge in order to help Haiti get out of its poor economic status. Lately, Ralph is a hard worker that has worked hard back in Haiti to pay for his trip and education in the US. For the last 3 years, Ralph worked on his family lands and saved roughly $20000 to come pursuing his dream in the US. Ralph is quadrilingual as he currently speaks Creole, French, English and Spanish.

Ralph is very passionate about technology, most importantly about the internet. He currently has a website about Haitian music that is visited by more that 300 people daily. 

 

Why a coding Bootcamp over a college degree?

Before I answer the question, let me explain what to everyone what a coding Bootcamp is. A coding Bootcamp is a technical training program that teaches the parts of programming with the biggest impact and relevance to current market needs. ... Most coding Bootcamps last anywhere from 8-12 weeks and are designed for speed and high-impact learning.

Now let's turn back to the initial question that will explain my interests in the program. This aspect of my fundraising campaign can be explained in two detail parts. The first one is linked to my financial situation. As mentioned above, I am here in the country on the savings that I made from my previous work in my country. It comes out that I am running out of money so now I have to rely on some family members to support me. As a matter of fact, I realized that I will not be able to continue taking classes which will result in my expulsion from the school then the loss of my student visa. On the other hand, for the purpose of my professional goal and career. I find a Bootcamp best suited for my needs as it provides a quick gain of skills that can be applied directly towards my life dream of having a tech company.

Most importantly, one should understand that I am not leaving college. I am going to pursue my computer science degree until I earn my Associate of Science. However because I am not transferring to a 4-year institution, I will be doing the Coding Bootcamp for the summer of 2017 to fill the other 2 years of college.

Please make a donation of at least 5$ to help me avoid being out of school and lost my visa. 

 

What's next after the Bootcamp?

After attending my 14 weeks Bootcamp at coding dojo, I will be applying for an OPT which is a Training program that allows International students to work in the US after having a degree. Although the Bootcamp alone can't count for the OPT, I will be graduating from West LA College after Spring 2018. From another point of view, I am an International student who comes here in the US to study. Which means that my main focus is what I am learning and not the job outcomes. In all the situations, I will win. 

The most probable outcome is that I will go back to my country to build my company.

 

Why should this matter to you?

My fundraising should matter to anyone fighting for the cause of minority students as I am clearly one of them. As an African descent, I am limited to many opportunities. Considering the family and country that I was born in, I have come a long way and now I require a little support. I consider myself as a help seeker, begging and willing to do anything possible for my education because I believe this is the only one way one can be useful to his society. Please contribute with a minimum of 5$ to help me accomplish that valuable goal.

Without your support, I will not make it.

 

My business model

The main motivation around my studies is to gain enough skill to build a tech company in Haiti. The main services of the company are the following:
1. Sell bus tickets online for all the major bus carriers operating through the country. Including a service of a personal guide that tourists visiting Haiti can book online to help them navigate the country. 
2. Offer an online platform for Haitian parents living in the US to pay for the school tuition of their children and relatives left in Haiti or even buy books and school uniforms.
3. Offer an online platform for people living in Haiti's main cities to buy their groceries from inner cities and have them delivered to their home.
4. Offer an online service where Haitians living in Haiti can buy goods directly from the US.


Any significant contribution to my study can be rewarded as shares of the company.

 

Other ways you can help

If you want to help me but you currently don't have the money to do so you can still contribute. I am currently accepting any used thing that is worth 5$ or more. Here's how it works:

1. I will come to your place* and pick up anything that you are willing to give (used clothes, shoes, bags, non-working phone including computers and laptops, or anything of value that I can sell for 5$ or more)
2. I will ship the collected items to Haiti so my family can sell them for me.
3. The money from the selling will go directly to the fundraising campaign.

* I will pick up anywhere in the Greater Los Angeles area
