story:
En Venezuela un grupo de mujeres luchadoras y comprometidas con el rescate de las tradiciones ancestrales formamos una comunidad de aprendizaje de partería, cada una de nosotras ha emprendido un camino hacia la atención integral de la mujer y su familia durante el proceso de gestación, parto y post parto, actualmente tenemos la oportunidad de fundar la Escuela de Saberes, Cultura y Tradición Ancestral (ESCTA-Venezuela) para así fortalecer y promover la comunicación, investigación y el desarrollo sustentable para la calidad de vida y la felicidad.

Nos acompaña en este proceso la Partera Tradicional Brasilera desde hace 42 años, Suely Carvalho quien será nuestra tutora en esta formación que tendrá por duración 2 años, con 2 módulos intensivos por año dirigido a 25 mujeres y/o hombres que por vocación deseen formarse en la partería tradicional.

El primer módulo se impartirá en el mes de mayo 2017, es por eso que difundimos la importancia de nuestra labor por diversos medios para conseguir el apoyo financiero que haga posible este sueño.

La realización de este encuentro acarrea gastos de pasajes aéreos, alimentación, hospedaje y honorarios profesionales en dólares. En nuestro país la adquisición de divisas internacionales es difícil, es por eso que contamos con el apoyo de la comunidad planetaria para materializar esta realidad.

Ayúdanos a difundir nuestro servicio para que juntos cocreemos el mundo que queremos, humanizando el nacimiento. www.indiegogo.com

Para mayor información pues escribir al correo electrónico: esctavzla@gmail.com

Gracias.

Y para nuestra gente querida de Venezuela les dejamos aquí un numero de cuenta bancaria para quienes quieran aportar en Bs. 

Banco Bicentenario.

Nro.: 01750394440071243556

Titular: Eymar Yepez

CI: 13.140.253 

Correo: eymaryepez@yahoo.com

________________________________________________________________________________________

In Venezuela a group os strong women commited with ancestral traditions rescue formed a midwives learning community, each one of us has traveled a road towards women and family care during pregnancy, labor anafter, nowadays we have the opportunity to establish the Ancestral Wisdom, Culture and Tradition School (ESCTA-Venezuela) to upgrade ans promote communication, research ans sustainable development for life quality and happiness.

We`re being helped through the process by Brasilian traditional midwife for over 42 years, Suely Carvalho, who will guide us in a 2-year journey, with 2 intensive modules each oriented to 25 women and/or men that hace chosen the path of traditional midwifery.

First Module will start may 2017, that is why we are broadcasting the importance of our job through diverse media to get the financial aid that will make this dream come true.

This gathering`s realization comes with costs of air transport, food, accommodation and professional bills in dollars. In our country foreing currency adquisition is hard, that`s why weare counting on the support of the planetary community to materialize this reality.

Help us get our message out so together we cocreate the world we want, humanizing birth. www.indiegogo.com

For further information e-mail: esctavzla@gmail.com

Thanks.

story:
NOTE- This campaign as already ended and we have created a new campaign. so, please visit the following link to make further contributions. 


https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/senior-citizens-hospital-establishment-in-nepal--3/x/12597070#/ 


AN INITIATIVE  FOR BETTERMENT OF ELDER GENERATION.

Nepal is a country where senior citizen care is in great need of reform. Like many places, citizens of Nepal traditionally care for their elderly family members. But with the state of the economy, so many people leave the country for work and to make new lives.

So you can help this project to establish 1 non profit facility
dedicated to caring for the elderly.

Contribute and share and do some good even if it is on the other side of the world!

                                                       Image: Elderly people protesting on the road (New Baneshwor,Kathmandu,Nepal) raising different social security issues including special health facilities and concessions for senior citizens.  Source http://www.annapurnapost.com/News.aspx/story/14883
source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=svcTQzB8G8o Published on Jul 12, 2015 by Sagarmathatv.

SOTRAN- Nepal(Socio - development Transformation-Nepal)is a non profit, politically non-aligned NGO which was established in 2011 AD. It focuses on helping the poor and backward communities, especially senior citizens healthy ageing.

We believe that older adults deserve a life of dignity and access to appropriate care suited to their needs for healthy ageing. Although care and well-being of its seniors should be a core priority of a civilized nation-state, Nepal remains an unfortunate exception. Nepal as a nation-state has an extremely weak health and social welfare system in general, and the well-being of the elderly in particular remains largely neglected. Senior citizens have however contributed greatly to the social and economic development and cultural fabric of their societies and the nation as a whole, and it becomes the current generation’s ethical responsibility to respond to their needs. 

In Nepal, government-funded social safety nets for the elderly are virtually non-existent, and most traditional community-funded old age homes are in immense disrepair and suffer from lack of basic geriatric health and sanitation services.  Due to a lack of employment opportunities in Nepal, a majority of the younger population is forced to migrate to countries in the Middle East, Southeast Asia, Europe, United States or Australia in search of jobs.  As a result, the traditional support and care received by older adults from their younger family members has quickly declined, and in many cases, older adults are dangerously living by themselves despite major illnesses and disabilities. In addition, there are increasing cases of older adults suffering from curable illnesses and manageable conditions due to lack of access to basic health maintenance and preventive care needed for healthy aging.

Costing for the hospital instrument, furniture, vehicle and other.

Description


Amount US$

Estimated Costing for the hospital instrument, furniture, vehicle and other


500000.00

Senior Citizens Hospital proposes to provide both in-hospital and home-based health services focused on the unique needs of the elderly  living in communities, temporary settlements, and traditional old-age homes (‘aasharams’) in Nepal.  The Tulsilal geriatric hospital thus represents a small but important step towards the fulfillment of this  social obligation. Tulsilal Senior Citizens Hospital aims to serve as part of an extended home for such families by developing a culturally appropriate suite of services and supports under ‘Community Geriatrics’, which includes regular home visits.

In addition to the lack of support from the Nepalese government as discussed previously, there is also a major gap in available funding in the non-governmental sector for the development of health and social services for the elderly in Nepal. Most donor-funded local organizations as well as international organizations seem to focus their efforts on child welfare and other areas of health, social and educational development in Nepal. While these efforts are commendable in their own right, the need for developing health and social services for the unique needs of senior citizens remains largely ignored and severely underfunded.  There are thus ample unfulfilled opportunities to improve the quality of life of older adults in Nepal.  Interested donors are urged to recognize this unmet need for funding, and support local efforts aimed at uplifting the life and dignity of the elderly Nepalese population. We thus propose an establishment of the Tulsilal Senior Citizens Hospital  1st of this kind of hospital to provide much needed geriatric health services and end-of-life care in Nepal. 

We are grateful to Tulsilal Memorial Foundation, Nepal for entrusting us (SOTRAN, a non-profiting-NGO) to establish and operationalize the proposed hospital by providing sufficient  land at Chysal-Monahara Bridge Junction, Lalitpur, Kathmandu Nepal. 

We look forward to receiving similar support from like-minded donors to help develop the hospital infrastructure and ambulance services, bio-medical equipment, and any other help.Every small generosity counts.

If you want to help us in our elderly project but are unable to donate financially, Sharing this page would also be a great help.

If you or your organization would like to visit our construction site and office, you are heartily welcome.

Contact us :                                          

Socio development Transformation-Nepal (SOTRAN-Nepal)

Central Office - Kathmandu

+9779851067146(Raghu Ghimire)

+9779851175127(Nakul Gautam)

+9779851132279(Manoj Bhattarai)

Email address- sotrannepal@gmail.com

TEAM MEMBERS


Mr. Raghu Ghimire, Chair person

Human Resource Development  Expert

More than 25 yrs of working experience in national and international organization, and involvement in various research and development area,mainly in health and governance sector


Mr.Manoj Bhattarai , Vice- Chair person

Planning and Development Expert.

More than 25 years of working Experience in enterprises management and involvement various research and development sectors.


Mr. Nakul Gautam ,General Secretary (Executive Director)

Health Educator

More than 22 years of working Experience in health service management (Hospitals and Health care centers) and involved other preventive /curative health sectors.


Ms. Rajani Gyawali , Treasurer

Health Educator

 More than 20 years of working Experience in health related national and international organization and involved other preventive/curative health service.


Dr. Nand P. Sharma , Member

Medical Doctor

More than 30 years working experience in medical field. Retired from government health sector (Director of  regional , zonal hospitals and other public health divisions)


Mr. Hari Gyawali  , Member

Advocate

More than 20 years working Experience in Law and Human Right sector (especially elder right sector).


Mr. Rukmagat Gyawali, Member

Social Worker

More than 20 years working Experience in Social work.

services focused on the unique needs of the elderly  living in communities, temporary settlements,
and traditional old-age homes (‘aasharams’) in Nepal.  The
Tulsilal geriatric hospital thus represents a small but important step towards
the fulfillment of this  social
obligation. Tulsilal Senior
Citizens Hospital
aims to serve as part of an extended home for such families by developing a
culturally appropriate suite of services and supports under ‘Community
Geriatrics’, which includes regular home visits.

In addition to the
lack of support from the Nepalese government as discussed previously, there is
also a major gap in available funding in the non-governmental sector for the
development of health and social services for the elderly in Nepal. Most
donor-funded local organizations as well as international organizations seem to
focus their efforts on child welfare and other areas of health, social and
educational development in Nepal. While these efforts are commendable in their
own right, the need for developing health and social services for the unique
needs of senior citizens remains largely ignored and severely underfunded.  There are thus ample unfulfilled opportunities
to improve the quality of life of older adults in Nepal.  Interested donors are urged to recognize this
unmet need for funding, and support local efforts aimed at uplifting the life
and dignity of the elderly Nepalese population. We thus propose an establishment of the Tulsilal Senior
Citizens Hospital  1st of this
kind of hospital to provide much needed geriatric health services and
end-of-life care in Nepal. 
We are
grateful to Tulsilal Memorial Foundation, Nepal for entrusting us
(SOTRAN, a non-profiting-NGO) to establish and operationalize the proposed
hospital by providing sufficient  land at Chysal-Monahara Bridge Junction,
Lalitpur, Kathmandu Nepal. 

We look forward to receiving similar support from
like-minded donors to help develop the hospital infrastructure and ambulance
services, bio-medical equipment, and any other help.Every small generosity counts.
If you want to help us in our elderly project but are unable to donate financially, Sharing this page would also be a great help.

If you or your organization would like to visit our construction site and
office, you are heartily welcome.
Contact us :                                          


Socio
development Transformation-Nepal (SOTRAN-Nepal)
Central
Office - Kathmandu

+9779851175127(Nakul Gautam)

story:
Why Purascard?

Time and again, innumerable stories have been told about poverty and education. We have been bombarded with information about how education can help solve the world's biggest problems and ultimately alleviate poverty, bring people dignity and a better quality of life. But what if these arguments are not convincing enough to the vast majority of the population inhabiting the planet? And most importantly, what do these heavy statements mean to children who find play more rewarding and pleasurable than work?

Several governments around the world have provided free education through their public schools for years but we still have had children dropping out of elementary and senior schools. There is clearly a disconnect that has to be worked around. As educationists, working in this field for over a decade, we have found that the motivation to attend schools and attain education is largely absent because of the lack of tangible benefits to it. The fact that education will lead to a better life does not seem apparent either to parents or to children and they attribute success largely to the unfair advantage of having a strong headstart. 
We aspire to fill this motivational gap with PURASCARD.

What is Purascard? 

Essentially meaning a 'Rewards card', these beacon technology-enabled cards will help track attendance in schools and convert them into points that can be further redeemed by children and their parents to buy an array of discounted products. Seeing the tangible benefits attached to education, children as well as their parents would be motivated towards educational attainment. We have been asked questions about the success of such a model. However, we believe this business has the potential to succeed as:
1. We do not set the boundaries as to what commodities or services can discounts be redeemed for, as is largely the case with a number of incentive-based models.
2. We are not providing freebies and the points have to be earned as we want our customers to value our service.
3. We have piloted the idea on an informal basis in India and its success has motivated us to formalize it. 
Therefore, investing in Purascard would mean creating an impact in terms of teaching children 'how to fish'. With an initial funding of USD 60,000 we aim to undertake product development and pilot the business. No matter how big or small your contribution, it will help us get closer to this larger vision. 

How does it work?

The child goes to school with Purascard. This attendance is tracked every day and converted into points. These points can be used by the child or the parents to redeem discounts on an array of goods and services that they need for their daily lives, be it food, clothes or even talk-time for cell phones. It is that simple! We have also tied performance in school to this and therefore, everybody's performance is appreciated and not just the rank-holders. We are trying to break down these hierarchies, which also play an important role in discouraging children.
We urge you to be a part of the new Renaissance. Do contribute and share this page so that we can enlist more support. Let's make this Thanksgiving and Christmas, merrier for many more! Thank you for all your support.

story:
(scroll-down for English)

Ser jornalista não é fácil. Especialmente no início de carreira. Sabemos que podemos fazer toda a diferença.

Desenvolvemos uma plataforma onde os jovens jornalistas (beginners) podem publicar seus artigos de melhor qualidade, criar um portfólio e obter um acesso mais fácil ao mundo jornalístico profissional.

Mas, para desenvolver qualquer artigo há determinados custos que até mesmo um jornalista freelance tem, como por exemplo os transportes ou as telecomunicações.

Precisamos da sua contribuição para desenvolver uma ferramenta dentro da nossa plataforma para tornar possível apoiar um beginner com o custo de produzir cada artigo.


O que precisamos e o que temos para oferecer

A versão beta da nossa plataforma já está online, e nós recebemos centenas de candidaturas de potenciais beginners que querem participar neste projeto.

Queremos tornar seus artigos disponíveis e queremos pedir aos leitores para apoiar os beginner com os custos de produção de um artigo.

Para desenvolver esta ferramenta de pagamentos estimamos um custo de:

- Design e Programação - 4.000 €
- Contabilidade - 1.500 €
- Aconselhamento Jurídico - 2.000 €

A maioria dos nossos familiares e amigo diz-nos que nunca pagaria por um artigo online. Provavelmente você está a pensar o mesmo neste momento. No entanto, temos vindo a recolher dados a partir de nossa versão beta que mostram haver um número suficiente de leitores dispostos a apoiar os nossos beginners.

Também queremos devolver-lhe algo pelo seu apoio ao nosso projeto, pelo que criámos um grupo de privilégios que poderá valorizar:

- 0 € - 50 € -> Agradecemos muito a sua contribuição, infelizmente não poderemos retribuir com valor maior que um enorme “Muito Obrigado”
- 51 € - 100 € -> Você poderá sugerir um artigo de nossos beginners
- 101 € - 500 € -> oferecemos uma semana de subscrição integral da plataforma begin.media
-> 501 € -> Iremos fazer-lhe um destaque muito especial na plataforma begin.media

O impacto da sua contribuição na vida dos Beginners:

O beginner padrão é um jovem licenciado em Jornalismo ou Comunicação Social na fase inicial de sua carreira profissional. Os beginners querem expor os seus trabalhos de melhor qualidade e aumentar o seu portfólio para serem absorvidos nas empresas tradicionais de media.

No entanto, para criar cada artigo, um beginner terá sempre de gastar algum dinheiro em transportes, comunicações, refeições, internet, material de apoio ou até simplesmente as suas próprias horas de trabalho.

Precisamos que os leitores ajudem e apoiem nos custos de cada beginner para fazer a todo o sistema sustentável.

Este crowdfunding é muito importante para nós, e para os beginners. Só assim será possível desenvolver as ferramentas de pagamento (incluindo contabilidade e aconselhamento jurídico).

Com a sua ajuda e financiamento vamos tornar possível para cada beginner alcançar a sustentabilidade do seu trabalho nesta fase inicial da sua carreira.

Seremos bem-sucedidos?

A nossa experiência, tal como a sua, é que ninguém está disposto a pagar por conteúdos online. Por isso, criámos um sistema inovador onde cada leitor irá contribuir diretamente nos custos de cada beginner, em vez de apenas pagar um valor fixo para ler um artigo.

Acreditamos que a empatia criada entre cada leitor e cada beginner irá tornar possível a sustentabilidade do beginners e consequentemente tornará possível publicar novos artigos.

O que alcançámos até o momento:

A ideia base veio da nossa co-founder Marta Velho, e nossa 1ª reunião foi no dia 6/junho/2015.

Isto significa que, em menos de 6 meses, desenvolvemos todo o conceito, design e programação da plataforma (versão beta) e atraimos mais de 500 potenciais beginners. Neste momento já poderá ler mais de 20 artigos, e fomos bem-sucedidos na candidatura à WebSummit de 2015 em Dublin, Irlanda

E para ser honesto, temos trabalhado com um orçamento verdadeiramente limitado.

Para celebrar o nosso aniversário de 6 meses lançando nossa campanha Crowdfunding pela mão de uma beginner.

Neste momento não pode contribuir, não tem problema:

Entendemos totalmente que não é o momento ideal para fazer uma contribuição para este projeto. Não tem problema.

Mas, se você leu este projeto até aqui, queremos pedir-lhe para partilhá-lo. Use os links no final desta página e partilhe no seu Facebook ou envie este link por e-mail a todos os seus contactos.

Os nossos beginners irão agradecer por todo o seu esforço.



Being a Journalist isn’t easy. Especially in the early beginning of their career. We know we can make the difference.

We’ve developed a platform, where young journalists (beginners) can publish their best quality articles, create a portfolio and get easier access to the professional journalistic world.

But, to make any article, there are certain costs even a freelance journalist has to take, like transportation or communications.

We need your contribution to develop a feature within our platform to make it possible to support any beginner with their cost to produce each article.

What We Need & What You Get

The beta version of our platform is already live, and we have received hundreds of applications of young journalists who want to take part in this project.

We want to make their articles available and we want to make readers help every beginner supporting their costs to produce an article.

To make this payment feature available within our platform we estimated a cost of:

- Design & Development – 4.000€
-Accounting – 1.500€-Legal counselling – 2.000€

Most of our relatives and friend admit they would never ever pay for an online article. Probably you are thinking the same right now. However, we have been collecting data from our beta version and it shows that there are enough people willing to support our beginners.

We want to give you back something for having support our project, therefore we have created some perks for you:

- 0€ - 50€ --> No perk
-51€ - 100€ --> You may order an article from our beginners-101€ - 500€ --> You have one week of full subscription in begin.media-> 501€ --> You'll have a special highlight in begin.media

Your contribution impact in the lives of our beginners:

Our standard beginner is a young journalists in the early stage of his career.Our beginners are mainly recent graduates in journalism programs who want to exhibit their best quality works and increase their portfolio so that they can be absorbed in the traditional media companies.

However, to create each article, a beginner will have to spend some money in transportation, communications, meals, internet, support material or event his own working hours.
We need our readers to support the costs of each beginner to make the all system sustainable.

This crowdfunding is very important for us, and for the beginners. This will make it possible to develop our payment feature (including accounting and legal counselling). With your help and funding we will make it possible for each beginner to reach sustainability for his work.

Why it will work:

Our experience, just like yours, is that no one is willing to pay for online content. Therefore we have created a revolutionary system where each reader will support the beginner for their costs, instead of just paying for reading.

We believe that the empathy created between each reader and each beginner will make it possible to have a sustainable income for the beginner to keep him writing new articles.

What have we reach so far:

The idea came from our co-founder Marta Velho, and our first group meeting was on the 6/jun/2015.

This means, in less than 6 month we came up with all the concept, design and developed the beta version of our platform and received more than 500 potential beginners’ applications. There are already over 20 articles uploaded in the platform so far, and we have successfully applied for the WebSummit in Doublin and earned the possibility of having an own branded stand.

And to be honest, we have worked on really low budget.

Now, to celebrate our 6-month-anniversary, we are launching our Crowdfunding campaign

You can’t contribute, there is no problem:

We totally understand that you are not able to contribute at this stage. No problem. Really. But, if you have read this campaign until here, please share it with your friend. Please use the share bottom in this page and past it in your Facebook page or send it by e-mail to all your relatives and friends.

Our beginners will thank you for all your effort.

story:
Help us build a Telecoms Centre for the Syrian Refugee Families.

I am Connor Johnson of Rhino Television & Media Limited based in the UK.


We are a group of 3 UK companies who have joined together to bring a Telecoms Centre to Kos in Greece for the Syrian Refugee Families.By now, you've both seen and heard of the horrors facing Syrians both at home and as they flee for safety. 

Our role, as suppliers and supporters is to build a Telecoms Centre in Kos at the beginning then with more donations other countries.

These Telecom Centres will supply the families with a life line, the centres will allow the families to communicate with family,friends and loved ones. We all know this feeling when we travel we all let our family, friends and loved ones that we have have arrived safely.

This people have left their entire possessions left behind just to survive. The Telecoms Centres will also act as temporary classrooms during the day and give the families accommodation at night. 

We have teachers that are prepared to give lessons via the internet to the children, why should these children suffer in having an education we wouldn't allow it to happen to our own children.

We all saw the horrifying pictures on the news on the 15th September on the tragic death of the 3 year old boy in Turkey. I cannot imagine how it feels swimming in cold water with your baby in your arms just to reach a place that you are safe. We are the lucky ones we never have to experience that these families do this on a daily basis.

That's where you and i come in. If you would like to help us help these refugee families by donating even just a few $'s or £'s .

We would be immensely appreciative.Any donation that you are willing to provide, no matter how small, will go directly towards helping these families start living the life they deserve- free of terror and full of possibility. Every $ or £ that you donate will help us build the Telecoms Centre.

Your donation will allow us to purchase the following items and allow these families to keep in contact with their families and loved ones and give them the education they deserve.

SIM Cards with credit  to make these important calls to let there families and loved ones know that they are alive and well.

Tri Band mobiles so they can make these important calls.

Tents to be used for the Telecoms Centre and teaching area during the day then used as additional accommodation during the night.

Solar/ Battery chargers for the mobiles after all they don't have electricity.

Solar Generators to power the mobiles and other equipment to be used for the calls and teaching and education purposes.

Laptops and the software to give the children a good start in life and understand the modern world. This will help them prepare for the future after all we all deserve a standard way of life we are no different we are all the same.

So please help us with this campaign share this message with your friends, family and even your loved ones that's what we are trying to achieve for these refugees after all.

With your small donation and you spreading this message we can give these families and these children a good start in life. The most important thing to remember is we cannot change the world overnight but we can make a big difference if we stand together and contribute.

Many Thanks!

I cannot imagine how it feels swimming in cold water with your baby in your arms just to reach a place that you are safe. We are the lucky ones we never have to experience that these families do this on a daily basis.That's where you and i come in. If you would like to help us help these refugee families by donating even just a few $'s or £'s .We would be immensely appreciative.Any donation that you are willing to provide, no matter how small, will go directly towards helping these families start living the life they deserve- free of terror and full of possibility. Every $ or £ that you donate will help us build the Telecoms Centre.Your donation will allow us to purchase the following items and allow these families to keep in contact with their families and loved ones and give them the education they deserve.SIM Cards with credit  to make these important calls to let there families and loved ones know that they are alive and well.Tri Band mobiles so they can make these important calls.Tents to be used for the Telecoms Centre and teaching area during the day then used as additional accommodation during the night.Solar/ Battery chargers for the mobiles after all they don't have electricity.Solar Generators to power the mobiles and other equipment to be used for the calls and teaching and education purposes.Laptops and the software to give the children a good start in life and understand the modern world. This will help them prepare for the future after all we all deserve a standard way of life we are no different we are all the same.So please help us with this campaign share this message with your friends, family and even your loved ones that's what we are trying to achieve for these refugees after all.With your small donation and you spreading this message we can give these families and these children a good start in life. The most important thing to remember is we cannot change the world overnight but we can make a big difference if we stand together and contribute.Many Thanks!

story:
"Through our great good fortune in our youth our hearts were touched by fire. It was given to us to learn at the outset that life is a profound and passionate thing."

-Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

What Is The Firestarter Project?

When you think of fire, what comes to mind? Passion, energy, heat. A catalyst for change. The Firestarter project is about creating change, lighting the sparks across the world and letting the fires of our hearts and minds begin to burn. 
As young people, we have each been a part of different learning experiences, and our varied paths have given each of us perspectives into what it means to be, and how to become, an empowered young adult. We believe that every student should have the chance to find his or her own avenue to empowerment, and we want to make different opportunities accessible to youths from all backgrounds, opening up opportunities where before there had seemingly only been one acceptable path.
Together, we brainstormed what it takes to empower young adults, and found a few key elements: community, respect, individualized learning, creativity, and a safe place to try, fail, and try again. With these facets in mind, we set out to create a project that offers that space for young adults and begins their learning journey.

The Firestarter Project is comprised of three parts:

  • Forming a network of organizations with the similar purpose of supporting emerging adults
  • Visiting high schools to connect with students moving on to the next stage in their lives
  • Hosting a summit in June 2016 to provide an accessible and engaging experience that inspires and spreads the message that you can create the change you seek, and that you aren't alone in that

Who Are We?

We are nine students bringing together our wide variety of skills, talents and passions to create an opportunity for young people like us to have a more holistic educational experience. 

We are all living and working together on the LEAPNOW campus as second year students. Part of our purpose for Leapyear2 is to create and carry out a service project of our own design. Firestarter is our project. 

Why Are We Fundraising?

Your contributions will go into starting a nonprofit, outreach to high schools, forming and making the network of organizations accessible, the training we need to successfully lead, all of the big and little details hosting a summit requires, and more! We want this network of organizations and the resources we're building to last, but we'll need your help to make that possible.

In tandem with all of this, we have the honor of working with Warrior Films as our sponsor, a nonprofit started by Frederick Marx, the director of the documentary Hoop Dreams, and an incredible activist in the field of youth empowerment and beyond. Through his nonprofit your donations become tax deductible, our little way of giving back to you as you support us.

Perks

Thank you note for $10 

Thank you so much for donating to our project. To show our gratitude, every donor will receive a personal thank you note! Without you, none of this would be possible.

Maacama Cookbook for $30

A collection of delicious recipes compiled over years and years from the LEAPNOW kitchen. 

Handmade Organic Granola for $50

You will receive one jar of delicious handmade organic granola, the recipe and a sweet note. Delicious, nutritious, a great snack, or a wonderful meal! You will also receive a card saying what your donation means with space for a message if you want to gift it!



Art piece for $100 

A piece of art (poem, painting, photo, print) handcrafted by our team with love for you, our amazing sponsor!

  

Paintings by Isabel Enns

       

Photography by Sarah Falk

     

Canvas mandala artwork by Camille Lauer

Handmade Quilt for $10,000

Cassie Bull - co-creator of LEAPNOW, incredible artist, and overall wonderful human being - will make you a personalized quilt! Choose your color scheme and watch the magic unfold…

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Put the word out - tell your friends!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us on Facebook!
Thank you so much for your support!
Love,
Camille, Daria, Isabel, Isabelle, Lyndsay, Meghan, Pip, Sarah, and Trevor!

story:
If you aren't able to donate this campaign, please share this link with anyone and everyone you can. I am aiming high because I seek to cover as much tuition as I possibly can before sewing myself a quilt of debt, also known as student loans. I can answer any questions you have about this campaign via email at salimboykin@gmail.com

 

For those who donate $25 or more...

I will send you a downloadable link to my project a week before it drops.

 

For those who donate $50 or more...

I will give a live Skype performance of some of my favorite songs.

 

For those who donate $100 or more...

You will receive tickets to a private show upon my return for the summer of 2016.

 

For those who donate $500 or more...

I will give a live Skype performance of one of YOUR favorite songs.

 

For those who donate $1000 or more...

You will receive all of the above and a hand pressed CD plus an unreleased bonus track to be created at Berklee.

Aaaaaand

If you want to go ahead and put me through school...

I'll come to your spot, cook you dinner, rub your feet and feed you grapes at the same time. Then I'll write you 5 songs and serenade you to sleep. :-)

 

Thank you for taking the time out to watch this video.

 

Bless

story:
Join us for an exciting evening as we explore every outlet to find peace and happiness within ourselves.  This event will be hosted by four degree students in their final year of Events Management with an end goal of 1000 pounds.  

Coastal West Sussex Mind is a charity that helps people with mental illness, this charity was selected by the team as it is a cause very close to their hearts.

The evening will include special cocktails, great food, music and various other activities.  It will offer guests the opportunity to win exciting prizes and gifts.

story:
Invest in our democracy!

Our democracy is at risk. Understanding of and trust in our democracy are dangerously low. Voting rates are stagnant. Incivility is rife. But, you may not know that civic education is a key part of the problem - and the answer. Without knowledge, citizens cannot meaningfully participate in their democracy, and civic education has been disappearing from US classrooms for decades.

But, iCivics has an innovative, scalable solution that is as effective as it is popular. With your support today, we can accelerate our efforts to ensure every student in America graduates from high school well prepared and enthusiastic for citizenship in just four years.

And, there’s more. Thanks to a generous matching gift opportunity from one of our donors, your donation can be doubled.

Every dollar you donate can become $2 and help us reach 4 more students. Your support will contribute to adding millions more informed and engaged voters, active citizens, political candidates and civic-minded leaders.

What is iCivics?

iCivics was founded 8 years ago by former Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O’Connor. She was concerned about the lack of understanding about our system of government and the disengagement that inevitably follows. She sought a way to make civic education accessible, fun and inspiring, to all students.

The result is www.icivics.org, a free, digital platform featuring over 19 award-winning educational games and more than 160 lesson plans, activities and tools. Gone is the dry, rote civics of old! Students learn best by doing, so iCivics games allow students to experience their government first hand. They can step into any role they choose – the President, a judge, a member of Congress, or a community activist fighting for local change – and do the job they do.

And it works! In just 8 years, iCivics resources are now used by over 170,000 teachers to educate over 5 million students, in all 50 states. To date, iCivics games have been played over 61 million times – at rates competitive with commercial games.

Said one teacher from Washington, DC, “As an educator using iCivics, I have watched my students convert from silent sitters into social speakers. All they needed was a platform and they went the distance for an issue they were passionate about! My students learned they can literally do anything they put their mind to.”

Double your support to double our impact

Today, we’re half-way toward our goal of reaching every student – 10 million per year – but we need your help! In just 8 years, iCivics has achieved remarkable growth with vision, passion and a limited budget. Our rapid expansion – and proven impact – in less than a decade, underscores both the demand for our and effectiveness of our solution.

This is our first general public fundraising campaign. Please help us raise vital funds, and expand our network of supporters by donating and referring our campaign today. Every dollar raised and doubled can help us reach 4 more students.

story:
Als een 18 jarige startende ondernemer ben ik erachter gekomen dat je nooit genoeg hebt geleerd en dat je altijd moet blijven leren. Voor mij is leren van andere ondernemers, zowel ervaren als onervaren, de beste manier om te leren. Dat is waarom ik mij heb aangemeld voor de Draper University in San Mateo, VS. De Draper University is een ondernemingscursus opgericht door Silicon Valley investeerder Tim Draper. In deze intensieve vijf weekse cursus leer je alles wat te maken heeft met ondernemen, zoals leiderschap, financiën, productontwikkeling, creativiteit, etc. Alle lessen worden gegeven door Tim Draper zelf en veel andere Silicon Valley ondernemers van bedrijven als Tesla, Google en Apple. Op deze cursus wil ik me omgeven met andere jonge ondernemers van over de hele wereld om van hun te kunnen leren en om misschien wel mijn toekomstige business partner te vinden. Ik weet zeker dat dit een unieke, leerzame ervaring wordt.

Ik ben erg trots op dat ik aangenomen ben, omdat dit betekent dat zij er in geloven dat ik in staat ben een succesvol bedrijf op te richten. Daarom ben ik ook enorm gemotiveerd om zo veel mogelijk te leren en om op een wereld verbeterd idee te komen. 

Mijn doel is om $12000 (€9600) te verzamelen om het volledige collegegeld te betalen. Dit collegegeld houdt het volgende in:

  • Accomodatie
  • Vervoer naar andere bedrijven en San Fransisco
  • Alle gastsprekers
  • Outdoor activiteiten

Deze studie betekent heel veel voor mij. Het zal mijn eerste echte stap naar ondernemerschap zijn. De studie begint in augustus 2018 en het collegegeld moet dan ook betaald zijn. Help mij alsjeblieft met het betalen van dit collegegeld door een donatie te doen. Elke donatie is erg nuttig en ik ben erg dankbaar voor elke donatie. Ondertussen is de campagne helaas al afgelopen, maar als je nog steeds wilt doneren kan dat, door het gewenste bedrag over te maken naar NL84 INGB 0660 7340 87. Als je geen donatie wilt doen, maar alsnog wilt helpen kun je ook mijn crowdfund delen. Dit zal mijn ook erg helpen.

Dankjewel.

story:
About Our Community Outreach Program

Our Community Outreach Program is designed to give Underprivileged Youth ages 12-18 in the Denver area an opportunity to LEARN and TRAIN with MOTH.  Selected students will join our growing community of like minded kids, while developing the skills necessary to pursue a career in the circus arts.  Students will focus on developing artistry along with the physical skills necessary to CREATE original acts, while learning to PERFORM as an ensemble along side the adult professional training students and elite professionals. 

Year to Date, MOTH has raised just over $11,000 so far and is 22% funded.  Our 2016 fund raising goal is $50,000.  We are so grateful for the support our community has shown, and we are thrilled to make this program a reality. The funding will go directly to providing free tuition for underprivileged youth to join our professional training programs, help buy new equipment, and bring in world-class coaches. If we receive 100% funding, we will also be able to send out coaches into the Denver Public School system to teach and reach a greater number of children.

MOTH Contemporary Circus Center, the home of MOTH Poetic Circus, is located in the RiNo Art District in downtown Denver. MOTH Contemporary Circus Center is the premier training facility in Denver, Colorado for professionally minded circus artists, and is based on the philosophy of our four pillars, LEARN, TRAIN, CREATE and PERFORM. MOTH Contemporary Circus Center’s programming is inclusive of all levels, from hobbyists to paid professionals, who share the mindset and goals of dedicated circus artists.

MOTH Contemporary Youth Circus 

MOTH is thrilled to bring you the next generation of circus stars. The Denver Metro area is filled with talented youth dancers, athletes, gymnasts, musicians, actors, and all around performers.  Our vision is for the community outreach program to produce artists that will join MOTH's Contemporary Youth Circus, and gain valuable life skills that will further their aspirations, whatever they may be.  

MOTH is delighted to bring together kids of all ages to perform in Denver’s only Professional Youth Circus. Be inspired, be dazzled, be awed by their skill, as they perform and delight audiences all over Colorado. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Community Outreach Program needs your help!

  • MOTH is hoping to raise $50,000, which will go towards  teacher pay, equipment, and program development. 
  • For every $5000 we raise, we are able to bring in 1 student to the Professional Training Program, and once we are fully funded, we will be able to send a Teacher into the Denver school system. In essence, the more money we raise, the more children will have an opportunity to experience the joy of circus. 

  • MOTH Poetic Circus is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of MOTH Poetic Circus must be made payable to "Fractured Atlas" only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The Impact

The smiles, the laughter, the visible joy that circus brings to children's lives is remarkable. For over 15 years, MOTH's Director Deena Marcum Selko has taught circus to children and adults all over this country. She has performed all over North America and abroad as a professional circus artist, and has experienced first hand what the joy of circus can do for the spirits. 

  • MOTH's programs will bring this joy to children who would never otherwise have the opportunity.
  • Our programs are mentoring programs going beyond circus that help children develop life skills such as team building, trust, confidence and life-long friendships.
  • We are helping the next generation foster a sense of self, a sense of place and a true community, where they will be lifted up and shown their worth. What is more important than that?

Risks & Challenges

It hasn't been easy to grow up wanting to be an artist. Unfortunately this country doesn't see the value in it, but in reality, artists are the soul of any nation. Teaching the next generation to value the arts, to value health, to value community is a challenge in a world of instant gratification. The more children we can reach, the more value will be brought to the arts, to health, fitness and community. Our world is hungry for it and our kids deserve it.

  • MOTH's program provides a true community for Denver's Youth.
  • Through our performance troupe, MOTH Contemporary Youth Circus, more children will experience the joy of circus, even if they don't want to directly participate. 
  • Circus is Universal! It is for everyone!

Other Ways You Can Help

We truly appreciate any and all help and understand that not everyone can make a monetary contribution. If you believe in what we are doing and would like to help in other ways, we would be ever so grateful.

  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, networking groups etc.
  • Indiegogo provides share tools that you can directly share to all of your social media networks.
  • Volunteer! We'd love to have you as a part of the MOTH Community. We could use help passing out flyers, making phone calls, ushering at shows, and lots of other fun and creative projects around our MOTH warehouse. 
  • Come to our shows! Our next show is called Metamorpheus: Dreamers Often Fly, and is the Professional Training Program's culmination show on May 20th at The Denver Performing Arts Complex. Details at www.contemporarycircuscenter.com

Thank you all, from the bottom of our M.O.T.Hearts!

Teaching the next generation to value the arts, to value health, to value community is a challenge in a world of instant gratification. The more children we can reach, the more value will be brought to the arts, to health, fitness and community. Our world is hungry for it and our kids deserve it.  MOTH's program provides a true community for Denver's Youth. Through our performance troupe, MOTH Contemporary Youth Circus, more children will experience the joy of circus, even if they don't want to directly participate. 
Circus is Universal! It is for everyone!    Other Ways You Can Help We truly appreciate any and all help and understand that not everyone can make a monetary contribution. If you believe in what we are doing and would like to help in other ways, we would be ever so grateful.  SHARE, SHARE, SHARE this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, networking groups etc. Indiegogo provides share tools that you can directly share to all of your social media networks.
Volunteer! We'd love to have you as a part of the MOTH Community. We could use help passing out flyers, making phone calls, ushering at shows, and lots of other fun and creative projects around our MOTH warehouse. 
Come to our shows! Our next show is called Metamorpheus: Dreamers Often Fly, and is the Professional Training Program's culmination show on May 20th at The Denver Performing Arts Complex. Details at www.contemporarycircuscenter.com
 
  Thank you all, from the bottom of our M.O.T.Hearts!

story:
INSIDE LIGHT is a documentary photography project for children and young people all over the world who find themselves in adverse conditions and living situations. The aim of Inside Light is to enable young people to find hope in their environments by engaging them in moments of positivity, often overlooked by the mainstream media.

We believe that by stimulating young people in tough living situations to find sparks of optimism in their surroundings, we can help them cultivate hope and confidence. That's why we created Inside Light, a photography project where young people are taught to use a camera and capture their own moment of positivity.

 

 

The Inside Light concept has strength in its simplicity. Each child or young person taking part in Inside Light becomes a 'Light Activist' and is given a compact, disposable, 35mm film camera in conjunction with workshops facilitated by professional photographers.

The process is simple: The children need to take photos of positive situations, return the cameras for developing and printing, and then explain what motivated them to create their pictures and why it is a positive image for them. 

This process is repeated several times with the same group, to enhance a change of perspective. For the young people, it is an opportunity to engage with their environments in more positive ways. 

The first pilot project was on Lesvos, an island in Greece which is at the forefront of the European refugee crisis. Over 550,000 refugees from Syria, Iraq, Turkey, Afghanistan and other countries have passed through Lesvos in the last eight months. 

Due to the lack of volunteer access to the Moria camp, children and young people have been attending workshops through the fence that surrounds the camp. Children have been given their cameras, have attended stage one of the project and returned their cameras for developing and discussion. 

The professional photographers will also document the context of the situation – the 'story behind the story' of the young people – so the final work tells a bigger story, complementing both viewpoints, from inside and from outside, of the child and the photographer. 

 

 

The objective of this campaign is to raise money to replicate the project in various parts of the world with children in adverse situations.

 

We need the money to:

1) Buy cameras

2) Cover the cost of photo development

3) Travel expenses for photographers

4) Cover the cost of exhibitions, where the photos will be presented and sold to raise more funds to self-finance the project in other parts of the world. 

5) Pay for a photobook and postcards that will be sold for the same purpose, generating funds used to improve the living conditions of children who participate in the project.

 

We are looking for any form of help – support, sponsors, donation of cameras or even just spreading the word.

Please contact us with any questions: insidelightproject@gmail.com

 

 

 

 

Inside Light was created and founded by Sebastian Gil Miranda, Oliver Zimmermann and Sevilay Maria Van Dorst. 

The project is open to receive proposals from photographers from around the world.

story:
About Us 

We are a group of Syrian poets and musicians collaborating with visual artists to present poetry as a multi-sensory experience; readings and art with musical accompaniment. The multifaceted nature of this experience invites all three creative forms to transcend imposed creative boundaries and offer new experiential nuances. All poems selected for this project are written in Arabic and translated into English.

About The Project

The word "ta'sheeq" تعشيق means dovetail in Arabic. In this project, poets, musicians and artists are collaborating and merging their passions to recreate and present poetry in a different way. 

As a proof of concept, we launched Ta'sheeq in Boston in May 2016. The event was very well received. In the debut event, poets Hussam Jefee and Alma Nizam, accompanied by violinist Samer Ali, and works by visual artist Tammam Azzam, were all present to create a new sensory experience. 

Visit ta'sheeq website for more information, future events, and updates on this project.

(Tammam Azzam - 'Starving’)


The featured video in this campaign page presents excerpts from our debut event.  

The dialogue between Syrian poetry and Syrian arts:

  • Defies the war.
  • Is Syria's chance to survive.
  • Will collectively advance more engaged and informed conversations about Syria; conversation inspired and led by artists.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • Donations will help sustain the project. 
  • Purchase audio-visual projection technology.
  • Will allow the project to tour the US and beyond.
  • Invite/collaborate with Syrian musicians and artists around the globe. 
  • Embark on a huge undertake to produce and publish our poetry, art, and musical work in augmented-reality forms. 
  • Output would include a printed book, an e-book, a multimedia book with augmented reality features, a CD/DVD, and more.  
  • In return you will receive a wide variety of perks as our "Thank you". Look at the list of our amazing perks. 
Even modest donations go a long way to ensure ta'sheeq is sustainable and offers a wide variety of Syrian artists opportunity to particpate. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Getting people excited about poetry is tough nowadays. We realize that!
  • We hope that the experiential aspect of our project will mitigate this.
  • The multi-sensory environment we create, will invite people to experience poetry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not back the project by money, that's absolutely fine, we understand. You can support by:

  • Spreading the word about our project. 
  • Share with your friends and family, and colleagues who might be interested. 
  • Share on Facebook, twitter, and other social media platforms. 

And that's all there is to it.

Collaborating Artists (names in no particular order):

Poets 

  • Akram Alkatreb
  • Firas Sulaiman
  • Janset Ali
  • Alma Nizam
  • Fadi Saad
  • Osama Esber
  • Hussam Jefee
Musicians:

  • Samer Ali
  • Lukman Ahmad
  • Hussam Jefee
Visual Artists:

  • Kevork Mourad
  • Tammam Azzam
  • Lukman Ahmad
  • Zaina Salem
Poetry translation:

  • Samantha Kostmyer Sulaiman
Vital team members:

  • Mai Taha
  • Rami Hammour

story:
We want to create the ultimate immersive Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality experience for your children.

Kids love colouring books. They also love using tablets and Smartphones.

It's amazing how much you can learn when you're having fun. As a world's first, at Mardles, we're combining the latest AR and VR technology to bring our new range of educational colouring books to life!

Parents love to see their kids having fun and learning at the same time. It's also important that any apps kids are using are 100% safe. Once you've installed our app there is no internet connection required, no registration and best of all, there are no in-app purchases. It's what we would expect as parents ourselves.

The Mardles discovAR concept is simple.

1) Use your favourite pens, pencils or paints to colour in a scene.

2) Open our free app on your tablet or smart phone (Apple, Android or Amazon)

3) Customise an alien character in our free app

4) Hold your device over your colouring page and watch it magically animate before your eyes using the exact colours you chose!

We're also creating a set of 6 pocket sized 'Action Cards' so that kids can bring their character to life wherever they go. Each card will make your alien animate in 3D and complete a task, e.g brushing it's teeth, having a healthy snack or rocking some dance moves!

Virtual Reality

Press the 'VR' icon to explore your colouring scene in virtual reality. You'll be looking through the eyes of your alien and by moving your device, you'll be able to see your picture in 3D in the exact colours you chose. 

Use the arrows on screen to move your customised alien character. Using our advanced locking technology, you can move your alien away from the action card and have him walking around your room at home. This is just 1 of the things that makes us different from the rest.

Use discovAR anywhere

Once you have installed the discovAR app, you no longer need an internet connection to use it (don't worry, it won't clog up all your memory!). Ideal for taking a colouring book to grandma's house or using the Action Cards in the car, on holiday or wherever your imagination takes you! 

A British success story

Mardles have been created by James and Sharon and their UK based team! Our designers, animators, developers and printers are as excited as we are to bring these products to market. 

Sharon first saw this technology when it was used in a furniture brochure in 2014, she spoke to her geeky friend James and they conceived the idea of Mardles - products that come to life with a free app. 

They launched their stickers that come to life in 2015 and have enjoyed global success with over 200,000 packs sold. 

Technology moves fast and the Mardles team like to keep one step ahead of the game. That's why they have pushed the boundaries of what is possible to create something truly magical for children that also helps them learn at the same time.

If you feel as passionate about learning through play as we do, keep your eyes peeled for our future projects. We are dedicated to launching even more educational tech based products for kids.

Pledge your support today and you will be enjoying one of our magical colouring books in just a few months' time.

For press and media enquiries or interviews with James and Sharon, email: jw@bootstrappedpr.com

Risks and challenges

The Mardles discovAR project is already underway thanks to the success of Mardles stickers, however, with Indiegogo funding we'll have these 4 colouring books on their way to you in just a few months.

Funding will be used to complete our designs, animations, visual effects, translations and sound recording, publish the app, as well as to produce stock.

If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal, we will be able to launch more books, more fun and more facts!

story:
Building The First Individual & Corporate Diversity Learning Lab

I'm Jennifer Gilhool and I've spent more than 25 years swinging from place to place on the corporate jungle gym on my way to serving as a the first-ever director for the sustainability and regulatory function in Asia Pacific & Africa for a Fortune 50 company. I get it.

When you are woman or a minority, you aren't climbing the same corporate ladder as your "dominant culture" colleagues -- aka white men. Hey, I love men. I'm married to one and am raising another. But, neither my husband nor my son navigates the world in the same way that my daughters or I do. And, I don't navigate the world in quite the same way as a woman of color or an Asian man. I also don't see or solve problems, evaluate risks or opportunities in the same way either. We all approach our life and our work from a combination of our heritage and our experiences.

My experiences include being the eldest daughter in a traditional large Irish family, serving as a public interest lawyer on behalf of individuals at risk of domestic violence, representing corporate clients and individuals in a variety of litigated matters, working for a Fortune 50 company, and eventually moving my family of three children, one dog, and one husband to Shanghai, China for nearly three years and burning out. 

I call myself a recovering anxiety-ridden workaholic. I wrote a book about my experience navigating the corporate jungle gym in Shanghai, China with my family -- a real life lean-in story -- called Sheryl Sandberg, China & Me. And, that book led me to think bigger.

If I burned out on my way to the coveted position of corporate officer, who wouldn't? There must be a better way. And, there is. It starts by creating a better, more diverse, and authentically inclusive work culture. It doesn't stop there, however, Culture must be nurtured, measured, and adjusted to meet the needs of a changing world.

Our world is changing fast. Today, Millennials are the dominant generation in the workforce and they don't work in the same way as the formerly dominant Baby Boom generation. Indeed, the lives of Baby Boomers and Millennials are vastly different. And, thus, the fundamentals of work -- the way we work, how we work together, where we work, and how we develop and support leaders must change too.

That is exactly what we do at the Gender Economics Lab. We focus on people, culture, and organization. The most important resources of any enterprise.

 How are we helping to change the world of work? Read on to find out!

The Project 

Empathy is the essential skill for the 21st century. Whether you are an educator, a manager, a C-Suite executive, or a world leader, you need the ability to understand and share the experiences and feelings of others, particularly those who are different from you. Our cultural learning lab is designed to help professionals increase their cultural awareness, build their cultural competency skills while also building their management and leadership skills.

Our content is unique. Based in research and tailored to meet the needs of the busy professional our content is:

  • Accessible -- available live and on-demand in digestible pieces that easily fit into your coffee break
  • Actionable -- strategies, tactics, workbooks, checklists along with tips and conversation rituals that you can put into practice immediately
  • Authentic -- we take the latest research and turn it into actionable solutions that work for you. We know because we've navigated the dominant culture and as member of the non-dominant culture too
Our user community will have access to virtual coaching, interviews, live and on-demand webinars, and more. Most of our content is designed to be viewed in under 15 minutes -- over a cup of coffee -- and immediately actionable. And, you can always get more information if you want it because we provide links and downloads of the research supporting our programming. If you still want more information, you can send us your questions.

We need your help to bring our content to life.

We have dozens of videos in the vault waiting to be edited and uploaded. We've tackled the most talked about and the most relevant topics first;

  • Unconscious bias, 
  • Performance assessment and talent management bias
  • Personal leadership and career planning
  • Professional leadership development
  • The art of difficult conversations, and more.  
Our programming isn't passive - it's compelling, engaging, and interactive. Through polling questions, we monitor developing trends in the workplace and develop our programming based on our user community's needs, keeping our content relevant and relatable. During scheduled webinars, our user community can communicate not only with the host but with each other through Twitter and other tools.

Today's workforce craves development. And, with the changing demographics of work and the failure of conventional diversity compliance training to develop cultural awareness and cultural management skills, a new approach is needed. 
GEL's interactive learning lab makes understanding the diverse experiences of the workforce accessible to virtually every member of the workforce. Our training modules are specifically designed to help our user community connect with the "characters" in our series and experience the workplace through the eyes of their diverse colleagues. Seeing and feeling the experience is far more powerful than reading a corporate diversity study or sitting through compliance-based training.

Watch a beta video today! And, help us populate the learning lab with more. 

We've gone as far as we can our own. Now, we need your help to complete the editing and post-production on nearly thirty (30) pre-recorded virtual coaching sessions and to hire staff to work with our platform provider and deliver the final product to you. We have our first training series scripted. Your donations will help us hire the film crew, create the supporting content, and complete the post-production work to offer this revolutionary cultural awareness and diversity training to our user community.

Our Content Sets Us Apart! Don't Take Our Word For It, Listen to What Our Pilot Partners Have to Say!

You don't have to take our word, listen to what members of the MBA Class of 2016 from the  University of Michigan's Stephen M. Ross School of Business have to say about participating in our pilot program on creating gender equity allies at and beyond business school. 

No matter what level you choose to donate, your donation brings to life the most affordable career development and coaching program available on the market. With our ability to create interactive programming, capture live events and replay play them on-demand, we are revolutionizing the way we talk about and approach diversity in virtually any setting fro universities to corporations to government agencies.  

Executive coaching costs as much as 10% of a C-Suite executives salary, For a C-Suite executive earning just $250,000 annually, the cost is $25,000 for a single coach for a year. Our interactive learning lab allows us to provide diversity and career coaching for a fraction of that cost. Every dollar you invest in developing your diversity, management, and leadership skills, is an investment in yourself, your earnings future, and your growth potential.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a monetary contribution, you can still help by:

  • Getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Share our link on social media, your Facebook page, on Tumbler, and wherever you interact with the world. 
  • Invite your colleagues and friends to become Lab Members. You can get a discounted annual Lab Membership through a $500 donation here or sign up on our webpage.  

THANK YOU!!

Seeing and feeling the experience is far more powerful than reading a corporate diversity study or sitting through compliance-based training.



Watch a beta video today! And, help us populate the learning lab with more. 

We've gone as far as we can our own. Now, we need your help to complete the editing and post-production on nearly thirty (30) pre-recorded virtual coaching sessions and to hire staff to work with our platform provider and deliver the final product to you. We have our first training series scripted. Your donations will help us hire the film crew, create the supporting content, and complete the post-production work to offer this revolutionary cultural awareness and diversity training to our user community.
Our Content Sets Us Apart! Don't Take Our Word For It, Listen to What Our Pilot Partners Have to Say!

You don't have to take our word, listen to what members of the MBA Class of 2016 from the  University of Michigan's Stephen M. Ross School of Business have to say about participating in our pilot program on creating gender equity allies at and beyond business school. 
No matter what level you choose to donate, your donation brings to life the most affordable career development and coaching program available on the market. With our ability to create interactive programming, capture live events and replay play them on-demand, we are revolutionizing the way we talk about and approach diversity in virtually any setting fro universities to corporations to government agencies.  
Executive coaching costs as much as 10% of a C-Suite executives salary, For a C-Suite executive earning just $250,000 annually, the cost is $25,000 for a single coach for a year. Our interactive learning lab allows us to provide diversity and career coaching for a fraction of that cost. Every dollar you invest in developing your diversity, management, and leadership skills, is an investment in yourself, your earnings future, and your growth potential.


    
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can't make a monetary contribution, you can still help by:  Getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. Share our link on social media, your Facebook page, on Tumbler, and wherever you interact with the world. 
Invite your colleagues and friends to become Lab Members. You can get a discounted annual Lab Membership through a $500 donation here or sign up on our webpage.     THANK YOU!!

story:
The Very Quiet Studio

  • The Very Quiet Studio is established by Ng, Wei Chin. Other works include book publications, a social project on mental health, film & audio production works. 

  • In collaboration with concerned artists from different parts of the world, who also find value Asian stories and music. 

  • Our first CD Story Kasina was launched February 2015
  • We would like to continue and expand this work to develop two more CDs with your support.

    Vision and Intent 

    PHASE I :

    In the first phase production, stories will be read in English and recorded.  These recordings will be combined with choreographed musical composition for accompaniment and sound effect in a final multi-soundtracks mixing.

    PHASE II :

    The 2nd phase of development extends the Phase I concept to other stories in another language of Asia. These stories will be recorded in both its original language or in an English translation, or both. 

    PHASE III :

    The 3rd phase will extend the reach of sound sanna works for distribution through new media or into classroom

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of 1st CD production was substantially reduced due to extensive support in kind, andpro bono work from participants who trusted in the project.  However to sustain production in future, we seek your support to pay for 

  • Vocal Artists, Musicians, Engineers, Story Researchers, Writers, Audio Recording, Production Space, Travel, Producer's Fee etc
  • For each contribution of US$200 to this culture-value-preservation work, a complimentary CD compilation of the final works will be mailed to you to thank you for your kind support.  There are other perks with higher contribution levels. See perks.

  • Our work will proceed one story at a time as funds become available, until a full CD repertoire can be produced. We humbly ask for your patience and trust as you wait to see your contribution bear fruit, as production timelines may be compromised due to lack of funds. 

Artistic Motivation & Intent

  • Why the Urgency?       

    A collection of Asian stories, blending in Asian musical styles and music instruments, will help preserve Asian cultural heritage and revive the wisdom of Asian arts and culture, and help guard against the erosion of our ability to sense our inner wisdom and help us reclaim access to our inner wisdom.

  • Inaugural CD took six years by independent work

    The Sound Sañña Asian Story Project idea was hatched in mid 2008, with the aim of preserving valuable stories in Asia for those with the least accessibility to high end technology and who are yet appreciative of simple modern conveniences that can feed our imagination in subtle ways. Funding contributions will be of great help in fulfilling the goal of preserving valuable stories in Asia for those countries under the greatest impact of social changes and economical development.

  • Story kasina CD was first introduced at the 6th World Parliament of Religions at Salt Lake City, Oct 2015.

    The choice of ancient Buddhism stories was spurred by the widespread influence of Buddhist culture and practice on many Asian cultures. The forthcoming CD would retain similar spiritual stakes and wisdom regardless.  While the stories may show the imprint of religious practice, we present them as an offering that transcends religious boundaries.

Risks & Challenges

  • The stories selected may be religious or spiritual, miniature or extensive, allegorical or realistic, historical or contemporary. The selection criteria  for the stories are largely intuitive, and seek to incorporate a long term vision.  Therefore they may show little or no obvious mass appeal and may not adhere to typical social norms.
  • As far as possible, we will retrace each story to its source. This means that the selection and reconstruction of these stories demands a pool of talent from whom intensive work and extensive understanding is required. We shall conduct polling to the final choices of stories, and allow for reworks without pressure of time. It is thus important to ensure  freedom from time pressures as the stories are  reworked.  We shall conduct polling to determine the final choice of stories.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are also seeking story researchers, stories, storytellers,  musicians, sound engineers, designers, marketers, who would like to contribute to our vision of helping to guard against the fast erosion of wisdom and culture in Asia, and setting the stage for it to bloom or boom in the near future.
  • Please kindly help to spread this crowdfunding idea to people whom you think will support us in funds. Thank you!
