story:
Update as of July 5th, 2016

Our Midwest Book Tour Crowdfunding campaign is over. If you'd like to make a donation to see more events happen you may so at our website here:  http://artesinmiedo.net/bios/ (donate button at the bottom of the page)

If you'd like to purchase a copy of the book you can do so using this link: http://artesinmiedo.net/get-the-book/

Thank You to everyone who supported our efforts to share this book with the Midwest! Wrap up reports and photos from Ann Arbor & Cleveland coming soon in the updates section!

Short Summary

Women Street Artists of Latin America; Art Without Fear is a book about female street artists in Latin America. It includes interviews in English and Spanish as well as portraits of the artists and photographs of their artwork. There is only one other book in the world dedicated to women making street art or graffiti so we wanted to focus on the stories behind these women. What motivates them? What is it like to work inside a male dominated art form? Why at times do they take great risk to make art? What impact do they hope to make on the world?

Rachel and I, the creators of the book, spent 9 months traveling in Latin America interviewing and photographing these artists. We have spent the last four years working to publish this book and the final stop of the project is sharing it with as many people as possible via a book tour.

By donating to our project you are helping shed light on these women, their stories, and the impact art can have on a community. You will also be funding creative experiences for our midwest audience members in the form of stencil making workshops and art pop ups in city centers (more on this later but it includes renegade chalk take overs of sidewalks).


What We Need 

Our biggest expense is covering travel costs. We have been footing the bill for our events in the San Francisco Bay Area and California but the Midwest is a little bigger and a bit further away.

What your donation will help fund:

  • Travel Costs (Airfare for two, a car rental, gas, insurance)
  • Art Supplies for stencil making workshops (Exacto knives, stencil transparency film, paint, paper, brushes)
  • Art supplies for Pop Up Chalk Stencils in multiple city centers (cornstarch, tempera paint, spray bottles, stencil making supplies)
  • Publicity efforts (posters, fliers, and one sign to hang at every event)
  • A few items to help document along the way (Rhode SmartLav Microphone, tripod, and if we surpass our goal maybe even a portable projector)
  • Help fulfilling the perks to send to you, our beautiful supporters.

What You Get

Besides that warm feeling of knowing you supported the arts; we are offering a variety of perks to say thank you for your donation.

Our featured perk, for $75, is a 4 color screen printed tote bag featuring the geographical scope of where we traveled and met artists. 


Other perks include a set of 4 postcards ($40) or an 11x14  image from the book. ($60) 


A fun reward we are offering at the$50 level is a street art kit which includes a paintbrush, a small bag of flour, our tried and true recipe for making wheat paste and a permanent marking crayon. (*wheat paste = a strong glue used to attach posters to the wall)


At the $100 level we are offering a wacky return from our first crowdfunding campaign. Your face integrated onto the animal of your choice, wheat pasted onto the free wall in San Francisco. We'll send you a photo of the complete animal queendom. 

     

(example on a dumpster in Indiana :)

Our higher tickets items are more experiential! 

Donate $200 and you can schedule a Skype session with Lauren Gucik. She's ready for you to pick her brain about independent & self publishing projects or street art.  (Includes a signed copy of the book)

For people in the Bay Area, a $300 donation will get you and three friends a  Mural and Street Art walking tour of the SOMA & Tenderloin neighborhoods. (Includes a signed copy of the book)

Donate $1,000 and Rachel and Lauren will facilitate a mural for you and your friends or co-workers in any legal location of your choosing! (Includes a signed copy of the book)

If you'd like your donation to fulfill our entire goal, $5,000, we will plan you a 4day/3night adventure in a city of your choosing from our book complete with a street art tour from a  local expert! (Includes a signed copy of the book)

What About the Book!

Unfortunately, we are unable to offer the book as a reward. But with any donation, we will send you a coupon code to use at our website for a 10% discount on the book. (please buy a book. You won't regret it!)

The Impact

"Women have to endure quite a number of limits on things they are not allowed to do. Doing graffiti seems like a revolutionary way to demonstrate there’s no limit to what we can accomplish. The more people see women painting in the streets, the more they see that we can do this." - Mishap, Arte sin Miedo

5 years ago, Rachel and I noticed a lack of representation of women in print and online media about street art and graffiti. As women street artists we were interested in finding other women to connect with. What we found was an incredibly diverse group of women making art for a variety of reasons against all odds. 

When people do not see themselves reflected back in the images of their role models it is hard for them to imagine themselves in those places. We hope that our book will help young women understand that even if a field is dominated by men it is more than alright to pursue it. We want young women, and people of all genders to see what is possible for themselves. We think it is important to share these stories as widely as possible and your donation will help make that happen.

Your donation goes towards the book tour. Our hope is that all profits made from book sales can be given back to the women in the book to fund mural projects with kids or that have a social justice theme. They more money we raise here, the more money goes back to the artists!

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know anyone in the Midwest who you think might be interested in hosting a presentation about our project? (We are still booking events into the calendar)

Do you know anyone who might be interested in letting us stay on their couch in the Midwest? 

Do you know any women street artists or groups working for social change through arts and education? Connect us!

And as always please share our campaign with people in your community!

A Final Note!

Thank you for your time. Thank You for Your Support! 

If you're in the Midwest or California, come get book tour-tastic with us!

For more information on the book and the artists inside check out our website.
